en: The former treatise I made, O Theophilus, concerning all that Jesus began both to do and to teach,
hmr: Theophil, kha hmaa lekhaa khan, Isu thilthaw le a închûktir phut lai thu po po kha ka ziek a nih;

en: until the day in which he was received up, after that he had given commandment through the Holy Spirit unto the apostles whom he had chosen:
hmr: Thlarau Inthieng ṭhangpuia a tirko thlanghai kuoma thu a tiem zoa, vân tienga ṭhuoia a um ni chena thu kha.

en: to whom he also showed himself alive after his passion by many proofs, appearing unto them by the space of forty days, and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of God:
hmr: Chu tirkohai kuoma chun rinum chu a tuor hnungin inhriettirna tam- takin hringin ân entir a, ni sâwmli zet an kuomah ân lâr a, Pathien ram thu a hril hlak.

en: and, being assembled together with them, he charged them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which, said he, ye heard from me:
hmr: Chun, an umkhâwm dâm a pâwl veh a, “Jerusalem fe san naw ro, Pathien thiltiem ka hril in hriet kha lo nghâk ro,” a ti tlat a.

en: for John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days hence.
hmr: “Johan khan tuiin a baptis hlak a, nisienlakhawm, ni sâwtnawtêah Thlarau Inthiengin baptisma chang in tih,” a ta.

en: They therefore, when they were come together, asked him, saying, Lord, dost thou at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?
hmr: Chun, anni chun an hung inkhâwmin a kuomah, “Lalpa, tuhin am a ni Israelhai kuoma ram i pêk nâwk ding?” an ta, an indawn a.

en: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know times or seasons, which the Father hath set within his own authority.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Pain a hun le a ni ama thu thua um dinga a ruot chu nangni lo hriet ding a ni nawh ie.

en: But ye shall receive power, when the Holy Spirit is come upon you: and ye shall be my witnesses both in Jerusalem, and in all Judæa and Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Thlarau In- thieng chu in chungah a hung tlung pha leh thilthawtheina la nei in tih; chuongchun, Jerusalema dâm, Judai le Samari ram khaw tina dâm, kâwlkawdawng chenin ka thu hretuhai nîng in tih,” a ta.

en: And when he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu a hril zoin an hmu zing pumin, vân tienga ṭhuoiin a um a; chun, sûmin an hmu phâk nawah a ṭhuoi hmang tah a.

en: And while they were looking stedfastly into heaven as he went, behold two men stood by them in white apparel;
hmr: Chun, a hang fe laia vân tieng an en zing laiin, mi pahni puon vâr silin an kâwlah an hung ngîr a.

en: who also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye looking into heaven? this Jesus, who was received up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye beheld him going into heaven.
hmr: Chuonghai chun, “Galili rama mihai, iengdinga vân tieng nghaa in ngir am? Hi Isu in kuoma inthawka vân tienga ṭhuoia um hi, vâna a hang fe in hmu ang bawk hin ama ngei hi hung nâwk a tih,” an ta.

en: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is nigh unto Jerusalem, a sabbath day’s journey off.
hmr: Chun, Oliv tlâng an tia inthawk chun Jerusalemah an kîr nâwk tah a; chu tlâng chu Jerusalem kâwl a nih. Châwlnia lêngna tâwk chau a nih.

en: And when they were come in, they went up into the upper chamber, where they were abiding; both Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphæus, and Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
hmr: Chun, an lûtin an umna pindan chunghnunga chun an hang feh a Peter le Johan leh, Jakob le Andri leh, Philip le Thoma leh, Bartholomai le Matthai leh, Alphai naupa Jakob leh, Simon Zelot pâwla mi le Jakob naupa Juda leh an nih.

en: These all with one accord continued stedfastly in prayer, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.
hmr: Chuonghai po po chun nuhmei tuhai amani le Isu nu Mari leh, Isu unauhai leh, lungril hmunkhata ṭhahnemngaitaka ṭawngṭaiin an um a.

en: And in these days Peter stood up in the midst of the brethren, and said (and there was a multitude of persons gathered together, about a hundred and twenty),
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun unauhai lai Peter a ngîr a, (an rêng chun za le sâwmhni lai an nih),

en: Brethren, it was needful that the scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spake before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to them that took Jesus.
hmr: “Unauhai, Thlarau Inthiengin, David baua, Isu mantuhai ṭhuoitu Juda thu a hrillâwk kha, kha Pathien Lekha Thu kha hung tlung ding a ni hrim a nih.

en: For he was numbered among us, and received his portion in this ministry.
hmr: Ama chu eini laia tiemsa a na, hieng rawngbâwlnaa hin chan khawm a nei ve sih a.

en: (Now this man obtained a field with the reward of his iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.
hmr: (Chun, ama chun a suol manin hmun pakhat ân chawk a, a bawkkhupin a tlah a, a laiah a puok kawi a, a rîl po po a suok vawng a.

en: And it became known to all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch that in their language that field was called Akeldama, that is, The field of blood.)
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu Jerusalema umhai po poin an lo hriet a; chuongchun, chu hmun chu anni ṭawngin, ‘Akeldama,’ an tih a, chu chu, ‘Thisen hmun,’ tina a nih.)

en: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be made desolate, And let no man dwell therein: and, His office let another take.
hmr: Inpâkna Hla Buah hi thu hi ziek a nih:- ‘A umna sukramin um raw se A sûngah tukhawm um naw raw se,’ ti le, ‘A hotu nîna chu mi dangin chang raw se,’ ti hi.

en: Of the men therefore that have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and went out among us,
hmr: “Chuongchun, Lal Isu eini laia lût hlak, suok hlaka a um sûng po a,

en: beginning from the baptism of John, unto the day that he was received up from us, of these must one become a witness with us of his resurrection.
hmr: Johan Baptisma chena in- thawka ei kuoma inthawka vâna ṭhuoia a um ni chen kha - hieng a mi pâwl hlakhai laia mi pakhat, a thonâwkna mi hrietpuitu dingin a um ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And they put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
hmr: Chun, mi pahni an ruot a, pakhat chu Josef Barsabba an ti chu, (a hming dang Justa an ti bawk a). Chun, pakhat chu Matthia a nih.

en: And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, who knowest the hearts of all men, show of these two the one whom thou hast chosen,
hmr: Chun, an ṭawngṭai a, “Lalpa, Nang mihriem po po lungril hretu, hienghai hi a tu lem am i thlang mîn hriettir la;

en: to take the place in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.
hmr: Juda chun ama umnaa a fe theina dinga hieng rawngbâwlna le tirko sin a tlâwmsan ai awtu dingin,” an ta.

en: And they gave lots for them; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
hmr: Chun, ai an sânpêk a, an aisân chu Matthia chungah a tlu a. Chuongchun, ama chu tirko sâwm le pakhat hai lai chun tiemsa a ni tah a.

en: Now there was a certain man in Cæsarea, Cornelius by name, a centurion of the band called the Italian band,
hmr: Chun, Kaisari khuoah a hming Korneli mi pakhat a um a; Itali pâwl an ti, chu pâwla sipai za hotu a nih.

en: a devout man, and one that feared God with all his house, who gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God always.
hmr: Pathien ngaisak mi a na, a sûnghai po po leh Pathien an ṭi hlak a; mihai kuomah thil tamtak a pêk hlak a, Pathien kuoma khawm an ṭawngṭai rawp a.

en: He saw in a vision openly, as it were about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming in unto him, and saying to him, Cornelius.
hmr: Ama chun chawhnung inher hin, mang angin fietakin Pathien vântir- ko pakhat a kuoma lûta, “Korneli,” tiin a hmuh a.

en: And he, fastening his eyes upon him, and being affrighted, said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are gone up for a memorial before God.
hmr: Chun, Korneli chun ama chu a lo en zing a, a ṭih a, “Lalpa, ieng am a na?” a ta. Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “I ṭawngṭainahai le i thil pêk thuhai kha hriet zing dingin Pathien hmaah a hang tlung tah.

en: And now send men to Joppa, and fetch one Simon, who is surnamed Peter:
hmr: Tuhin Joppa khuoah mihai tir la, mi pakhat Simon Peter an ti chu, hang inṭhuoitir rawh.

en: he lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side.
hmr: Savun siemtu Simon kuoma tlung a nih, a in chu tuisuoriet pangah a um,” a ta.

en: And when the angel that spake unto him was departed, he called two of his household-servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;
hmr: Chun, vântirko a betu chu a fe phingleh, Korneli chun, a siehlawhai laia mi pahni le a rawngbâwl rawphai laia Pathien ngaisak sipai pakhat a ko a;

en: and having rehearsed all things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
hmr: chun, thu po po chu an kuoma a hril zoin Joppa khuoa chun a tir tah a.

en: Now on the morrow, as they were on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray, about the sixth hour:
hmr: Chun, a zînga an fe laia khaw kâwl an tlung laiin, Peter chu ṭawngṭai dingin, sûnbu fâk hun laiin, in chungah a hang lawn a.

en: and he became hungry, and desired to eat: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance;
hmr: Chun a phîng a hung ṭâm a, bu fâk a nuom tah a; nisienlakhawm, fâk ding an siem lai chun zêlin a um tah a.

en: and he beholdeth the heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending, as it were a great sheet, let down by four corners upon the earth:
hmr: Vân inhawngin, iengkhat bâwm puon lientak ang, a ki palia khita, hnuoiah inkhaithlain a hmuh a.

en: wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts and creeping things of the earth and birds of the heaven.
hmr: Chu sûnga chun sapheimanli- hai le, thilhring le chunga vate tinrênghai an um a.

en: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill and eat.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah rawlin, “Peter tho rawh; that la fa rawh,” a hung tih a.

en: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common and unclean.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peter chun, “Lalpa, ni lo e; thiengnaw le, inthiengnaw iengkhawm ka fâk ngai nawh ie,” a ta.

en: And a voice came unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, make not thou common.
hmr: Chun, rawl chun vawihninaah, “Pathienin a sukthieng ta chu nangin thiengnaw ti naw rawh,” a ta.

en: And this was done thrice: and straightway the vessel was received up into heaven.
hmr: Chuong ang ruok chun, vawi thum a hung um a; chun, bâwm chu vâ- na zuk khaiin a um nâwk nghâl tah a.

en: Now while Peter was much perplexed in himself what the vision which he had seen might mean, behold, the men that were sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for Simon’s house, stood before the gate,
hmr: Chun, Peterin mang anga a hmu chu a ngaina hre loa a lunginzîng laiin, Korneli mi tirhai chun Simon in chu an lo indawn suok tah a, kawtkhâr bulah an lo ngîr a,

en: and called and asked whether Simon, who was surnamed Peter, were lodging there.
hmr: an khêk a, Simon, Peter an ti chu, chutaka chun a tlung le tlung naw an indawn a.

en: And while Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
hmr: Chun, Peterin a mang thu chu a ngaituo laiin, Thlarauin a kuomah, “Ngai ta, mi pathumin an zawng che.

en: But arise, and get thee down, and go with them, nothing doubting: for I have sent them.
hmr: Chuongchun, tho la, ṭum la, iengkhawm ringhla loin anni zui rawh; anni chu ka itir an nih,” a ta.

en: And Peter went down to the men, and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?
hmr: Chuongchun, Peter chu chuhai kâwla chun a ṭum a, an kuomah, “In izawng hi ka nih; ieng am in hungna san?” a ta.

en: And they said, Cornelius a centurion, a righteous man and one that feareth God, and well reported of by all the nation of the Jews, was warned of God by a holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words from thee.
hmr: Anni chun, “Vântirko inthieng pakhatin, Korneli, sipai za hotu mi feltak, Pathien ṭi Juda hnam po pohai khawma an ingaisâng kuoma chun, i thu hril a hrietna dingin, a inah nang ko ding chein a hril a nih,” an ta.

en: So he called them in and lodged them. And on the morrow he arose and went forth with them, and certain of the brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
hmr: Chuongchun, mihai chu a ko lût a, ân riek tir tah a. A zînga chun Peter chu a tho a, an kuomah a feh a, Joppa khuoa mi unau tuhai amani khawm anni leh an fe veh a.

en: And on the morrow they entered into Cæsarea. And Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his kinsmen and his near friends.
hmr: Chun, a zing nâwk chun Kaisari khuoa chun an lût tah a. Chun, Korneli chun a laibunghai le a ruol dittakhai a ko khâwm a, anni chu a lo nghâk zing a.

en: And when it came to pass that Peter entered, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
hmr: Chun, Peter chu a lût ding lai takin Korneli chun a lo tuok a, a ke bulah a bawkkhup a, Pathien chibai bûk angin a bûk a.

en: But Peter raised him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peterin ama chu a keitho a, “Ngîr rawh, kei khawm mihriem ka ni hi,” a ta.

en: And as he talked with him, he went in, and findeth many come together:
hmr: Chun, a kâwla thu hril pumin a lût a, mi tamtak umkhâwm chu a va hmuh a.

en: and he said unto them, Ye yourselves know how it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to join himself or come unto one of another nation; and yet unto me hath God showed that I should not call any man common or unclean:
hmr: An kuomah, “Juda mîn hnam dang kuoma fe le pâwl a thieng nawzie nangnîn in hriet a nih; nisienlakhawm, tukhawm thiengnaw le inthiengnaw ka ti ding an nawh ti Pathienin a mîn hriettir a nih.

en: wherefore also I came without gainsaying, when I was sent for. I ask therefore with what intent ye sent for me.
hmr: Chuleiin, in mi hung ko phingle khan sêl loin ka hung a ni hi. Chuongchun, kân dawn cheu, ieng am a na in mi hung ko san?” a ta.

en: And Cornelius said, Four days ago, until this hour, I was keeping the ninth hour of prayer in my house; and behold, a man stood before me in bright apparel,
hmr: Chun, Korneli chun, “Ni li a ni tah, tu phâ ang chen hin, ka inah, chawhnung inher ṭawngṭainaah ka ṭawngṭai a; chun, ngai ta, mi pakhat puon vârtak silin ka hmaah a hung ngîr a,

en: and saith, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
hmr: ‘Korneli, i ṭawngṭaina kha hrietin a um tah, mi kuoma i thilpêkhai khawm kha Pathienin a hriet zing ie.

en: Send therefore to Joppa, and call unto thee Simon, who is surnamed Peter; he lodgeth in the house of Simon a tanner, by the sea side.
hmr: Chuleiin, Joppa khuoah mi tir la, Simon Peter an ti chu, i kuomah ko rawh, ama chu tuisuoriet panga savun siemtu Simon ina tlung a nih,’ a ta.

en: Forthwith therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God, to hear all things that have been commanded thee of the Lord.
hmr: Chuleiin, i kuomah mi ka hung tir nghâl tah a nih; i hung hi a ṭha ie. Chuongchun, Lalpain thu a pêk taphawt che hre dingin tuhin Pathien mithmuin kan rêngin hitaka hin kan um a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
hmr: Peter chun a hril a;— “Pathienin mi ditsak bîk a nei nawh ti indiktakin ka hriet;

en: but in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is acceptable to him.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, hnam tin lai tû- khawm ama ṭia, feltaka thaw taphawt chu, a lâwm zâwng mi a ni hlak.

en: The word which he sent unto the children of Israel, preaching good tidings of peace by Jesus Christ (he is Lord of all)—
hmr: Ama chun thlamuongna Chan- chin Ṭha Isu Krista baua hrilin Israel thlahai kuomah thu ân phur a, (Isu chu mi po po Lal a nih).

en: that saying ye yourselves know, which was published throughout all Judæa, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
hmr: Johanin a khêkpui hlak baptisma zoa khan, thu, Galili rama inthawkin hung inthang phutin, Juda ram po poa inthang suok kha, nangnîn in hriet bawk annâwm.

en: even Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.
hmr: Nazareth Isu chungchâng thu kha, khânga ama chu Pathienin Thlarau Inthieng le thilthawtheinaa a vurzie kha; ama chun mi chunga thawṭhain le diebol suknawmnat po po sukdamin a fang vêl hlak, Pathien a kuoma a um leiin.

en: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom also they slew, hanging him on a tree.
hmr: Juda ram le Jerusalema a thilthawhai po po hretu kan nih; ama chu thinglêra khaiin an sukhlum tah.

en: Him God raised up the third day, and gave him to be made manifest,
hmr: Pathienin ama chu ni thum niin a keitho nâwk a, fietakin ân entir a,

en: not to all the people, but unto witnesses that were chosen before of God, even to us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
hmr: amiruokchu, mi po po kuomah ni loin, a thu hretu ni dinga inhmaa Pathienin a ithlang tah, keini, mithi laia a thonâwk hnunga a kuoma faa dâwntuhai kuoma hin a nih.

en: And he charged us to preach unto the people, and to testify that this is he who is ordained of God to be the Judge of the living and the dead.
hmr: Ama chu mithihai le mi hringhai chunga Rorêltua Pathien iruot chu a nih ti, mi kuoma khêkpui le inhriettir dingin Pathienin thu a mi pêk a nih.

en: To him bear all the prophets witness, that through his name every one that believeth on him shall receive remission of sins.
hmr: “Tûkhawm ama ring taphawt chu a hming leiin suolhai ngaidamin um an tih ti hieng a chanchin hi zâwlneihai po poin an inhriettir hlak kha a nih,” a ta.

en: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all them that heard the word.
hmr: Chun, Peterin chuong thu chu a hril lai tak chun, thu hretuhai po po chunga chun Thlarau Inthieng a hung tlung tah a.

en: And they of the circumcision that believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, Sertanhai laia ringtuhai Peter hung zuituhai chun Thlarau Inthieng pêk chu Jentailhai chunga khawm buok a ni leiin mak an ti hleh a;

en: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
hmr: ṭawng hrietnawhaia thu hrilin, Pathien inpâkin an hriet sih a.

en: Can any man forbid the water, that these should not be baptized, who have received the Holy Spirit as well as we?
hmr: Chun, Peterin a biek a, “Hieng mihai, eini anga Thlarau Inthieng hmuhai hi baptisma an chang nawna dingin miin tui hmang an khap thei am a nih?” a ta.

en: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu Krista hminga baptisma chang ding thu a pêk a. Chuong zoa chun ni iengzat amani lai châm dingin an ngên a.

en: Now the apostles and the brethren that were in Judæa heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
hmr: Chun, Juda rama tirko le unau umhai chun Jentailhai khawmin Pathien thu an zâwm ti an hriet tah a.

en: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,
hmr: Chuongchun, Peter chu Jeru- salem a hang tlung phingleh, Sertanhaiin an kal a,

en: saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.
hmr: a kuomah, “Sertan nawhai inah i lût a, an kuomah i fâk vei a,” an ta.

en: But Peter began, and expounded the matter unto them in order, saying,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peterin a bula inthawkin indawt zatin an kuomah a hrilfieh a;

en: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, a certain vessel descending, as it were a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even unto me:
hmr: “Joppa khuoah ṭawngṭaia ka um laiin zêlin ka um a. Mang angin iengkhat bâwm, puon lientak ang, a ki palia khita, vâna inthawka inkhaithla ka hmuh a; ka kâwla ngei a mi hung hnai a.

en: upon which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw the fourfooted beasts of the earth and wild beasts and creeping things and birds of the heaven.
hmr: Chu chu ka en zing a, ka ngai- tuoh a, hnuoia mi sapheimanlihai, ramsahai, thilhringhai le chunga vatehai ka hmuh a.

en: And I heard also a voice saying unto me, Rise, Peter; kill and eat.
hmr: Chun, rawlin, ‘Peter, tho rawh, that la fa rawh,’ mi tiin ka hriet bawk a.

en: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath ever entered into my mouth.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, keiin, ‘Lalpa, ni lo e, thiengnaw le inthiengnaw ieng- khawm ka bauah a lût ngai nawh,’ ka ta.

en: But a voice answered the second time out of heaven, What God hath cleansed, make not thou common.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, vâna inthawka rawl chun a vawi hninaah, ‘Pathienin a sukthieng ta chu nangin inthieng- naw ti naw,’ tiin a mi dawn a.

en: And this was done thrice: and all were drawn up again into heaven.
hmr: Chuong ang ruok chun vawi thum a hung um a; chun, iengkim chu vâna zuk khaiin a um nâwk tah a.

en: And behold, forthwith three men stood before the house in which we were, having been sent from Cæsarea unto me.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta u, mi pathum, Kaisari khuoa inthawkin ka kuomah an hung tir a, ka umna tuola chun an lo um zing tah a.

en: And the Spirit bade me go with them, making no distinction. And these six brethren also accompanied me; and we entered into the man’s house:
hmr: “Chun, Thlarauin lunghimaw- na nei loa anni zui dingin a mi tir a. Hieng unau parukhai khawm hin an mi zui veh a, mi ina chun kan lût a.

en: and he told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying, Send to Joppa, and fetch Simon, whose surname is Peter;
hmr: Chun, ama chun kan kuomah, a ina vântirko ngîr a hmuzie le, vântirko chun a kuomah, ‘Joppa khuoah mi tir la, Simon, Peter an ti chu, hung inṭhuoitir rawh;

en: who shall speak unto thee words, whereby thou shalt be saved, thou and all thy house.
hmr: ama chun thu hril a ti cheh a, ama thu lei chun nang le i sûnghai sandamin um in tih,’ a tizie khawm a mi hril a.

en: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.
hmr: Chun, thu ka hang hril hlimin Thlarau Inthieng ei chunga a hung tlung tir lai ang khan an chungah a hung tlung tah a.

en: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized in the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, Lalpa thu, ‘Johanin tuiin mi a baptis hlak kha, nangni ruok chu Thlarau Inthiengin baptisma la chang in tih,’ a tizie kha ka hung hriet suok nâwk tah a.

en: If then God gave unto them the like gift as he did also unto us, when we believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?
hmr: Chuongchun, Lalpa Isu Krista an ring phingleh, Pathienin thil thlâwnpêk a mi pêk ang kha an kuoma a pêk phawt tahnung chu, kei tê hi Pathien sêl ruol am ka nih?” a ta.

en: And when they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then to the Gentiles also hath God granted repentance unto life.
hmr: Chuong thu chu an hrietin an to tah a, “Chuong a ni chun, Pathienin Jentailhai khawm hring dingin sim a phal tah a ni chu,” tiin Pathien an inpâk tah a.

en: They therefore that were scattered abroad upon the tribulation that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phoenicia, and Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to none save only to Jews.
hmr: Chun, Stephan leia an suk- nawmnata indarhai kha, Phoiniki ram dâm, Kupra thlierkâr dâm, Antiokei dâm chenin an feh a, Juda- hai kuoma chau naw chu tu kuoma khawm thu an hril nawh a.

en: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Greeks also, preaching the Lord Jesus.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni laia a ṭhen chu Kupra thlierkâr le Kurinia mihai an na, chuonghai chu Antiokei an tlung chun Grikhai kuoma khawm, Lalpa Isu Chanchin Ṭha an hril ve tah a.

en: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number that believed turned unto the Lord.
hmr: Chun, Lalpa kutin anni a ṭhangpui a; mi tamtakin an ring a, Lalpa tieng chu an ngha tâwl tah a.

en: And the report concerning them came to the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas as far as Antioch:
hmr: chun, an chanchin chu Jerusalema kohran umhai naa chun a hung lût tah a; chuongchun, Antiokei chen chun Barnaba chu an tir suok tah a.

en: who, when he was come, and had seen the grace of God, was glad; and he exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord:
hmr: Chun, ama chu a va tlung a, Pathien lunginsietzie chu a hmu chun a lâwm hleh a; ṭhahnemngai- taka Lalpa chel zing dingin an rêngin ân fui tah a.

en: for he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.
hmr: Barnaba chu mi ṭhatak, Thlarau Inthieng le ringnaa sip a nih. Chun, mi tamtakin Lalpa kuomah an belsa tah a.

en: And he went forth to Tarsus to seek for Saul;
hmr: Chun, Barnaba chu Saula zawng dingin Tarsa khuoah a feh a; chun a hmu chun Antiokeia chun a hung ṭhuoi a.

en: and when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that even for a whole year they were gathered together with the church, and taught much people; and that the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.
hmr: Chun, kum khat zet kohranhai inkhâwmnaa chun an ṭhang ve hlak a, mi tamtak an inchûktir hlak a. Antiokeia chun a nih inchûktirhai chu “Kristien” an ti hmasa tak chu.

en: Now in these days there came down prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
hmr: Chun, chuong lai chun zâwlnei tuhai amanih Jerusalema inthawkin Antiokeia chun an zu feh a.

en: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be a great famine over all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius.
hmr: Chun, anni laia mi pakhat, a hming Agaba, a ngîr a, khawvêl po poah ṭâm nasatak a tlung ding a ni ti Thlalrau hrilin ân hriettir a; chu ṭâm chu Klaudi inlal laiin a hung tlung tah a.

en: And the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren that dwelt in Judæa:
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktirhai chun, an thei tâwk sengin, Judai rama unau umhai kuoma chun sawmdâwlna ding thawn an tum a.

en: which also they did, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
hmr: Chu chu an thaw ta ngei a, Barnaba le Saula kuta chun upahai kuomah an inphur tah a.

en: Now about that time Herod the king put forth his hands to afflict certain of the church.
hmr: Chun, chuong lai vêl chun Lal Herod chun kohrana mi ṭhenkhat suknawmnat tumin a kut ân let tah a.

en: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
hmr: Jakob, Johan unau chu, kâwl- hnâmin a sâthlum a.

en: And when he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. And those were the days of unleavened bread.
hmr: Chu chun Judahai chu a suklâwm ti a hrietin, Peter khawm chu man a tum nâwk pei a. (Chuong nihai chu Chawlṭhanglo Bei ruoiṭhe ni a nih).

en: And when he had taken him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to guard him; intending after the Passover to bring him forth to the people.
hmr: chun, a man hnung chun intângna inah a khum a, sipai pâwl li, pali seng peiin, ân vêng sâwktir a; Fekân Ruoiṭhe zoa mi po po kuoma ṭhuoi suok a tum a na.

en: Peter therefore was kept in the prison: but prayer was made earnestly of the church unto God for him.
hmr: Chuleiin, Peter chu intângna inah ân umtir hrih a; nisienlakhawm, kohranhaiin ama ta dingin ṭha- hnemngaitakin Pathien kuomah an ṭawngṭaipêk hlak a.

en: And when Herod was about to bring him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and guards before the door kept the prison.
hmr: Chun, Herod chun a ṭhuoi suok tâwmin, chu zân tak chun Peter chu sipai pahni inkârah khaidiet pahni bunin a in a, a vêngtuhai khawm kawtkhâr bulah an um a, intângna in chu an vêng a.

en: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shined in the cell: and he smote Peter on the side, and awoke him, saying, Rise up quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Lalpa vântirko pakhat a kâwlah a hung ngîr a, rip sûnga chun var ieng amanih a hung var a, Peter nâkah a khîk har a, “Tho vak rawh,” a ta. Chun, a khaidiethai chu a kuta chu a tla tah a.

en: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And he did so. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
hmr: Vântirko chun a kuomah, “Dier kei la, i kekawk bun rawh,” a ta. Ama chun chuong ang chun a thawh a. Chun vântirko chun a kuomah, “I puon bât ṭha la, mi zui rawh,” a ta.

en: And he went out, and followed; and he knew not that it was true which was done by the angel, but thought he saw a vision.
hmr: Peter chu a suok a, a zui tah a; vântirko chângzie chu a tak a ni ti a hriet nawh a, manga a hmu amanih a sâwn lem a.

en: And when they were past the first and the second guard, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth into the city; which opened to them of its own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and straightway the angel departed from him.
hmr: Chun, vêngtu hmasa le a dawttu chu an khêl hnung chun, tuol suokna ding thîr kawtkhâr chu an va tlung a, chu chu an ta dingin ân hawng fâwm tah a; an suok a, kawtthlêr pakhat an khêl a; chun, vântirko chun a fe san nghâl tah a.

en: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a truth, that the Lord hath sent forth his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
hmr: Chun, Peter chu a har phingleh, “Lalpain a vântirko a tir suok a, Herod kut le Juda mihai beiseina po poa inthawkin a mi sandam ti tuhin indiktakin ka hriet tah,” a ta.

en: And when he had considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together and were praying.
hmr: Chun, ân ngaituo zo chun, Johan, Marka an ti, chu mipa nu Mari ina chun a va feh a; chutaka chun ṭawngṭaiin mi tamtak an lo um khâwm a.

en: And when he knocked at the door of the gate, a maid came to answer, named Rhoda.
hmr: Chun, tuolpûk kawtkhâr a hei nawk phingleh, a hming Rodi, nunghâk pakhat, dawn dingin a va feh a.

en: And when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for joy, but ran in, and told that Peter stood before the gate.
hmr: Peter rawl a hriet phingleh, a lâwm leiin kawt chu hawng loin a tlân lût nâwk ta lem a, “Peter chu kawtkhâr bulah a ngîr” tiin a va hril a.

en: And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she confidently affirmed that it was even so. And they said, It is his angel.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chun a kuomah, “în vêt a ni ta hi,” an lo tih a. Ama ruok chu, “Titakzet a nih,” tiin a ṭhang ṭal a. Anni chun, “A vântirko a ni chu,” an ta.

en: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened, they saw him, and were amazed.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peter chun a nawk zing a; chun, an hei hawng chun, ama chu an hmuh a, mak an ti hleh a.

en: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him forth out of the prison. And he said, Tell these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went to another place.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun an tona dingin kutin a zâp a, Pathienin intângna ina inthawka a ṭhuoi suokzie chu a hril tah a. Chun, “Hieng thu hi Jakob le unauhai kuomah va hril ro,” a ta. Chun, a suok a, ram dangah a fe tah a.

en: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
hmr: Chun, nisa a suok phingleh, sipaihai chu, “Peter khâwlai am a um tah a?” tiin buoi namênin an buoi nawh a.

en: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the guards, and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judæa to Cæsarea, and tarried there.
hmr: Herod chun a zawng a, a hmu si nawh a, a vêngtuhai chu a suosal a, sukhlum dingin thu a pêk tah a. Chun, Herod chu Judai rama inthawkin Kaisari khuoah a zu feh a, chutaka chun a um zing a.

en: Now he was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: and they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, they asked for peace, because their country was fed from the king’s country.
hmr: Herod chu, Tura le Sidon khuoa mihai chunga chun a lungninaw bêk bêk a. Anni chun, Blasta, lal khum vêngtu chu, an ruolah an siem a, inthuruolin a kuomah an hung a, an khuo tiengin lal khuo tienga pûr inchaw hlak an ni leiin inrem an ngên a.

en: And upon a set day Herod arrayed himself in royal apparel, and sat on the throne, and made an oration unto them.
hmr: A ni tiem ni chun, Herod chun lal puon a sil a, lalṭhungphaah a ṭhung a, an kuomah thu a hril a.

en: And the people shouted, saying, The voice of a god, and not of a man.
hmr: Mi po po chun, “Pathien rawl a ni hi, mihriem rawl a ni naw hi,” an ta, an khêk a.

en: And immediately an angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
hmr: Ama chun Pathien kuomah chawimawina chu a pêk naw leiin Lalpa vântirkoin kârloah a man a, rulrukûtin a fâk a, a thi tah a.

en: But the word of God grew and multiplied.
hmr: Pathien thu ruok chu, ân dâr a, a pung ta pei a.

en: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministration, taking with them John whose surname was Mark.
hmr: Chun, Barnaba le Saula chun, rawng chu an bâwl zo chun, Jerusalema inthawk chun an kîr nâwk tah a, Johan, Marka an ti chu an kuomah an ṭhuoi veh a.

en: Now there were at Antioch, in the church that was there, prophets and teachers, Barnabas, and Symeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen the foster-brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
hmr: Chun, Antiokeia kohran lai chun thu hriltuhai le inchûktirhai an um; chuong chu Barnaba hai, Simeon Niger an ti hai, Kurini khuoa Lukia hai, lal Herod unau Manaina hai, Saula hai leh an nih.

en: And as they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.
hmr: Chun, Lalpa rawng an bâwl a, bu an nghei laiin, Thlarau Inthiengin, “Barnaba le Saula hi anni ka ruot ang san thaw dingin mi suktumpêk ro,” a ta.

en: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
hmr: Chuongchun, bu nghei a, an ṭawngṭai zo chun an chungah kut an innghat a, an infetir tah a.

en: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
hmr: Chuongchun, Thlarau Inthieng tir suok chun an fe tah a, Selukai khuoah an fe thlah a, chutaka in- thawkin Kupra thlierkârah lâwngin an feh a.

en: And when they were at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John as their attendant.
hmr: Chun, Salamis khuoa an um laiin, Juda inkhâwmna inahai Pathien thu an hril hlak; Johan khawm kha an rawng bâwl dingin an ṭhuoi veh a.

en: And when they had gone through the whole island unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-Jesus;
hmr: Chun, thlierkâr chu Paphos chenin an fang suok a, dawithiem zâwlnei tehlêm, Juda mi pakhat an hmuh a, a hming chu Bar-Isu a nih.

en: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of understanding. The same called unto him Barnabas and Saul, and sought to hear the word of God.
hmr: Ama chu, lal aiawtu, Serjia Paula, mi vartak kuoma um a nih. Chu lal aiawtu chun, Barnaba le Saula chu a ko a, Pathien thu hriet a tum a.

en: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Elum, (Bar-Isu hming dang umzie hi Dawithiem tina a nih), chu mipa chun, lal aiawtu chu, inringnawtir tumin, anni chu a lo kal a.

en: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, fastened his eyes on him,
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula, (Paula an ti bawk chu), Thlarau Inthiengin a sip a, ama chu a en zing a,

en: and said, O full of all guile and all villany, thou son of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
hmr: “Nang mi hlêm le theidaum tinrênga sippa, nang diebol naupa, nang felna tinrêng kawp nawpa, Lalpa kawng feltakhai hi suksiet ma naw ti ni maw?

en: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
hmr: Hre rawh, tuhin Lalpa kut i chungah a tla a ni hi, i mit hung indel a ta, khaw var hmu hri naw ti ni,” a ta. Chuongchun, inthim le sûmin ama a baw nghâl tah a, kuta keitu ding zawngin ân vâk a.

en: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.
hmr: Chun, Lal aiawtu chun, chuong thil chu a hmuh a, Lalpa inchûktir thu chu mak a ti hleh, a ing tah a.

en: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, and came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Paula chu a rawihai le chun, Paphos khuoa inthawk chun lawngin an feh a. Pamphulia rama Perga an tlung a; chun, Johan khan anni chu a mâksan a, Jerusalemah a kîr nâwk tah a.

en: But they, passing through from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia; and they went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chu Pergaa inthawkin an fe pei a, Pisidia rama Antiokei an tlung a; chun, Châwlniin inkhâwmna inah an lût a, an ṭhung a.

en: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
hmr: Chun, Dân Lekhabu le Zâwl- neihai lekhabu tiem zoin inkhâwmna hotuhaiin an kuomah mi an tir a, “Unauhai, mihai infuina thu ieng amanih in nei chun hril ro,” an ta.

en: And Paul stood up, and beckoning with the hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, hearken:
hmr: Chun, Paula a ngîr a, kutin a zâp a, a hril a: “Israel mihai le Pathien ṭituhai, ngai ro.

en: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they sojourned in the land of Egypt, and with a high arm led he them forth out of it.
hmr: Hieng Israel chihai Pathien hin, ei thlatuhai a thlang a, Aigupta rama an thang zing lai khan a chawimawi a, kut chunghnungin chutaka inthawk chun a ṭhuoi suok tah a.

en: And for about the time of forty years as a nursing-father bare he them in the wilderness.
hmr: Kum sâwmli lai thlalêra khan an thilthawhai chu a en thei zing a.

en: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred and fifty years:
hmr: Chun, Kanaan rama hnam sari a suktlâwm zo hnung khan an ram chu hluo dingin a pêk pei a, kum zali sâwmnga sûng po khan.

en: and after these things he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.
hmr: Chuong hnunga chun, rorêltu- hai a pêk hlak a, zâwlnei Samuel chen khan.

en: And afterward they asked for a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for the space of forty years.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun lal an hnih a; chuongchun, Pathienin Saula, Kis naupa, Benjamin chia mi kha an kuomah a pêk a, kum sâwmli sûnga dingin.

en: And when he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king; to whom also he bare witness and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who shall do all my will.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a sawn hmang hnung khan an lala um dingin David a siem tah a; Pathienin chu thu chu inhriettirin, ‘David, Jessai naupa, ka lungril ang put mi ka hmu suok tah, ama chun ka dit zâwng taphawt thâwng a tih,’ a ta.

en: Of this man’s seed hath God according to promise brought unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus;
hmr: “Chu thlahai laia chun Pathien- in, thutiem ang peiin, Israelhai Sandamtu Isu a hung intlun a.

en: when John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
hmr: A hung hmain Johanin simna baptisma chu Israel mi po po lai a lo hril ta a.

en: And as John was fulfilling his course, he said, What suppose ye that I am? I am not he. But behold, there cometh one after me the shoes of whose feet I am not worthy to unloose.
hmr: Chun, Johanin a lampui a hraw suok ding lai chun, ‘Nangnîn tu âm in mi ruot a? Ama chu ka ni nawh ie. Nisienlakhawm, ngai ta u, ka hnungah mi tû amanih a hung ding a nih, kei hi chu a kephaa a kekawk sût tlâk khawm ka ni nawh,’ a ta.

en: Brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and those among you that fear God, to us is the word of this salvation sent forth.
hmr: “Unauhai, Abraham thla nau- hai, nangni laia Pathien ṭi po pohai, eini kuoma hin hieng sandamna thu hi a mi hung inphur suok a ni hi.

en: For they that dwell in Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.
hmr: Jerusalema umhaiin, an hotu- hai leh, ama chu an hriet naw lei le, zâwlneihai thu, Châwlni ta- phawta tiem hlak kha, an hriet bawk naw leiin, ama chu thiemnaw in- changtirin, chu thu chu an hlen tah a.

en: And though they found no cause of death in him, yet asked they of Pilate that he should be slain.
hmr: A thina khawp meu a chung- ah iengkhawm an hmu naw khawm- in, Pilat kuomah sukhlum an ngên a.

en: And when they had fulfilled all things that were written of him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.
hmr: Chun, a thu zâwlneihaiin an ziek lâwk po po kha an hlen zo hnungin, thinga inthawk chu an lâk thlâk a, thlânah an inzâl tah a.

en: But God raised him from the dead:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathienin mi- thi laia inthawkin a keitho nâwk tah a.

en: and he was seen for many days of them that came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses unto the people.
hmr: Chun, Galili rama inthawka Jerusalema ama ruola hang fe vehai kuoma chun ni sâwt tak sûngin ân lâr hlak a; chuong mihai chu tuhin mi kuoma a thu hretuhai an nih.

en: And we bring you good tidings of the promise made unto the fathers,
hmr: Keini khawmin thlatuhai kuomah thutiem kha a chanchin lâwmum kan hung hril cheu hi,

en: that God hath fulfilled the same unto our children, in that he raised up Jesus; as also it is written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
hmr: khânga Pathienin Isu a keitho khan, eini an nauhai lei hin chuong chu a hlen a nih, Inpâkna Hla pa- hninaah, ‘Ka naupa i nih ie, vawisûn hin ka nei che a nih,’ ti ziek ang bawk khan.

en: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he hath spoken on this wise, I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.
hmr: Hmawnna hmuna fe nâwk lo dingin Pathienin ama chu mithi laia inthawkin a keitho dingzie thu chu hieng hin a hril a nih, ‘David kuoma lunginsietna ka itiem tlathai kha nanga kuomah pêng ka che,’ tiin.

en: Because he saith also in another psalm, Thou wilt not give thy Holy One to see corruption.
hmr: Chuleiin, Hla dangin, ‘I Mi In- thieng chu hmawn hmang phal naw ti nih a,’ a ti bawk a.

en: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:
hmr: David chu, Pathien rorêlpêk angin a dam ruolpuihai rawng a bâwl zo khan, a in innghil a, a thlatuhai kuomah an inzâl a, a hmawn hmang tah a nih.

en: but he whom God raised up saw no corruption.
hmr: Pathienin a ikeitho ruok kha chu a hmawn hmang naw kha.

en: Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is proclaimed unto you remission of sins:
hmr: “Chuongchun, unauhai, hre ro; ama lei chun, suol ngaidamna thu in kuomah hril a ni hi;

en: and by him every one that believeth is justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
hmr: tûkhawm ama ring taphawt chu, iengkimah ama thiem inchang- tirin a um, chuonga chun, Mosie Dânin thiem inchangtirin in um thei nawh.

en: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you which is spoken in the prophets:
hmr: Chuleiin, fîmkhur ro, chuong naw chun, zâwlneihai lekhabua an hril kha in chungah hung tlung a tih,

en: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish; For I work a work in your days, A work which ye shall in no wise believe, if one declare it unto you.
hmr: ‘Hmusittuhai en ta u, Makti unla, bohmang ro; In dam sûng hin thil kawng khat ka thaw hi, Chu thil chu miin hril hai sienla cheu khawm, Awi tawp naw ti niu,’ a ti kha,” a ta.

en: And as they went out, they besought that these words might be spoken to them the next sabbath.
hmr: Chun, an suok chun, Châwlni nâwka chuong thu chu hril nâwk dingin an ngên a.

en: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas; who, speaking to them, urged them to continue in the grace of God.
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmhai chu an ṭin phingleh, Judahai le an saphun Pathien ngaisak laia mi tamtakin Paula le Barnaba chu an zui pei a; anni chun an lo biek a, Pathien lunginsietnaa chun um zing dingin an infui a.

en: And the next sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.
hmr: Chun, Châwlni nâwka chun a khuo deu thawin Pathien thu ngai dingin an hung inkhâwm a.

en: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Judahaiin mi- puihai chu an hmu phingleh an îtthîk bêk el a; Paula thu hril chu an sêlkal a, an hrilpâwi hleh a.

en: And Paul and Barnabas spake out boldly, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first be spoken to you. Seeing ye thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
hmr: Chun, Paula le Barnaba chun huoitakin an hril dawk a, “Pathien thu hi nangni kuoma hril hmasak hrim ding a nih; nisienlakhawm, in lo dang kîr a, chatuona hring tlâk loa in inruot ta hnung chu, hre ro, Jentailhai kuom tieng ngha ta vêng kan tih.

en: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee for a light of the Gentiles, That thou shouldest be for salvation unto the uttermost part of the earth.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Lalpain thu a mi pêk a nih. ‘Jentailhai sukvartuah ka ruot che, Kâwlkawdawng chena sandamna in tlun theina dingin,’ ti ziek ang khan,” an ta.

en: And as the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
hmr: Chun, Jentailhai chun chuong thu chu an hrietin an lâwm a, Pathien chu an chawimawi a, chun, chatuona hring dinga ruot po chun an ring tah a.

en: And the word of the Lord was spread abroad throughout all the region.
hmr: Chun, Lalpa thu chu, chu lai ram khawvêla chun ân dar tah a.

en: But the Jews urged on the devout women of honorable estate, and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and cast them out of their borders.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Judahai chun nuhmei inzaum Pathien ngaisakhai le khuoa upahai chu an infui a, Paula le Barnaba chu an insuknawmnatir a, an rama inthawkin an hnawt suok tah a.

en: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
hmr: Chun, anni chun an chungah an kephaa pilvut an thinthlâk a, Ikoniom an tlung tah a.

en: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, închûktirhai chu lâwmna le Thlarau Inthiengin an sip tâwl a.

en: And it came to pass in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed.
hmr: Chun, Ikonioma chun Judahai inkhâwmna inah an lût rêl a, thu an hril hlak a, chuongchun, Grik le Juda tamtak khawmin an ring ta rau a.

en: But the Jews that were disobedient stirred up the souls of the Gentiles, and made them evil affected against the brethren.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ring nuom naw Judahaiin Jentailhai lungril an infui a, unauhai chu an intheidatir a.

en: Long time therefore they tarried there speaking boldly in the Lord, who bare witness unto the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa thu huoitaka hrilin chutaka chun sâwt rei an um a, ama chun, inchikna le thilmakhai an kuta inthawtirin, a lunginsiet thu ân hriettir hlak a.

en: But the multitude of the city was divided; and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
hmr: Chun, khuoa mipuihai chu an inkhing tah a; aṭhenin Judahai chu an ṭan a; aṭhenin tirkohai chu.

en: And when there was made an onset both of the Gentiles and of the Jews with their rulers, to treat them shamefully and to stone them,
hmr: Chun, Jentailhai, Judahai, an hotuhai le chun, tirkohai chu inzakumtaka siem le lunga dêng tuma an thaw ding laiin anni chun an lo hriet a,

en: they became aware of it, and fled unto the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the region round about:
hmr: Lukaoni ram bawka chun, Lustra le Derbe khuoa le a vêl ramhaia chun an tlân hmang a;

en: and there they preached the gospel.
hmr: chuonga chun, Chanchin Ṭha an hril pei a.

en: And at Lystra there sat a certain man, impotent in his feet, a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.
hmr: Chun, Lustraa chun ke zeng tû amanih a ṭhung hlak a, a pieng tîra inthawk keinbai hrim a na, kein a lâwn ngai nawh a.

en: The same heard Paul speaking: who, fastening his eyes upon him, and seeing that he had faith to be made whole,
hmr: Ama chun, Paula thu hril a ngai a, chun, Paula chun, ama chu a en zing a, damna dingin ringna a nei ti a hriet a,

en: said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped up and walked.
hmr: rawl inringtakin, “I kein ngîr tlûn rawh,” a ta. Chun, ama chu ân châwm tho a, kein a lâwn tah a.

en: And when the multitude saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
hmr: Chun, mipuihaiin Paula thil- thaw chu an hmu phingleh, Lukaoni ṭawngin inringtakin, “Pathienhai chu mihriem angin ei kuomah an hung ṭum tah a ni hi!” an ta.

en: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercury, because he was the chief speaker.
hmr: Chun, Barnaba chu, “Jupitar” an tih a, Paula chu, thu hriltu lem a ni leiin, “Merkuri” an tih a.

en: And the priest of Jupiter whose temple was before the city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the multitudes.
hmr: Chun, Jupitar biekin khaw- hnâwma um chu, a thiempu chun sebâwng chalhai le, pâr ṭhihrui limhai, kawtkhâr kâwlah a hung lâk a, mipuihai le chun biekna dingin that an tum a.

en: But when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of it, they rent their garments, and sprang forth among the multitude, crying out
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tirko Barnaba le Paula chun, chu chu an hriet phing- leh, an puon an keithlêr a, mipui lai chun an inchâwm lût a, an khêk a.

en: and saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and bring you good tidings, that ye should turn from these vain things unto a living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and all that in them is:
hmr: “Puhai, iengdinga hieng thilhai hi in thaw am a na? Keini khawm in nungchang ang put mihriem kan ni hi; hieng thil teplohai hi in nghatsan a, vân hai, hnuoi hai, tuisuoriet hai, an sûnga um po pohai siemtu Pathien hring kuoma chun in hung kawpna dingin Chanchin Ṭha kan hung intlun cheu a ni hi.

en: who in the generations gone by suffered all the nations to walk in their own ways.
hmr: Chu Pathien chun, tienlaiin hnam tin mâni lampui seng hraw a phal hlak a.

en: And yet he left not himself without witness, in that he did good and gave you from heaven rains and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama inhriettir- na um loin ân siem ngai nawh. Chuongchun, thil a thaw ṭha hlak a, vâna inthawka ruohai le kum ṭhat kumhai a pêk cheu a, in lungril fâk ding le lâwmnain a suktlaipêk hlak cheu kha,” an ta.

en: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the multitudes from doing sacrifice unto them.
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chun, mipuihaiin anni biekna dinga ran an that ding chu an khap zo hrâm a.

en: But there came Jews thither from Antioch and Iconium: and having persuaded the multitudes, they stoned Paul, and dragged him out of the city, supposing that he was dead.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Antiokei le Ikonioma mi Juda tuhai amanih chutaka chun an hung a, mipuihai chu an zâwr thlûk tah a; chuongchun, Paula chu lungin an dêng a, thia an ring leiin khuoa inthawk chu an hnûk dawk tah a.

en: But as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and entered into the city: and on the morrow he went forth with Barnabas to Derbe.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, inchûktirhai chu a vêla an ngîr laiin, a hung tho a, khuoa chun a lût nâwk tah a. Chun, a zînga chun Barnaba leh Derbeah an fe tah a.

en: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, and to Iconium, and to Antioch,
hmr: Chu khuohai kuoma chun, Chanchin Ṭha an hril a, inchûktir tamtak an siem hnungin Lustraa hai, Ikonioma hai, Antiokeia hai, an kîr nâwk a.

en: confirming the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that through many tribulations we must enter into the kingdom of God.
hmr: “Rinum tamtak tuorin Pathien ramah ei lût ding a ni hrim a nih,” tiin inchûktirhai lungril an sukdet a, ringnaa chun um zing dingin an infui a.

en: And when they had appointed for them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.
hmr: Chun, kohran tinah upahai an ruot pêk pei a, bu nghei puma an ṭawngṭai zoin, an ring Lalpa kuoma chun an inkawltir pei a.

en: And they passed through Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.
hmr: Chun, Pisidia ram chu an fang suok a, Pamphulia ram chu an tlung a.

en: And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia;
hmr: Chun, Pergaa thu an hril zoin Attaliaah an zu feh a;

en: and thence they sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been committed to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled.
hmr: chutaka inthawk chun lawngin an suok a, Antiokei chu an hung tlung nâwk tah a, chu chu a thil thaw zo ta chu thaw dinga unauhaiin Pathien lunginsietna inkawltira an suokna kha a nih.

en: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all things that God had done with them, and that he had opened a door of faith unto the Gentiles.
hmr: Chun, an tlung hnungin ko- hranhai chu an ko khâwm a, Pathienin anni hmanga, thil a thawhai po po le, Jentailhai ta dinga ringna kawtkhâr a hawngpêkziehai chu an hril a.

en: And they tarried no little time with the disciples.
hmr: Inchûktirhai lai chun sâwt rei an um tah a.

en: And certain men came down from Judæa and taught the brethren, saying, Except ye be circumcised after the custom of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
hmr: Chun, mi tuhai amanih Judai rama inthawkin an hung thlah a, “Mosie dân anga ser in intantir naw chun sandam ni thei naw ti niu,” tiin unauhai chu an inchûktir a.

en: And when Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and questioning with them, the brethren appointed that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
hmr: Chuongchun, Paula le Barnaba chu anni le chun insêl namêna an insêl nawa an inkhing tlat leiin, Paula le Barnaba chu, anni laia tuhai amani leh, chu thubuoi chunga chun, Jerusalema tirkohai le upahai kuoma hang fe dingin an ruot a.

en: They therefore, being brought on their way by the church, passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
hmr: Chuongchun, kohran chun an hang inthlah a, anni chun Jentailhai nghat kîr nâwkzie thu chu hril peiin Phoiniki ram le Samari ram an fang suok tah a; chuongchun, unauhai po po an suklâwm bêk bêk a.

en: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church and the apostles and the elders, and they rehearsed all things that God had done with them.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem chu an hang tlung chun, kohranhai, tirkohai, upahai chun an lo lâwm a, chun, Pathienin anni hmanga thil a thaw- hai po po chu an hril a.

en: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees who believed, saying, It is needful to circumcise them, and to charge them to keep the law of Moses.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pharisai pâwl, ring ve tuhai amanih an tho a, “Jentailhai ser tan ding a nih. Mosie dân zâwm khawm anni chu tiem kher ding a nih,” an ta.

en: And the apostles and the elders were gathered together to consider of this matter.
hmr: Chun, tirkohai le upahai chu, chu thu chu ngaituo dingin an inkhâwm a.

en: And when there had been much questioning, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Brethren, ye know that a good while ago God made choice among you, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.
hmr: Chun, an insêl rak hnungin Peter a tho a, an kuomah, “Unauhai, Jentailhaiin keia baua Chanchin Ṭha thu hrea awi dingin, Pathienin inhmaa nangni laia inthawka a mi ruotzie kha in hriet.

en: And God, who knoweth the heart, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Spirit, even as he did unto us;
hmr: Chun, lungril hretu Pathienin eini a mi pêk ang bawk khan, Thlarau Inthieng an kuoma pe vein, an chungah a lâwm ti ân hriettir a;

en: and he made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.
hmr: chun, anni le eini thlier bîk loin, ringnain an lungril a sukthieng tah a.

en: Now therefore why make ye trial of God, that ye should put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
hmr: Chuongchun, ei thlatuhai le eini izo ta naw, rîngkawl kha inchûktirhai chungah tuhin innghat tumin ieng- dinga Pathien var in sêlkal am a na?

en: But we believe that we shall be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus, in like manner as they.
hmr: Anni ring ang bawkin eini khawmin Lalpa Isu lunginsietna leia sandam ding niin ei ring sih a,” a ta.

en: And all the multitude kept silence; and they hearkened unto Barnabas and Paul rehearsing what signs and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles through them.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui po po an to zing a, Barnaba le Paula Pa- thienin anni hmanga Jentailhai laia inchiknahai le thilmakhai a thaw thu kha an hril sûng po chu an ngai a.

en: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Brethren, hearken unto me:
hmr: Chun, an hril zoin Jakobin a hril ve thung a; “Unauhai, ka thu lo ngai ta u,

en: Symeon hath rehearsed how first God visited the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
hmr: Pathienin ama hming put dingin, anni laia mihai la suok dingin Jentailhai a hung kan tîr thu kha, Simeon hin a hril tah.

en: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
hmr: Chun, chuong thu le zâwlneihai thu hi ân hme a nih:

en: After these things I will return, And I will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen; And I will build again the ruins thereof, And I will set it up:
hmr: ‘Chuong zoa chun kîr nâwk ka ta David bâwktê chim kha siem nâwk ka tih, A sietna lai po khawm siem ṭha nâwk ka ta;

en: That the residue of men may seek after the Lord, And all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called,
hmr: Mi dang, Jentailhai po po ka hming mîn ṭawmpuihai chun, Lalpa an zawngna dingin Chu bâwktê chu tungding ka tih, tiin,

en: Saith the Lord, who maketh these things known from of old.
hmr: Khawvêl siem tîra inthawkin hieng thu inhriettir hlaktu Lalpa chun a tih,’ ti ziek ang khan.

en: Wherefore my judgment is, that we trouble not them that from among the Gentiles turn to God;
hmr: “Chuleiin, hieng ang hin ka ruot a nih. Jentailhai laia Pathien tieng nghahai chu sukrinum naw inla,

en: but that we write unto them, that they abstain from the pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from what is strangled, and from blood.
hmr: milim biekna thil inthiengnaw fâk dâm, indit dâm, sa râkhlum le thisen fâk dâm bân dingin an kuomah ziek lem inla ka ti tak a nih.

en: For Moses from generations of old hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath.
hmr: Mosien inhmaa inthawk tah khaw tinah a thu khêkpuitu a nei hlak sih a; inkhâwmna inahai Châwlni taphawt chun a thu chu tiem a ni hlak kha,” a ta.

en: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:
hmr: Chun, tirkohai, upahai kohran po pohai le chun, an pâwla mi thlanga, Paula le Barnaba ruolin Antiokeia infetir ṭha an tih a; an ithlanghai hming chu Juda (Barsaba an ti) le, Sila an nih; anni chu unauhai laia hotu deu an nih.

en: and they wrote thus by them, The apostles and the elders, brethren, unto the brethren who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia, greeting:
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hin an ziek a, an kutah an inphur a; “Tirkohai le unauhai laia upahaiin Antiokeia dâm, Suria rama dâm le Kilikia rama Jentail unau umhai chibai an bûk.

en: Forasmuch as we have heard that certain who went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls; to whom we gave no commandment;
hmr: “Kan pâwl laia mi tuhai amaniin thu hrilin an sukbuoi cheu a, in lungril an suklungzîng ti kan hriet a, an kuomah thu iengkhawm kan pêk si nawh.

en: it seemed good unto us, having come to one accord, to choose out men and send them unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
hmr: Chuleiin, inthuruola kan in- khâwmin, kan dittak Barnaba le Paula,

en: men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
hmr: Lalpa Isu Krista hming leia thi dâwnlohai hung ruol hin, mi thlanga in kuoma hung tir ve ṭhain kan hriet a.

en: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves also shall tell you the same things by word of mouth.
hmr: Chuongchun, Juda le Sila kan hung tir a ni hi, anni khawmin hieng thu bawk hi ṭawng bauin hril an ti cheu.

en: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things:
hmr: Thlarau Inthieng le keinîn, hieng thu pawimaw naw hi chu phur rik zuol in chungah innghat naw inla, a ṭha kan tih;

en: that ye abstain from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication; from which if ye keep yourselves, it shall be well with you. Fare ye well.
hmr: milim biekna sa fâk dâm, indit dâm ma unla kan tih. Hieng hi in ma chun in ta dingin ṭhâng a tih. Damtakin um ro,” tiin.

en: So they, when they were dismissed, came down to Antioch; and having gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle.
hmr: Chuongchun, an itir chun an feh a, Antiokei chu an zu tlung a. Mipui chu an ko khâwm a, lekha chu an pêk a.

en: And when they had read it, they rejoiced for the consolation.
hmr: Chun, an tiem zoin thlamuong- na thu lei chun an lâwm ta hleh a.

en: And Judas and Silas, being themselves also prophets, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed them.
hmr: Chun, Juda le Sila chu zâwlnei an ni bawk a, thu tamtakin unauhai chu an thlamuon a, an sukdet a.

en: And after they had spent some time there, they were dismissed in peace from the brethren unto those that had sent them forth.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun sâwt rei an um hnungin, anni hung tirtuhai kuomah kîr nâwk dingin unauhai chun thlamuongtakin an infetir nâwk tah a,
(Sila ruok chu chutaka um zing a tum a.)

en: But Paul and Barnabas tarried in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
hmr: Paula le Barnaba ruok chu Antiokeia chun Lalpa thu inchûktir le hrilin an um zing a, mi dang tamtakhai leh.

en: And after some days Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us return now and visit the brethren in every city wherein we proclaimed the word of the Lord, and see how they fare.
hmr: Chun, ni iengzat amanih hnunga chun, Paulain Barnaba kuomah, “Tuhin fe nâwk inla, khaw tina Lalpa thu ei hrilna taphawta unau umhai kha kan pei inla, an um dân en ei tih,” a ta.

en: And Barnabas was minded to take with them John also, who was called Mark.
hmr: Chun, Barnaba chun Johan, (Marka an ti chu), an kuoma ṭhuoi ve a tum a, Paula ruok chun, ama chu an kuoma ṭhuoi chu ṭha a ti nawh a.

en: But Paul thought not good to take with them him who withdrew from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
hmr: Pamphulia ramah anni a kîr san a, sinthawnaa an kuoma a fe ve ta naw lei khan.

en: And there arose a sharp contention, so that they parted asunder one from the other, and Barnabas took Mark with him, and sailed away unto Cyprus:
hmr: Chuongchun, nasatakin an lo insêl tah a, an inṭheh a, Barnaba chun, Marka chu a kuomah a ṭhuoi a, Kupra thlierkâr tieng lawngin a fe tah a.

en: but Paul chose Silas, and went forth, being commended by the brethren to the grace of the Lord.
hmr: Paula ruok chun, Sila a thlang a, unauhaiin Lalpa lunginsietna an inkawltir hnungin a fe suok tah a.

en: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.
hmr: Chun, kohranhai chu sukdet peiin Suria le Kilikia ram a fang suok tah a.

en: And he came also to Derbe and to Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewess that believed; but his father was a Greek.
hmr: Chun, Derbe le Lustraa chun a fe bawk a; chun, chutaka chun, a hming Timothe inchûktir pakhat a um; ama chu ringtu Juda nuhmei naupa a na, a pa ruok chu Grik a nih;

en: The same was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.
hmr: Lustra le Ikonioma unau umhai chun, ama chu an inpâk hlak a.

en: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and he took and circumcised him because of the Jews that were in those parts: for they all knew that his father was a Greek.
hmr: Paulain ama chu a kuoma fe ve dingin a dit a; chuongchun, chu tienga Juda umhai lei chun, a ser a tanpêk a, a pa chu Grik a nih ti an hriet vawng sih a.

en: And as they went on their way through the cities, they delivered them the decrees to keep which had been ordained of the apostles and elders that were at Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, khaw tinah an fe malamin Jerusalema tirko le upa umhai thurêl kha zâwm dingin unauhai kuomah an pêk pei a.

en: So the churches were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.
hmr: Chuongchun, kohranhai chu ringnaa chun an det tah a, ni tin an pung ta deu deu a.

en: And they went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been forbidden of the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia;
hmr: Chun, Thlarau Inthiengin Asia rama thu hril a khap leiin Phrugia le Galati ram chu an fang suok a;

en: and when they were come over against Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia; and the Spirit of Jesus suffered them not;
hmr: chun, Musia ram kâwl an tlungin Bethunia ramah lût an tum a, nisienlakhawm, Isu Thlarauin a phal si nawh.

en: and passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.
hmr: Chuongchun, Musia ram chu an khêl a, Troasah an fe thla tah a.

en: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night: There was a man of Macedonia standing, beseeching him, and saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.
hmr: Chun, zânah Paulain a mang angin Makedonia rama mi mi pakhat ngîrin, “Makedonia ramah hung kai la, mi ṭhangpui rawh,” tia ngên ngênin a hmuh a.

en: And when he had seen the vision, straightway we sought to go forth into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel unto them.
hmr: Chun, chu mang chu a mang zo phingleh, Makedonia rama chun fe kan tum tah a, an kuoma Chanchin Ṭha hril dingin Pathienin a mi ko ti kan hriet a.

en: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis;
hmr: Chun, Troasa inthawk chun lawngin kan suok a, tluongtakin Samotrakiah kan riek a, a zînga chun Neapoliah kan fe nâwk a;

en: and from thence to Philippi, which is a city of Macedonia, the first of the district, a Roman colony: and we were in this city tarrying certain days.
hmr: chun, chutaka inthawk chun Philippiah kan feh a, chu khuo chu Makedonia rama khaw pakhat a nih, chu biela chun khaw pawimaw tak a na, Roma inthawka mi inpêmhai khuo a nih. Chu khuoa chun ni tam rei kan châm a.

en: And on the sabbath day we went forth without the gate by a river side, where we supposed there was a place of prayer; and we sat down, and spake unto the women that were come together.
hmr: Chun, Châwlniin kul kawtkhâr puo tienga vadung panga, ṭawng- ṭaina hmun ni dinga kan ringa chun kan feh a; chun, kan ṭhunga nuhmei hung khâwmhai kuoma chun thu kan hril a.

en: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one that worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened to give heed unto the things which were spoken by Paul.
hmr: Chun, a hming Luda, puon senduk zawrtu, Thuotira khuoa mi, Pathien betu nuhmei pakhatin kan thu a hriet a; chun Paula thu hril zâwm dingin Lalpa chun a lungril a sukvar tah a.

en: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide there. And she constrained us.
hmr: Chun, ama le a sûnghaiin baptisma an chang zo chun, “Lalpa ring tak zeta in mi ruot chun, ka inah hung tlung ro,” tiin a mi ngên a mi ngên a, a mi chel tah a.

en: And it came to pass, as we were going to the place of prayer, that a certain maid having a spirit of divination met us, who brought her masters much gain by soothsaying.
hmr: Chun, ṭawngṭaina hmuna kan fe lai chun suok nunghâk tû amanih, khawhri aisânthiem zâwlin a mîn tuokpui a, ama chun a aisân lei chun a puhai chu sum tamtak ân hmutir hlak a.

en: The same following after Paul and us cried out, saying, These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim unto you the way of salvation.
hmr: Ama chun Paula le keini a mi zui a, “Hienghai, sandamna lampui hriltu cheu hi, Achunghnungtak Pathien suokhai an ni hi,” tiin a khêk a.

en: And this she did for many days. But Paul, being sore troubled, turned and said to the spirit, I charge thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And it came out that very hour.
hmr: Chuong ang chun, ni sâwt rei a thaw hlak a. Chuongchun, Paula chu a lungni ta nawh a, a nghah a, khawhri kuoma chun, “Isu Krista hmingin a sûnga inthawkin suok thu ka pêk che,” a ta. Chun, chu lai tak chun a suok nghâl tah a.

en: But when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they laid hold on Paul and Silas, and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers,
hmr: Chun, a puhai chun an sum hmuna ân hmang ti an hriet a, Paula le Sila chu an man a, hotuhai hmaah dâwr hmunah an kei lût a.

en: and when they had brought them unto the magistrates, they said, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,
hmr: Chuongchun, thu rêltuhai kuomah an ṭhuoi a, “Hienghai hi Judahai an na, kan khuo an sukbuoi bêk bêk a,

en: and set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to receive, or to observe, being Romans.
hmr: dân kan pawm thiengnaw le kan zâwm thiengnaw dâm an hril a, Rom mi kan ni sih a,” an ta.

en: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent their garments off them, and commanded to beat them with rods.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipuihai khawm chu tirkohai thaw ding chun an hung inthawk veh a, thu rêltuhai chun an puonhai an the thlâkpêk a, hmawla vuok thu an pêk a.

en: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:
hmr: Chun, vawi tamtak an vuok zoin intângna inah an khum a, a vêngtu kuomah himtaka vêng ding an ti tlat a.

en: who, having received such a charge, cast them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
hmr: Chuong ang lâwma thu an pêk leiin rip sûngrilah a khum a, an kehaia chun thing kawl ân buntir a.

en: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns unto God, and the prisoners were listening to them;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, zân rila chun, Paula le Sila chu Pathien kuomah an ṭawngṭai a, hla an sak a, intânghai chun an ngai a;

en: and suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison-house were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened; and every one’s bands were loosed.
hmr: chun, kârloin simkhawleihnuoi nasatakin a hung inhnîng a; chun, kawtkhâr po po chu ân hawng nghâl a, mi tin kawl bunhai chu a hung insût vawng tah a.

en: And the jailor, being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword and was about to kill himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.
hmr: Chun, a vêngtu a ininnghil chu a hung har a, intângna in kawt- khârhai chu inhawngin a hmuh a, intânghai chu an tlân hmang amanih a ta, kâwlhnâm a phawi a, insukhlum a tum a.

en: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Paula chu rawl inringtakin a khêk a, “Iengkhawm inlaw naw, kan rêngin hitaka hin kan la um vawng annâwm,” a ta.

en: And he called for lights and sprang in, and, trembling for fear, fell down before Paul and Silas,
hmr: Chun, a vêngtu chun khâwn- varhai a lam a, ân châwm lût a, ṭia inthin pumin Paula le Sila hmaah a bawkkhup a.

en: and brought them out and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
hmr: Anni chu a ṭhuoi suok a, “Puhai, sandama um dingin ieng am ka thaw ding?” a ta.

en: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus, and thou shalt be saved, thou and thy house.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Lalpa Isu ring la, chuongchun, sandamin um i tih, nang le i sûnghai leh,” an ta.

en: And they spake the word of the Lord unto him, with all that were in his house.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma le a ina um po pohai kuoma chun Pathien thu an hril a.

en: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, immediately.
hmr: Chu zân chun, chu lai le le chun, a ṭhuoi a, an vuokna invuolhai chu a sâwpfai a; chun, ama le a sûnghai po po chun baptisma an chang nghâl tah a.

en: And he brought them up into his house, and set food before them, and rejoiced greatly, with all his house, having believed in God.
hmr: Chun, a inah a hang ṭhuoi a, fâk ding a pêk a, chun, Pathien an ring leiin, ama chu, a sûnghai po po le chun an hlim ta bêk bêk a.

en: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.
hmr: Chun, nisa a suok chun rorêltuhai chun, “Kha hai kha insuo rawh,” ti dingin manmihai an tir a.

en: And the jailor reported the words to Paul, saying, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore come forth, and go in peace.
hmr: Chun, intângna in vêngtu chun, Paula kuomah an thu a hril a, “Rorêltuhai chun insuo ding cheuin mi an hung tir a; chuleiin, tuhin hung suok unla, thlamuongtakin fe ro,” a ta.

en: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men that are Romans, and have cast us into prison; and do they now cast us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and bring us out.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Paula chun an kuomah, “Rom mi kan ni sih a, kan thiem le kan thiem naw hre loin vântlâng mithmuin an mi vuok a, intângna inah an mi khum a; tuhin inrûkin an mi hnawt suok vei ding a ni maw? Ni der naw ni; anni ngei hung hai sienla mi hung ṭhuoi suok raw hai se,” a ta.

en: And the serjeants reported these words unto the magistrates: and they feared when they heard that they were Romans;
hmr: Chuongchun, manmihai chun, chuong thu chu rorêltuhai kuoma chun an hril a. Chun, Rom mi an nih ti an hriet chun an ṭi tah a.

en: and they came and besought them; and when they had brought them out, they asked them to go away from the city.
hmr: An va feh a, an thlêm a, an ṭhuoi suok a, khuoa inthawk chun fe hmang dingin an ngên a.

en: And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
hmr: Chun, intângna ina inthawk chun an suok a, Luda ina chun an lût a; chun, unauhai chu an hmuh a, an thlamuon a, an suok tah a.

en: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:
hmr: Chun, Amphipoli le Apollonia an khêl a, Thessalonika an tlung tah a; chutaka chun Judahai inkhâwmna in a um a.

en: and Paul, as his custom was, went in unto them, and for three sabbath days reasoned with them from the scriptures,
hmr: Chun, Paula, a dân pângngaiin, an kuomah a lût a, Châwlni vawi thum Pathien Lekha Thua inthawkin nguntakin a suipui a,

en: opening and alleging that it behooved the Christ to suffer, and to rise again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom, said he, I proclaim unto you, is the Christ.
hmr: Krista chu rinum tuor ding a ni hrimzie dâm, mithi laia inthawka thonâwk ding a ni hrimzie dâm a hrilfieh a; a suklang hlak a, “Hi Isu a thu ka hril cheu hi, ama chu Krista a nih,” a ti bawk hlak a.

en: And some of them were persuaded, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni laia ṭhenkhat chu zâwrthlûkin an um tah a, Paula le Sila chu an pâwl tah a; Pathien ngaisak Grik mipui nasatak le nuhmei ṭhuoitu tamtak leh.

en: But the Jews, being moved with jealousy, took unto them certain vile fellows of the rabble, and gathering a crowd, set the city on an uproar; and assaulting the house of Jason, they sought to bring them forth to the people.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Judahaiin an huphur a; dâwr hmuna mi suol thabo tuhai amanih an kuomah an ṭhuoi a, mipui an ko khâwm a, khuo po po chu an chawkbuoi a, Jason in an hung ṭhâwng a, vântlâng laia ṭhuoi suok tumin.

en: And when they found them not, they dragged Jason and certain brethren before the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;
hmr: Chun, anni chu an hmu nawh a, Jason le unau dang tuhai amanih khaw hotuhai kuomah an kei lût a, an khêk a, “Khawvêl chawk- buoituhai kha hitaka khawm hin an hung a,

en: whom Jason hath received: and these all act contrary to the decrees of Cæsar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.
hmr: Jason hin a lo intlungtir vei a; hienghai po po hi, ‘A hming Isu, lal dang a um,’ tiin Kaisar thu kalin an um hlak a nih,” an ta.

en: And they troubled the multitude and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.
hmr: Chun, mipui le khaw hotuhai chun chuong thu chu an hang hriet chun an buoi tah a;

en: And when they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.
hmr: chun, Jason le unau danghai kuoma inthawka an aia hrên ding iengkhat an lâk a, an insuo tah a.

en: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Beroea: who when they were come thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.
