hmr: Chun, unauhai chun a zân a zânin Paula le Sila chu Beroia khuoah an infetir nghâl tah a; chutaka an va tlung chun, Judahai inkhâwmna inah an lût a.

en: Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, examining the scriptures daily, whether these things were so.
hmr: Chutaka mihai chu Thes- salonika mihai nêk chun an lo ṭha lem a, chuongchun, lungril lâwmtakin thu chu an pawm a, an thu hril chu ân dik le ân dik naw hrietna dingin ni tin Pathien Lekhaah an zawng hlak a.

en: Many of them therefore believed; also of the Greek women of honorable estate, and of men, not a few.
hmr: Chuongchun, chuong mihai tamtak chun an ring tah a; Grik nuhmei inzaumhai le pasalhai khawmin duoiin an ring ta nawh a.

en: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed of Paul at Beroea also, they came thither likewise, stirring up and troubling the multitudes.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Thessalonikaa Judahai chun Paulain Beroia khuoah Pathien thu a hril ti an hriet phingleh, chutaka khawm chun an va feh a, mipuihai an infui a, an buoi nâwk tah a.

en: And then immediately the brethren sent forth Paul to go as far as to the sea: and Silas and Timothy abode there still.
hmr: Chuongchun, unauhaiin tuisuo- riet chena fe dingin Paula chu an tir suok tah a, Sila le Timothe ruok chu chutaka chun an la um zing a.

en: But they that conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens: and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timothy that they should come to him with all speed, they departed.
hmr: Chun, Paula ṭhuoituhai chun Atheni chenin an ṭhuoi a; chun, Sila le Timothe chu inhmawtaka a kuoma fe vakna ding thu incha chu phurin an kîr tah a.

en: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him as he beheld the city full of idols.
hmr: Chun, Paulain Atheniah anni chu a lo nghâk laiin, khuo chu Pathien lima sipin a hmuh a, a lungril a helkam tah a.

en: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with them that met him.
hmr: Chuongchun, inkhâwmna inah Judahai le Pathien ngaisakhai a sêl hlak a, dâwr hmuna dâm khawm, chutaka hung um taphawthai chu ni tin a lo sêl bawk hlak a.

en: And certain also of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers encountered him. And some said, What would this babbler say? others, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached Jesus and the resurrection.
hmr: Chun, Epikuria mi le Stoik mi laia mi var tuhai amanih khawmin ama chu an hung sêl a, a ṭhenin, “Hi mipa bautam hin ieng am hril a tum a?” an ta. A ṭhenin, (Isu thu le thonâwkna thu a hril leiin,) “Ram dang pathienhai thu hriltu a ni âwm ie,” an ta.

en: And they took hold of him, and brought him unto the Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by thee?
hmr: Chun, ama chu an chel a, Areopagia chun an hung ṭhuoi a, a kuomah, “Hi inchûktirna thar i hril hlak hi mîn hriettir thei i ti?

en: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.
hmr: Thilmak ieng amanih kan naah i hung intlun a nih; chuleiin, hieng thil umzie hi hriet kan nuom,” an ta.

en: (Now all the Athenians and the strangers sojourning there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.)
hmr: (Athenia mi po po chu, an khuoa mikhuol umhai khawm, an inhman chang taphawt chu thu thar chu hrilin amanih, ngaiin amani bêk an um zing hlak hrim a na).

en: And Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus, and said, Ye men of Athens, in all things I perceive that ye are very religious.
hmr: Chun, Paula chu Areopagi lai taka chun a ngîr a, a hril a, “Nangni Athenia mihai, iengkimah sakhaw ngaisaktak mi in ni ti ka hriet a.

en: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription, TO AN UNKNOWN GOD. What therefore ye worship in ignorance, this I set forth unto you.
hmr: Ka lêng malama, chibai in ibûkhai ka en laiin, mâichâm pakhat, a chungah, ‘HRIET NAW PATHIEN TA DING,’ tia ziek ka hmu a nih. Chuongchun, hre loa chibai in ibûk hlak kha, ama thu chu ka hril cheu a ni hi.

en: The God that made the world and all things therein, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands;
hmr: Pathien, khawvêl le a sûnga thil po po siemtu chu, hnuoi le vân lal a ni leiin, kuta bâwl inhaiah a um nawh.

en: neither is he served by men’s hands, as though he needed anything, seeing he himself giveth to all life, and breath, and all things;
hmr: Thil tlasam angin mihriem kuta rawngbâwlpêkin a um bawk nawh. Ama ngei chu iengkim kuoma hringnahai, inthuoknahai, le thil po po petu chu a ni lem.

en: and he made of one every nation of men to dwell on all the face of the earth, having determined their appointed seasons, and the bounds of their habitation;
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chung po poa um dingin, bul hmunkhatin hnam tin mi a siem a. An ta dingin hun bihai a ruot a, an umna rihai khawm a khang pêk a;

en: that they should seek God, if haply they might feel after him and find him, though he is not far from each one of us:
hmr: Pathien an zawng a, an dap an dap a, an hmu hrâmna dingin; nisienlakhawm, ama chun a mi hlat naw seng si.

en: for in him we live, and move, and have our being; as certain even of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.
hmr: Ama leiin, ei hring, ei châng, ei um a ni sih a; nangni hlaphuokthiem tuhai amani khawmin, ‘Eini khawm a thlahai ei nih,’ tia an hril ang khan.

en: Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art and device of man.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathien thlahai ei ni hnung chu, Pathien pangti chu, rângkachak dâm, tangka dâm, lung dâm, mihriem themthiem le remruot- a suthai ang hi amanih ei ti ding a ni nawh.

en: The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked; but now he commandeth men that they should all everywhere repent:
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin ei hriet naw laihai kha hriet naw tehlêm a thaw hlak a; nisienlakhawm, tuhin chu ram tina mi po po sim ding thu a pêk tah a nih, ni a tiem leiin;

en: inasmuch as he hath appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead.
hmr: chu ni chun, a mi ruot chu, hnuoia mihai ro feltakin inrêltir a tih. Chu thu chu, Pathienin ama chu mithi laia inthawka a keithona chun, mi po po kuomah ân hriettir tah a nih,” tiin.

en: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; but others said, We will hear thee concerning this yet again.
hmr: Chun, mithi laia inthawka thonâwkna thu chu an hriet phingleh a ṭhenin an nuisan a; a ṭhenin, “Hi thu hi i kuomah la ngai nâwk kan tih,” an ta.

en: Thus Paul went out from among them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Paula chu anni laia inthawkin a suok tah a.

en: But certain men clave unto him, and believed: among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi tuhai ama- nih a kuomah an ṭhang ta tlat a, an ring tah a; anni laia ṭhenkhathai chu Areopagia rorêltu pâwla mi Dionusia le, nuhmei pakhat a hming, Damari le, an kuoma mi danghai le chun an nih.

en: After these things he departed from Athens, and came to Corinth.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun Paula chu Athenia inthawk chu a suok a, Korinthah a fe tah a.

en: And he found a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by race, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome: and he came unto them;
hmr: Chun, a hming Akuila, Juda pakhat a hmuh a, ama chu Ponto rama pieng a nih; Klaudiin Juda po po Roma inthawka suok thu a pêk leiin a nuhmei Priskilla leh Itali rama inthawka hung hlim an nih.

en: and because he was of the same trade, he abode with them, and they wrought; for by their trade they were tentmakers.
hmr: Chun, Paula chu anni ina chun a tlung tah a; chun, an sinthaw ang thaw a ni leiin anni a hrawn a, an kuomah a thaw ve hlak a; an sinthaw chu puon in siem a nih.

en: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded Jews and Greeks.
hmr: Châwlni po leh inkhâwmna inah ṭhahnemngaitakin thu a hril hlak a, Judahai le Grikhai chu thlêmthlûk a tum hlak a.

en: But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was constrained by the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
hmr: Chun, Sila le Timothe chu Makedonia rama inthawka an hung thla chun, Paula chu thu hril chauin a um tah a, Isu kha Krista a nih ti Judahai chu a hrilfie a. Nisien- lakhawm, an kalin an hrilpâwi a,

en: And when they opposed themselves and blasphemed, he shook out his raiment and said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.
hmr: Paulân a puon a thin a, an kuomah, “In thina maw chu nangnîn phur ro, kei chu ka hul a nih, tuta chen chu Jentailhai lai fe tâng ka tih,” a ta.

en: And he departed thence, and went into the house of a certain man named Titus Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the synagogue.
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawk chun a feh a, a hming Tita Justa mi pakhat inah a lût a, ama chun Pathien a biek hlak a; a in khawm chu inkhâwmna in le inzawm a nih.

en: And Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his house; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed, and were baptized.
hmr: Chun, Krispa, inkhâwmna hotu chun, a sûnghai po po leh Lalpa an ring a, Korinth khuoa mi tamtak khawmin an hriet a, an ring a, baptisma an chang tah a.

en: And the Lord said unto Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak and hold not thy peace:
hmr: Chun, zânah Lalpain Paula kuoma chun mang angin, “Ṭi naw la, to loin thu hril pei rawh,

en: for I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to harm thee: for I have much people in this city.
hmr: kei i kuomah ka um annâwm, sukna ding chein tukhawmin i chungah kut thlâk naw ni hai; hi khuoa hin mi tamtak ka nei sih a,” a ta.

en: And he dwelt there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
hmr: Chun, Paula chu chutaka chun, an kuomah Pathien thu inchûktirin kum khat le thla ruk a um a.

en: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment-seat,
hmr: Chun, Gallio, Akaia rama lal aiawa a um laiin Judahaiin inthu- ruolin Paula an thaw a, rorêlna ṭhungpha hmaah an ṭhuoi a,

en: saying, This man persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.
hmr: “Hi mipa hrep hin Dân naw anga Pathien be dingin mi a thlêm- thlûk hlak a nih,” an ta.

en: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked villany, O ye Jews, reason would that I should bear with you:
hmr: Chun, Paulain a dawn tâwmin, Gallio chun Judahai kuomah, “Judahai, hieng hi thil indiknaw thu amanih bêk ni sienla, matheiloin ngaisak ka ti cheu a;

en: but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves; I am not minded to be a judge of these matters.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, thuhai, hming- hai, nangni dân chung thuhai mei mei a ni chun, nangnîn rêl lem ro; kei chu chuong ang thu chu ngaituo ka nuom nawh ie,” a ta.

en: And he drove them from the judgment-seat.
hmr: Chun, rorêlna ṭhungphaa in- thawk chun anni chu a hnawt hmang tah a.

en: And they all laid hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment-seat. And Gallio cared for none of these things.
hmr: Chun, Grik mihai po poin inkhâwmna in hotu Sosthen an man a, rorêlna ṭhungpha hmaa chun an vuok a. Gallio chun chuong an thilthaw chu ienga khawm a ngai nawh.

en: And Paul, having tarried after this yet many days, took his leave of the brethren, and sailed thence for Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila: having shorn his head in Cenchreæ; for he had a vow.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun, Paula chu ni sâwttak a la châm zing a; chu zoa chun, unauhai chu ṭawng- bauṭhain a ṭheh a, chutaka inthawk chu Suria ram tieng lawngin a fe tah a, a kuomah Priskilla le Akuila chu an fe ve bawk a; Paulain thutiem a nei leiin Kenkrieiah a lu a vâw zet a.

en: And they came to Ephesus, and he left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.
hmr: Chun, Ephesi chu an tlung a, chutaka chun anni chu a mâksan tah a; ama ruok chu inkhâwmna inah a lût a, Judahai kuomah ṭhahnem- ngaitakin thu a hril hrih a.

en: And when they asked him to abide a longer time, he consented not;
hmr: Chun, sâwt deu châm dingin an ngên a, nisienlakhawm, a remti nawh a,

en: but taking his leave of them, and saying, I will return again unto you if God will, he set sail from Ephesus.
hmr: “Pathienin a phal chun, in kuomah la hung nâwk ka tih,” tiin ṭawngbauṭhain a ṭheh a; Ephesia inthawk chu lawngin a fe tah a.

en: And when he had landed at Cæsarea, he went up and saluted the church, and went down to Antioch.
hmr: Chun, lawnga inthawk chu Kaisariah a suok a, Jerusalemah a hang feh a, kohranhai chu chibai a bûk a; chun, chu zoa chun, Antiokeiah a zu fe tah a.

en: And having spent some time there, he departed, and went through the region of Galatia, and Phrygia, in order, establishing all the disciples.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun sâwt rei a um hnungin, a fe nâwk a, inchûktir- hai po po sukdetin Galati ram le Phru- gia ram chu a fang suok vawng a.

en: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by race, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus; and he was mighty in the scriptures.
hmr: Chun, Juda pakhat a hming Apollo, Alexandria khuoa pieng, thuhril theitak, Ephesia chun a zu feh a; ama chun Pathien Lekha thuhai a hriet nasa bêk bêk a.

en: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spake and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, knowing only the baptism of John:
hmr: Ama chu Lalpa Lam thu in- chûktir tah a na, lungrila ṭhahnem- ngaitak a ni leiin Isu chanchin nguntakin a hril a, ân chuktir hlak a, Johan baptisma thu chau a hriet sih a.

en: and he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him unto them, and expounded unto him the way of God more accurately.
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmna inah huoi- takin thu a hril phut tah a. Chuongchun, Priskilla le Akuila chun a thu hril an hrietin; an inah an ṭhuoi a, a kuomah Pathien Lam thu fel nâwk zuolin an hrilfie tah a.

en: And when he was minded to pass over into Achaia, the brethren encouraged him, and wrote to the disciples to receive him: and when he was come, he helped them much that had believed through grace;
hmr: Chun, ama chun Akaia rama fe kai a tum phingleh unauhaiin an infui a, ama an lo lâwmna dingin inchûktirhai kuomah lekha an ziekpêk a. Chun, a tlung chun, Pathien lunginsietna leia ringtuhai chu nasatakin a ṭhangpui a.

en: for he powerfully confuted the Jews, and that publicly, showing by the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.
hmr: Vantlâng hrietin Judahai chu nasatakin a sêldawng a, Pathien Lekha Thu hmangin Isu kha Krista chu a nih ti ân hriettir hlak a.

en: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper country came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples:
hmr: Chun, Paula chu khaw sak biel a fang suok zet a, Apollo Korintha a um kâr khan Ephesi chu a tlung a, inchûktir tuhai amanih a hmuh a;

en: and he said unto them, Did ye receive the Holy Spirit when ye believed? And they said unto him, Nay, we did not so much as hear whether the Holy Spirit was given.
hmr: chun, ama chun an kuomah, “In ring tîr lai khan Thlarau Inthieng in chang am?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Chang lo, Thlarau Inthieng a um ti khawm kan hriet nawh,” an ta.

en: And he said, Into what then were ye baptized? And they said, Into John’s baptism.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ieng baptisma am in chang a?” a ta. Anni chun, “Johan baptisma,” an ta.

en: And Paul said, John baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people that they should believe on him that should come after him, that is, on Jesus.
hmr: Chun, Paula chun, “Johan khan chu mi kuomah, ‘A mi hung zuitu ding, (Isu chu) in la ring ding a nih,’ tiin simna baptismain a baptis hlak a ni kha,” a ta.

en: And when they heard this, they were baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.
hmr: Chu thu chu an hriet phingleh, Lalpa Isu hmingin baptisma an chang tah a.

en: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Spirit came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.
hmr: Chun, Paulain an chungah a kut ân nghat a, Thlarau Inthieng chu an chungah a hung tlung tah a; chuong- chun ṭawng hrietnaw haiin thu an hril a, Pathien thu khawm an hril tah a.

en: And they were in all about twelve men.
hmr: An rêng chun patling sâwm le pahni lai an nih.

en: And he entered into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, reasoning and persuading as to the things concerning the kingdom of God.
hmr: Chun, Paula chu inkhâwmna inah a lût hlak a, thla thum lai huoitakin thu a hril a, Pathien ram kawng thua chun a sêl a, mi a thlêmthlûk hlak a.

en: But when some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a ṭhen chu an kawmaw a, an awi nuom nawh a, mipui hmaah Lam thu chu an hrilsiet phingleh, ama chun anni a fe san a, inchûktirhai chu a kei hran a, ni tin Turanna inchûktirnaah a sêl hlak a.

en: And this continued for the space of two years; so that all they that dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks.
hmr: Chuong ang ruok chun kum hni lai a thawh a; chuongchun, Asia rama um po po, Judahai le Grikhai khawm- in, Lalpa thu chu an hriet ta rau a.

en: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Paula kutin thilmak namên ân thawtir nawh a.

en: insomuch that unto the sick were carried away from his body handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out.
hmr: Chuongchun, a taksaa in- thawka inhrûkna puonhai amanih, fênthuohai amanih damnawhai kuomah an hung chawi a, an natna- hai a bo hlak a, an sûnga inthawkin khawhrihai khawm an suok hlak a.

en: But certain also of the strolling Jews, exorcists, took upon them to name over them that had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying, I adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.
hmr: Chun, Juda invai, thieminzawr tuhaiin amanih, “Paulain a thu a ikhêkpui hlak Isu hmingin kan vau che,” tiin khawhri vawnhai chung- ah Lalpa Isu hming an lam hlak a.

en: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, a chief priest, who did this.
hmr: Chun, Juda mi, thiempu lal pakhat, Skeva chun chuong ang thaw ve hlak naupasal pasari a nei a.

en: And the evil spirit answered and said unto them, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, khawhri chun an kuomah, “Isu ka awi, Paula khawm ka hriet, nangni ruok chu tuhai am in ni leh?” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and mastered both of them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
hmr: Chun, khawhri vawn chun a hung bawh a, an pahni chun a hneh a, a ngam ta lem a, chuongchun, chu ina inthawk chun ruok le hliemin an tlân suok ta rau a.

en: And this became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, that dwelt at Ephesus; and fear fell upon them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ephesia um po po, Judahai le Grikhai kuoma chun, chu thu chu ân thang tah a. Chuongchun, an rêngin an ṭih a, Lalpa Isu hming a lien tah a.

en: Many also of them that had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds.
hmr: Chun, ringnawhai khawm chu a ṭhen tamtak an hung a, an thilthaw- hai thupha an chawi a, an inphuong tah a.

en: And not a few of them that practised magical arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all; and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
hmr: Dawihmang a ṭhen tamtak khawmin an lekhabuhai an hung chawi khâwm a, mi po po mithmuah an raw tah a; chun a man an sût a, tangka sîng nga niin an hriet.

en: So mightily grew the word of the Lord and prevailed.
hmr: Chuong ang lâwma nasa chun Lalpa thu chu ân dar a, a hne ta pei a.

en: Now after these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.
hmr: Chun, chuong zoa chun Paulain, Makedonia ram le Akaia ram chu fang suok phawt a, Jerusalema fe a lungril a, “Chutaka ka fe zo chun Rom ka sir bawk ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And having sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.
hmr: Chuongchun, a ṭhangpuitu pahni, Timothe le Erasta chu, Make- doniaah ân fetir zet a, ama ruok chu Asia ramah a um hrih a.

en: And about that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way.
hmr: Chun, chuong lai vêl chun Lam thu lei chun mi buoi namênin an buoi ta nawh a.

en: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Diana, brought no little business unto the craftsmen;
hmr: Mi pakhat a hming Demetria, tangkaruo suttu, tangkaruoa Diana biekna in siemtu chun, a siemthiem- hai kuomah inhlawna tamtak a pêk hlak a.

en: whom he gathered together, with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this business we have our wealth.
hmr: Ama chun anni chu a ko khâwm a, an sinthaw ang thawtuhai leh; chun, an kuomah, “Puhai, hi sin hi ei hausakna a nih ti in hriet.

en: And ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they are no gods, that are made with hands:
hmr: Hitaka Ephesi chaua hin ni loin Asia ram khawvêl po po deu thawa khawm, hi Paula hin, ‘Kuta siem pathienhai hi Pathien an ni nawh,’ tiin mi tamtak a thlêmthlûk a, ân kaitir zo tah ti nangni ngeiin in hmuin in hriet bawk a.

en: and not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana be made of no account, and that she should even be deposed from her magnificence whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.
hmr: Chuongchun, ei sinthaw lân a tih ti chau khawm hi ni loin, pathiennu ropuitak Diana biekin khawm hi hung ngaitlâwm an ta, Asia rama mi po po le khawvêla miin an biek hlak hi, a ropui vei leh, tlâwm a tih ti ṭi a um bawk a nih,” a ta.

en: And when they heard this they were filled with wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu an hriet phingleh an lunginsen ta bêk bêk a, “Ephesia mi Diana hi ropuitak a nih!” tiin an khêk a.

en: And the city was filled with the confusion: and they rushed with one accord into the theatre, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel.
hmr: Chuongchun, a khuoin an buoi tah a, Gaia le Aristarka, Makedonia rama mi, Paula hnungzuituhai chu an man a, inthuruolin ennuom siemna inah an tlânpui a.

en: And when Paul was minded to enter in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
hmr: Chun, Paulain mipui lai lût a tum chun, inchûktirhai chun an phal nawh a.

en: And certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent unto him and besought him not to adventure himself into the theatre.
hmr: Chun, Asia rama hotutakhai laia ṭhenkhat tuhai amanih Paula ruolhai an na, a kuomah mi an tir a, ennuom siemna ina chun lût ṭâl lo dingin an ngên a.

en: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was in confusion; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.
hmr: Chun, umkhâwmhai chu an buoi a, mi tam lem chun an inkhâwmna san khawm an hriet nawh a, chuleiin ṭhenkhat thu pakhatin an khêk a, ṭhenkhat thu dangin an khêk a.

en: And they brought Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made a defence unto the people.
hmr: Chun, mipui laia mi ṭhenkhatin an thiemna thu hril dân ding chu Alexandra an hril a, Judahaiin ama chu mi hma tieng chun an nam lût a, Alexandra chun a kutin a zâp a, mi po po kuoma chun an thiemna thu hril a tum a.

en: But when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chu Juda mi a nih ti an hriet phingleh, dârkâr hni lai, rawl inruoltakin, “Ephesia mi Diana hi ropuitak a nih” ti ruokin an khêk a.

en: And when the townclerk had quieted the multitude, he saith, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there who knoweth not that the city of the Ephesians is temple-keeper of the great Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?
hmr: Chun, khaw lekhaziektuin mi- pui chu a vaudei zo chun, “Ephesia mihai, Diana ropuitak biekin le vâna inthawka milim tla kha, Ephesia mihai hi a vêngtu in ni ti, tû am a hre naw an um a?

en: Seeing then that these things cannot be gainsaid, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rash.
hmr: Chuongchun, hieng thu hi sêl ruol a ni naw hnung chun in to zing ding a nih, thu dâwn loin iengkhawm in thaw ding a ni nawh.

en: For ye have brought hither these men, who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of our goddess.
hmr: Hieng mihai hitaka in hung ṭhuoihai hi, biekin suomhmanghai an ni nawh a, ei pathiennu hrilsetu hlak an ni bawk nawh.

en: If therefore Demetrius, and the craftsmen that are with him, have a matter against any man, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls: let them accuse one another.
hmr: Chuongchun, Demetria le a ruol themthiemhai khawmin tû chunga khawm thupawi an nei chun thupawi hrilna inhai chu hawng zing a nih annâwm, lal aiawtuhai khawm an um a; insâl raw se.

en: But if ye seek anything about other matters, it shall be settled in the regular assembly.
hmr: Thil dang pawi hrim nei in ni chun inkhâwm pângngaiah rem an tih.

en: For indeed we are in danger to be accused concerning this day’s riot, there being no cause for it: and as touching it we shall not be able to give account of this concourse.
hmr: Vawisûna nasêtum lei hin suosal ṭiumin ei um ta hi, a bul um si loin; chuongchu a ni leiin, hi inkhâwmna san hi iengkhawm ei hril thei âwm naw hi,” a ta.

en: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
hmr: Chun, chuong ang thu a hril zo chun, umkhâwmhai chu ân ṭintir tah a.

en: And when the day of Pentecost was now come, they were all together in one place.
hmr: Chun, Pentikost ni a hung tlungin, an rêngin hmun khatah an um khâwm vawng a.

en: And suddenly there came from heaven a sound as of the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
hmr: Chun, kârloin vâna inthawkin ri thlipui hrâng angin a hung tlung ta phut a. Chu chun an ṭhungna in chu a suksip ta vawng a.

en: And there appeared unto them tongues parting asunder, like as of fire; and it sat upon each one of them.
hmr: Chun, leihai ama le ama insemin, mei angin an kuomah a hung inlâr ta a.

en: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
hmr: Chun, an chungah a chuong seng a, an rêngin Thlarau Inthiengin an sip ta vawng a, Thlarauin ân ṭawngtir ang peiin ṭawng danghaiin an lo ṭawng tah a.

en: Now there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven.
hmr: Chun, vânkhuphnuoia hnam tin laia mi Pathien ngaisak Judahai Jerusalemah an châm a.

en: And when this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speaking in his own language.
hmr: Chun, chu ri chu an hriet phingleh mipui an hung inkhâwm a, mi tinin an ṭawng chu mâni ṭawng sengin an lo hriet leiin an lungrilin an lo buoi a.

en: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying, Behold, are not all these that speak Galilæans?
hmr: Chun, an rêng chun an lunginzîng a, mak an ti hleh a; “En ta u, hieng a ṭawnghai po po hi Galili rama mi an ni naw am a nih?

en: And how hear we, every man in our own language wherein we were born?
hmr: Iengtiziea ei rênga ei ṭawng piengpui anga ei hriet seng am a na?

en: Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, in Judæa and Cappadocia, in Pontus and Asia,
hmr: Ṭhenkhat Parthai hnam dâm, Medai hnam dâm, Elamatai hnam dâm, ei ni sih a; Mesopotamia rama um dâm, Judai rama um dâm, Kappadoki rama um dâm, Ponto rama um dâm, Asia rama um dâm,

en: in Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and sojourners from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
hmr: Phrugia rama um dâm, Pamphulia rama um dâm, Aigupta rama um dâm, Kurini kâwl vêla Libu rama um ei na,

en: Cretans and Arabians, we hear them speaking in our tongues the mighty works of God.
hmr: ṭhenkhat Rom khaw mikhuol — Judahai le an saphunhai leh-ei na, ṭhenkhat Kret thlierkâra mi le Arab rama mi ei ni sih a; nisienlakhawm, Pathien thilthaw ropuihai an hril mâni ṭawng sengin ei hriet si hi!” an ta.

en: And they were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying one to another, What meaneth this?
hmr: Chun, an rêng chun mak an ti hleh a, a ngaina an hriet nawh a, “Hieng hi iengtizie am a na?” an in tih a.

en: But others mocking said, They are filled with new wine.
hmr: Ṭhenkhatin an nuisan a, “Uoin thar an inrui a ni hi,” an ta.

en: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spake forth unto them, saying, Ye men of Judæa, and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and give ear unto my words.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peter chu sâwm le pakhathai leh an ngîr a, ama chun rawl inringtakin, an kuomah a hril a, “Nangni Judai rama mihai, nangni Jerusalema um po pohai, hieng hi hre unla, ka thu khawm lo ngai ro.

en: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose; seeing it is but the third hour of the day;
hmr: Hienghai hi in ring angin an inrui nawh, vairik chau a la ni hi.

en: but this is that which hath been spoken through the prophet Joel:
hmr: Hieng hi zâwlnei Joelin a hril kha a ni lem:

en: And it shall be in the last days, saith God, I will pour forth of my Spirit upon all flesh: And your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, And your young men shall see visions, And your old men shall dream dreams:
hmr: Pathienin, ‘Ni nuhnungahai chun hieng hi nîng a ta, Mi po po chungah ka Thlarau buok ka ta; Chuongchun, in naupahai, in naunuhaiin ka thu hril an tih; In tlangvâlhaiin inlârnahai hmûng an ta, In tarhaiin mangah mang an ta;

en: Yea and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days Will I pour forth of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy.
hmr: Anih, chuong nia chun ka suokpahai, ka suoknuhai chunga khawm, Ka Thlarau buok ka ta, ka thu hril an tih,

en: And I will show wonders in the heaven above, And signs on the earth beneath; Blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke:
hmr: Chun, chungtieng vânah thilmakhai, Hnuoi tieng leihnuoiah inchiknahai inhmutir ka tih: Thisen dâm, mei dâm, meikhu hu dâm,

en: The sun shall be turned into darkness, And the moon into blood, Before the day of the Lord come, That great and notable day:
hmr: Nisa inthimin inchang a ta, Thla thisenin inchang a ta, Lalpa ni ropuitak le hminginthangtak chu A hung tlung hma chun;

en: And it shall be, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi nîng a ta, Tûkhawm Lalpa hming lam taphawt chu sandaminum an tih,’ a tih, a ti kha.

en: Ye men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God unto you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him in the midst of you, even as ye yourselves know;
hmr: “Nangni Israel mihai hieng thu hi lo ngai ro; Nazareth Isu chu, Pathienin nangni lai thilthaw mak dâm, thilmak dâm, inchikna dâm inthawtirin ân hriet chiengtir cheu kha,

en: him, being delivered up by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye by the hand of lawless men did crucify and slay:
hmr: Nangni ngeiin in hriet ang khan; kha mipa kha Pathien rêl tlat le hriet lâwk angin an inmantir a, nangnîn mi suolhai kutin krawsah in hemdeh a, in sukhlum tah a.

en: whom God raised up, having loosed the pangs of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.
hmr: Kha mipa kha Pathienin thina khuopnahai chu a sûtpêk a, a keitho tah a; ama chu thina chel sawng ruol a ni naw leiin.

en: For David saith concerning him, I beheld the Lord always before my face; For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:
hmr: Chun, David chun ama thu chu a hril a, ‘Ka hmaah kumkhuoin Lalpa chu ka hmu hlak, Kân hnîng nawna dingin ka changtieng a um a nih;

en: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced; Moreover my flesh also shall dwell in hope:
hmr: Chuleiin, ka lungril a hlim a, Ka lei khawm a lâwm a; Chuleiin, ka tisa khawm beiseitakin um bawk a tih;

en: Because thou wilt not leave my soul unto Hades, Neither wilt thou give thy Holy One to see corruption.
hmr: Ka thlarau mithi khuoah mâksan naw ti nih a, I mi inthieng hmawnhmangna hmu khawm phal naw ti nih a;

en: Thou madest known unto me the ways of life; Thou shalt make me full of gladness with thy countenance.
hmr: Nangin hringna lampuihai i mîn hriettir a, Nangin i hmêlin lâwmin mi suksip i tih,’ tiin.

en: Brethren, I may say unto you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us unto this day.
hmr: “Unauhai, chi thlatu David chanchin hi ṭi loin in kuomah ka hril cheu a; ama chu a thi a; phûm khawm an phûm tah annâwm, a thlân khawm tu chen hin ei kuomah a la um zing a.

en: Being therefore a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins he would set one upon his throne;
hmr: Ama chu zâwlnei a na, Pathienin a ṭhalbea mi tû amanih a ṭhungpha chungah ân ṭhungtir ding a nih ti inkhâmin a hril ti a hriet a.

en: he foreseeing this spake of the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was he left unto Hades, nor did his flesh see corruption.
hmr: Chuongchun, chuong chu a lo hriet lâwk zing leiin, Krista thonâwkna ding thu a hril a nih, ‘Mithi khuoah mâksanin a um nawh a, a ruong khawmin hmawnna a hmu bawk nawh,’ tiin.

en: This Jesus did God raise up, whereof we all are witnesses.
hmr: Chu Isu chu Pathienin a keitho nâwk ta hrim a, chu chu kan rêng hin a hretu kan nih.

en: Being therefore by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he hath poured forth this, which ye see and hear.
hmr: Pathien kut changtienga chawi- mawiin a um a, Thlarau Inthieng tiem chu Pa kuoma inthawkin a hmuh a, in hmu le in hriet hi a hung buok a ni hi.

en: For David ascended not into the heavens: but he saith himself, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
hmr: David chu vânah a hang lâwn naw a nih, ama ngeiin, ‘Lalpa chun ka Lalpa kuomah, Ka changtieng ṭhung zing rawh,

en: Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet.
hmr: I hmêlmahai i kepha innghatnaa Ka siem hmakhat chu,’ a tih a, a ti lem a ni kha.

en: Let all the house of Israel therefore know assuredly, that God hath made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom ye crucified.
hmr: “Chuongchun, Isu in hemde ngei kha, Pathienin Lal le Krista ni fâwmin a siem tah ti, Israel hnam tinin hre mawl raw se,” a ta.

en: Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and the rest of the apostles, Brethren, what shall we do?
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu an hrietin an lungrilah sun ang an lo ni tah a, Peter le tirko danghai kuoma chun, “Unauhai, iengtin am thaw tâng kan ta?” an tih a.

en: And Peter said unto them, Repent ye, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ unto the remission of your sins; and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Peter chun an kuomah, “In suolhai ngaidamna dingin, sim unla, Isu Krista hmingin baptisma chang seng ro; chuongchun, Thlarau Inthieng pêk hi hmûng in tih.

en: For to you is the promise, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call unto him.
hmr: A tiem kha, nangni ta ding khawmin, in nauhai ta ding khawmin, hlataka mi po po ta ding khawmin, Lalpa ei Pathienin a kuoma a kohai taphawt ta dingin a nih ie,” a ta.

en: And with many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, Save yourselves from this crooked generation.
hmr: Chun, thu dang tamtakin a hrilfieh a, “Tulai ruolthar rilohaia in- thawk hin insukhim ro,” tiin ân fui a.

en: They then that received his word were baptized: and there were added unto them in that day about three thousand souls.
hmr: Chun, a thu zâwm taphawt chun baptisma an chang tah a; chu nia chun mi sâng thum lai belsain an um a.

en: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread and the prayers.
hmr: Chun, tirkohai inchûktirin, in- pâwlin, bei khawiin, ṭawngṭaiin ṭhahnemngaitakin an um zing a.

en: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.
hmr: Chun, mi tinin an ṭi tah a; tirkohai chun thilmak le inchikna tamtak an thawh a.

en: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;
hmr: Chun, a ring taphawt chun iengkim an inṭâwm a,

en: and they sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all, according as any man had need.
hmr: an thil neihai, an thuom- hnawhai an zawr a, an mamaw dai tâwk seng chauin an rênga kuoma chun an sem hlak.

en: And day by day, continuing stedfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart,
hmr: Ni tin lungril hmunkhatin Pathien biekina chun ṭhahnem- ngaitakin an um hlak a, an in tieng khawm bei an khawi a, hlimtak le lungawitakin bu an fâk hlak a.

en: praising God, and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to them day by day those that were saved.
hmr: Pathien an inpâk a, mi po po lâwmzâwngin an um hlak. Chun, sandama hung um pei taphawthai chu, Lalpain ni tin an kuomah ân ṭhangsatir pei hlak.

en: And after the uproar ceased, Paul having sent for the disciples and exhorted them, took leave of them, and departed to go into Macedonia.
hmr: Chun, nasêtum chu a re zo chun, Paulain inchûktirhai ân kotir a, ân fui a, ṭawng bauṭhain a ṭheh a, Makedonia rama fe dingin a suok tah a.

en: And when he had gone through those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece.
hmr: Chun, thu tamtaka inchûktirhai infui peiin chu ram chu a fang suok a, Grik ram a tlung tah a.

en: And when he had spent three months there, and a plot was laid against him by the Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he determined to return through Macedonia.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun thla thum a thang hnungin Suria ram tieng lawngin a fe ding a na, Judahaiin ama an phierrûk leiin Makedonia rama fe nghâl a tum nâwk lem tah a.

en: And there accompanied him as far as Asia, Sopater of Beroea, the son of Pyrrhus; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.
hmr: Chun, Purrha naupa Sopater Beroia khuoa mi hai, Thessalonikaa mi Aristarka le Sekunda hai, Derbea mi Gaia hai, Timothe hai, Asia ram mi Tukik le Trophim hai, ama leh Asia rama chun an va fe veh a.

en: But these had gone before, and were waiting for us at Troas.
hmr: Chuonghai chun kan hma an ṭhuoi a, Troasa chun an mi lo nghâk zing a.

en: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread, and came unto them to Troas in five days; where we tarried seven days.
hmr: Keini ruok chu Chawlṭhanglo Bei ruoiṭhe ni po po hnunga chun Philippia inthawk chu lawngin kan suok a, ni nga chenah Troasah an kuom kan tlung a; chutaka chun ni sari kan châm a.

en: And upon the first day of the week, when we were gathered together to break bread, Paul discoursed with them, intending to depart on the morrow; and prolonged his speech until midnight.
hmr: Chun, ni saria ni hmasataka chun, bei khawi dinga kan um khâwm laiin, Paulain a zînga fe a tum leiin ṭhahnemngaitakin thu a hril a; zân ril chenin thu a hril pei a.

en: And there were many lights in the upper chamber where we were gathered together.
hmr: Chun, pindan chunghnung kan um khâwmnaa chun khâwnvar tamtak a um a.

en: And there sat in the window a certain young man named Eutychus, borne down with deep sleep; and as Paul discoursed yet longer, being borne down by his sleep he fell down from the third story, and was taken up dead.
hmr: Chun, a hming Eutuk, tlangvâl pakhat tukvera chun a ṭhung a, a lo inlusu a lo inlusuh a. Paula thuhril chu a sâwt ta leiin a îmu suok chu a tuor ta nawh a, in sâwng thumnaa inthawk chun a tla tah a, a thiin an lâk tah a.

en: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracing him said, Make ye no ado; for his life is in him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Paula a ṭum a, a zu bawh a, a zu pawm a, “Thla- phâng naw ro, a hnuk a la chat nawh,” a ta.

en: And when he was gone up, and had broken the bread, and eaten, and had talked with them a long while, even till break of day, so he departed.
hmr: Chun, Paula a hang lâwn nâwk a, bei chu a khawi a, bu a fâk a, sâwttak, khawvar rakin an kuomah thukhawchâng a hril a, chu hnunga chun a fe tah a.

en: And they brought the lad alive, and were not a little comforted.
hmr: Chun, tleirawl chu damin an ṭhuoi a, thlamuong namênin an thlamuong ta nawh a.

en: But we, going before to the ship, set sail for Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, intending himself to go by land.
hmr: Chun, keini ruok chu lawngah kan lo fe tah a, Asso pan dingin lawng chun kan suok hmasa a, chutaka chun Paula chu inchuongtir kan tum a; ama chun kea hung a tum leiin chuong ang chun amain a ruot hrim a nih.

en: And when he met us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.
hmr: Chun, Assoah a mi hung pâwl nâwk chun kan inchuongtir tah a, Mitulin kan tlung a.

en: And sailing from thence, we came the following day over against Chios; and the next day we touched at Samos; and the day after we came to Miletus.
hmr: Chutaka inthawk chun lawngin kan fe nâwk a, a zînga chun Kia thlierkâr zâwn kan tlung a; a zing nâwk Sami thlierkâr kan sir a; chu zîng nâwk chun Mileti kan tlung nâwk a.

en: For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus, that he might not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hastening, if it were possible for him, to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost.
hmr: Chun, Paulain Asia rama um sâwt a nuom naw leiin, Ephesi chu lawnga khêl a tum sa hrim a na, a thei chun Jerusalemah Penti- kost ni nang a tum a, a fe inhmaw a nih,

en: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called to him the elders of the church.
hmr: Chun, Miletia inthawkin Ephe- siah mi a tir a, kohrana upahai a kuomah ân kotir a.

en: And when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, after what manner I was with you all the time,
hmr: Chun, a kuoma an hung tlung chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Asia ram ka sir hlima inthawk tah, in kuoma ka um sûng po khan ka um dân kha in hriet a.

en: serving the Lord with all lowliness of mind, and with tears, and with trials which befell me by the plots of the Jews;
hmr: Judahaiin an mi phierrûk leia mitthli tla le, thil rinum ka chunga tlahai tuor pumin thuhnuoirawltakin Lalpa rawng ka bâwl hlak kha.

en: how I shrank not from declaring unto you anything that was profitable, and teaching you publicly, and from house to house,
hmr: Khâng khan a sâwt ding thil chu in kuomah iengkhawm hril intîm ka nei nawh a, vantlâng lai dâm inchûktir ka ma naw kha.

en: testifying both to Jews and to Greeks repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
hmr: Judahai le Grikhai kuoma khawm Pathien tienga lungril inlet thu le, ei Lalpa Isu Krista tieng ringna ding thu kân hriettir hlak kha.

en: And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:
hmr: Chun, hre ro, tuhin lungrila fe lo thei loa kân hriet leiin, Jerusalemah ka fe ding a ni hi, chutaka chun ka chunga thil hung tlung ding chin ka hriet nawh.

en: save that the Holy Spirit testifieth unto me in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions abide me.
hmr: Thlarau Inthiengin ‘Khuopna le rinumnain a tuok che’, tiin khaw tinah a mîn hriettir hlak, chu chau chu ka hriet a nih.

en: But I hold not my life of any account as dear unto myself, so that I may accomplish my course, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, kân tlânsiekna lam ka hmabâk suo ding le, Pathien lunginsietzie Chanchin Ṭha in- hriettir ding, Lalpa Isua inthawka kha rawngbâwl sin ka hmu kha, thaw zo phawt lang chu, ka hringna khawm thlâkhlâ tlâkah ka ruot nawh.

en: And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I went about preaching the kingdom, shall see my face no more.
hmr: “Chun, hre ro, nangni po po, Pathien ram thu khêkpuia kân vâk kân vâkna hlakhai hin ka hmêl hmu nâwk ta naw ti niu ti ka hriet a.

en: Wherefore I testify unto you this day, that I am pure from the blood of all men.
hmr: Chuleiin, mi po po thisenah ka hul a nih ti vawisûn hin kân hriettir cheu.

en: For I shrank not from declaring unto you the whole counsel of God.
hmr: Pathien rêl po po arêngin in kuoma hril kân tîm nawh a.

en: Take heed unto yourselves, and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit hath made you bishops, to feed the church of the Lord which he purchased with his own blood.
hmr: Pathien kohran ama thisena a inchâwk chu, châwm dingin, nangni le inrawihai po po chunga chun fimkhur ro, Thlarau Inthiengin an chunga hotuin a siem cheu hi.

en: I know that after my departing grievous wolves shall enter in among you, not sparing the flock;
hmr: Ka fe hnungin satene hrânghai nangni lai hung lût an ta, pâwlruol chu hla naw ni hai ti ka hriet.

en: and from among your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.
hmr: Nangni laia mi khawm, inchûktirhai an kuoma inkawptir dingin thu hran hril la hung um an tih.

en: Wherefore watch ye, remembering that by the space of three years I ceased not to admonish every one night and day with tears.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngaiven ro; kum thum rau, mitthli tla pumin asûn azâna, mi tin hal ka ma naw kha hre zing ro.

en: And now I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you the inheritance among all them that are sanctified.
hmr: “Tuhin Pathien le a lunginsiet- na thu kuomah kân kawltir cheu, chu chun a siem lien thei cheu a, mi inthienghai lai ro chan ân neitir thei bawk cheu a.

en: I coveted no man’s silver, or gold, or apparel.
hmr: Tu tangkahai, rângkachakhai, silfênhai khawm kân hnar ngai naw kha.

en: Ye yourselves know that these hands ministered unto my necessities, and to them that were with me.
hmr: Hi kuthai hin kei le ka ruolhai pawimaw chu a them suok hlak kha nangni ngeiin in hriet a.

en: In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring ye ought to help the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that he himself said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
hmr: Iengkim ka thaw taphawt ka thawhmu hlak cheu kha, chuonga sininrim pum le, Lalpa Isu thu hre zing pumin mi hrâtnawhai in ṭhang- pui ding a nih; ama ngeiin, ‘Iengkhat lâk nêkin pêkin lukhâwng a nei lem’, a ti kha,” a ta.

en: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down and prayed with them all.
hmr: Chun, chuong ang thu chu a hril zo chun, a dingṭhaṭhuon a, an rêngin a ṭawngṭaipui a.

en: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul’s neck and kissed him,
hmr: Chun, an rêng chun an ṭap a, Paula chu an kuoh a, an fâwp an fâwp a.

en: sorrowing most of all for the word which he had spoken, that they should behold his face no more. And they brought him on his way unto the ship.
hmr: A hmêl an hmu nâwk naw ding thu a hril chu an lungngaina tak a nih. Chun, lawng chen chun ama an inthla tah a.

en: And when it came to pass that we were parted from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course unto Cos, and the next day unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara:
hmr: Chun, anni le chun kan inṭheh a, lawngin kan suok a, chu hnunga chun tlûntakin Kos thlierkâr kan tlung a; chun, a zîngah Rodi thlierkâr kan tlung nâwk a, chutaka inthawkin kan fe pei a, Patara kan tlung a;

en: and having found a ship crossing over unto Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.
hmr: chun, Phoiniki ram kai ding lawng pakhat kan hmuh a, kan chuong a, kan fe pei tah a.

en: And when we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed unto Syria, and landed at Tyre; for there the ship was to unlade her burden.
hmr: Chun, Kupra thlierkâr kan hmuh a, vawitieng panin kan khêl a, Suria ram tieng kan fe pei a, Turaa chun khawmuolah kan suok phawt a; chu- taka chun lawnga thuomhnaw thak suok ding a nih a.

en: And having found the disciples, we tarried there seven days: and these said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not set foot in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai kan zawng suok a, chutaka chun ni sari kan châm a. Anni chun, Thlarau hrilin, Paula kuomah, Jerusalem sir lo ding an ta.

en: And when it came to pass that we had accomplished the days, we departed and went on our journey; and they all, with wives and children, brought us on our way till we were out of the city: and kneeling down on the beach, we prayed, and bade each other farewell;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuong ni zoa chun kan suok a, kan fe tah a, unauhai chun an rêngin, an nuhmei an nauhai leh khaw kâwl chenin an mi vân thlah a; chun, tuisuoriet panga chun kan dingṭhaṭhuon a, kan ṭawngṭai a.

en: and we went on board the ship, but they returned home again.
hmr: Chun, “Damtakin”, kan in tih a, lawnga chun kan chuong a; anni ruok chu an inah an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And when we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais; and we saluted the brethren, and abode with them one day.
hmr: Chun, Turaa inthawka lawnga kan fe zo chun Ptolemai kan tlung a, unauhai chibai kan bûk a, an kuomah ni khat kan châm a.

en: And on the morrow we departed, and came unto Cæsarea: and entering into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, we abode with him.
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun kan suok a, Kaisari kan tlung a, Chanchin Ṭha hriltu Philip inah kan lût a, ama chu pasari hai lai khan pakhat a na, a kuomah kan châm a.

en: Now this man had four virgin daughters, who prophesied.
hmr: Ama chun naunuhmei pali a nei a, nunghâk inthieng an nih, Pathien thu an hril hlak a.

en: And as we tarried there some days, there came down from Judæa a certain prophet, named Agabus.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun ni tamtak kan châm a, chu lai chun Judai rama inthawkin a hming Agaba, Zâwlnei pakhat a hung thlah a.

en: And coming to us, and taking Paul’s girdle, he bound his own feet and hands, and said, Thus saith the Holy Spirit, So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.
hmr: Kan kuomah a hung a, Paula kâwnghrên a lâk a, a kehai, a kuthai ama le ama ân khuop a, chun, “Jerusalema Judahai chun hi kâwnghrên neitu hi hieng ang hin khuop an tih, Jentailhai kutah pe bawk an tih, Thlarau Inthiengin a tih,” a ta.

en: And when we heard these things, both we and they of that place besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuong thu chu kan hriet phingleh, keini le chu khuoa mihai chun Paula chu Jerusalema hang fe lo dingin kan ngên ta rak a.

en: Then Paul answered, What do ye, weeping and breaking my heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.
hmr: Paula chun a dawn a, “Ieng am in ti a ni leh, in ṭap in ṭap a, ka thla in suksie ie! Lalpa Isu hming lei chun Jerusalema khuop chau ni loin, thi khawm ka huom in sawnnaw,” a ta.

en: And when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The will of the Lord be done.
hmr: Chun, thlêm ruol a ni naw hnung chun, “Lalpa thu thu ni raw se,” kan ta, kan ma tah a.

en: And after these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun kan thuomhnaw kan siem a, Jerusalemah kan hang feh a.

en: And there went with us also certain of the disciples from Cæsarea, bringing with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we should lodge.
hmr: Kaisaria mi inchûktir tuhai amanih kan kuomah an fe veh a, anni chun a hming Mnason, inchûktir hmasa pâwl, Kupra thlierkâra mi pakhat, kan tlung-in dingpa chu an ṭhuoi veh a.

en: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem kan tlung chun unauhaiin hlimtakin an mi lo lâwm a.

en: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.
hmr: A zînga chun Paula rawiin Jakob kuomah kan lût a; chutaka chun kohran upahai po po khawm an um a.

en: And when he had saluted them, he rehearsed one by one the things which God had wrought among the Gentiles through his ministry.
hmr: Chun, Paulain anni chibai a bûk zoin, a rawngbâwlna hmanga Pa- thienin Jentailhai laia thil ân thawtirhai chu a kip a kawiin a hril a.

en: And they, when they heard it, glorified God; and they said unto him, Thou seest, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of them that have believed; and they are all zealous for the law:
hmr: Chun, unauhai chun chuong thu chu an hrietin Pathien an chawi- mawi a; chun, Paula kuoma chun, “Unau, Judahai laia ringtu tamzie i hmuh a; an rêngin Dân chungah ṭhahnem an ngai bawk a.

en: and they have been informed concerning thee, that thou teachest all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children, neither to walk after the customs.
hmr: Chun, nangin Jentailhai laia Juda umhai po po kuoma chun an nauhai ser tan lo ding le, dân anga um naw ding tiin, Mosie peithlâkna thu în chûktir hlak ti mi bauah an hriet a.

en: What is it therefore? they will certainly hear that thou art come.
hmr: Iengtin am ni tâng a ta? I hung tlung ti an hriet ngei âwm sih a.

en: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men that have a vow on them;
hmr: Chuleiin, i kuoma kan hril ang hin thaw rawh: Thutiem nei pasal pali kan kuomah an um.

en: these take, and purify thyself with them, and be at charges for them, that they may shave their heads: and all shall know that there is no truth in the things whereof they have been informed concerning thee; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, keeping the law.
hmr: Chuonghai chu ṭhuoi la, anni lai inthien fai ve la, an lu an vaw theina dingin an ta dingin sum sêng rawh: chuongchun, mi po poin mi baua i thu an hriethai kha, a tak a ni naw hrieng an ta, nang ngei Dân hrawin feltakin i um lem a nih hre el an tih.

en: But as touching the Gentiles that have believed, we wrote, giving judgment that they should keep themselves from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what is strangled, and from fornication.
hmr: Jentailhai laia ringtu thu chu, milim biekna thil fâk kawnga dâm, sa thisen fâk kawnga dâm, sa râkhlum fâk kawnga dâm, indit kawnga dâm an insukthieng ding a nih, tiin ei rêl a, ei ziek ta kha,” an ta.

en: Then Paul took the men, and the next day purifying himself with them went into the temple, declaring the fulfilment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun Paulain pasalhai chu a ṭhuoi a, anni lai ân thienfai veh a, Pathien biekina chun a lût a, an ta dinga sa that seng ding a pêk pêk hmakhat chu inthienfainain an nei hri ding a nih ti, thiempu kuoma chun an hril lâwk a.

en: And when the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him,
hmr: Chun, ni sari chu a tling vângin Asia rama Judahai chun Paula chu Pathien biekinah an hmuh a, mipui po po an infui a, ama chu an man a,

en: crying out, Men of Israel, help: This is the man that teacheth all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place; and moreover he brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath defiled this holy place.
hmr: an khêk a, “Israel mihai, mi ṭhangpui ro, hi mipa hi ram tinah mi po po kuomah, Juda mi dâm, Dân dâm, hi in dâm hi hrilsetu kha a nih; chu naw khawm chu Pathien biekina hin Grik mihai khawm a lûtpui a, hi in inthieng hi a suktirdakum tah a nih,” an ta.

en: For they had before seen with him in the city Trophimus the Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.
hmr: (Chu hma chun khuoa chun Ephesia mi Trophim chu a kuomah an hmuh a, Paulain ama chu Pathien biekina a lûtpui an ring sih a).

en: And all the city was moved, and the people ran together; and they laid hold on Paul, and dragged him out of the temple: and straightway the doors were shut.
hmr: A khuo chun an inlap ta mer mur a, mihai chu an tlân khâwm a. Paula an man a, Pathien biekina inthawk chun an kei dawk a, kawthai chu an khâr nghâl tah a.

en: And as they were seeking to kill him, tidings came up to the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in confusion.
hmr: Chun, ama chu sukhlum an tum lai chun Jerusalema mi po po an buoi ti thu chu sipai pâwl hotu laltak kuom a hang tlung a.

en: And forthwith he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down upon them: and they, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, left off beating Paul.
hmr: Ama chun sipaihai le sipai za hotuhai a ṭhuoi nghâl tah a, an kuomah a tlân thlah a. Anni chun sipai hotu laltak le sipaihai an hmu chun Paula vuok chu an ma tah a.

en: Then the chief captain came near, and laid hold on him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and inquired who he was, and what he had done.
hmr: Chun, hotu laltak chun a hung hnai a, Paula a chel a, khaidiet pahni inbuntir ding thu a pêk a; tû am a ni, ieng am a thaw ân dawn a.

en: And some shouted one thing, some another, among the crowd: and when he could not know the certainty for the uproar, he commanded him to be brought into the castle.
hmr: Chun, mipui lai chun a ṭhen thu pakhatin an khêk a, a ṭhen thu dangin an khêk a. Chu, nasêtum lei chun a ziezâng a hriet thei nawh a, kulbîngah ṭhuoi lût ding thu a pêk a.

en: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the crowd;
hmr: Chun, Paula kailâwn a tlung laiin mipuiin an thaw nasat leiin sipaihaiin ama chu an dawm kâng pei a;

en: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out, Away with him.
hmr: mi po poin, “Sukbohmang ro” tia khêkin an zui hut hut sih a.

en: And as Paul was about to be brought into the castle, he saith unto the chief captain, May I say something unto thee? And he said, Dost thou know Greek?
hmr: Chun, Paula chu kulbînga chun an ṭhuoi lût ding laiin, ama chun sipai za hotu laltak kuoma chun, “I kuomah thu bau khat hril thei ka ti?” a ta. Ama chun, “Grik ṭawng i hriet maw?

en: Art thou not then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?
hmr: Inhmaa mihai infuia, mihriem philhmanghai sângli thlalêra ṭhuoi suoktu Aigupta rama mi kha i ni naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: But Paul said, I am a Jew, of Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and I beseech thee, give me leave to speak unto the people.
hmr: Paula chun, “Juda mi, Kiliki rama Tarsa khuoa mi ka nih, khaw namêna um ka ni nawh; mi lunginsiet la, mi po po kuomah thu mîn hriltir rawh,” a ta.

en: And when he had given him leave, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with the hand unto the people; and when there was made a great silence, he spake unto them in the Hebrew language, saying,
hmr: Chun, a remti phingleh, Paula kailâwna chun a ngîr a, mi po po tona dingin kutin a zâp a; chun an to ṭhuop phingleh Hebrai ṭawngin an kuomah:

en: Brethren and fathers, hear ye the defence which I now make unto you.
hmr: “Unauhai, pahai, tuhin in kuomah ka thiemna thu ka hril ding cheu a ni hi lo ngai ro,” a ta.

en: And when they heard that he spake unto them in the Hebrew language, they were the more quiet: and he saith,
hmr: Chun, Hebrai ṭawngin an kuomah thu a hril ti an hriet phingin an to nâwk zuol a;

en: I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city, at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict manner of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as ye all are this day:
hmr: chun, ama chun, “Juda mi ka nih, Kiliki ram Tarsa khuoa pieng ka nih; nisienlakhawm, hi khuoa hin Gamaliel ke bula inchûka inṭhang lien ka nih, ei thlatuhai Dân khermeitak chu inchûka um hlak ka nih, vawisûna nangni ang tak hin, Pathien ta dinga ṭhahnem bawk hlak ka nih.

en: and I persecuted this Way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.
hmr: Hi Lama mihai hi sukhlum rau khawpin ka suknawmna hlak a, a nuhmei a pasalin ka khuop a, intângna inah kân khumtir hlak a.

en: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and journeyed to Damascus to bring them also that were there unto Jerusalem in bonds to be punished.
hmr: Thiempu Laltak le upahai po po khawmin chuong thu chu an mi hrietpui thei, an kuoma inthawka unauhai pêk dingin lekha ka hmu kha; chun, Damaskaa um taphawt an hrem dingin, khuop puma Jeru- salema ṭhuoi dingin ka fe kha.

en: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and drew nigh unto Damascus, about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.
hmr: “Chun, ka feh a, Damaska khaw kâwl ka tlung chun, sûnbu fâk pha laiin, kârloin vâna inthawka var nasatak ka vêlah a hung var phut a.

en: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
hmr: Chun, hnuoiah ka tluh a, ka kuomah, ‘Saula, Saula, nangin ieng- dinga i mi suknawmna am a na?’ tiin rawl ka hriet a.

en: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.
hmr: Chun, keiin, ‘Tu am i na, Lalpa?’ tiin ka dawn a. Ama chun ka kuomah, ‘Nazareth Isu i suknawmnat hi ka nih,’ a ta.

en: And they that were with me beheld indeed the light, but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.
hmr: Ka ruolhai chun var chu an hmu dea chu, a mi betu rawl ruok chu an hriet nawh.

en: And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.
hmr: Chun, keiin, ‘Lalpa, ieng am thâwng ka ta?’ ka ta. Lalpa chun ka kuomah, ‘Tho la, Damaskaah lût rawh, thil po po i thaw dinga ruot taphawt chu hril an ti che,’ a ta.

en: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me I came into Damascus.
hmr: Chun, chu var nasat lei chun khuo ka hmu thei ta nawh a, ka ruolhaiin kutin an mi kei a, Damaskaah ka lût tah a.

en: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews that dwelt there,
hmr: “Chun, mi pakhat, Anania, Dân kawnga Pathien ngaisak le chutaka Juda umhai po po kuoma hming ṭha chu,

en: came unto me, and standing by me said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And in that very hour I looked up on him.
hmr: ka kuomah a hung a, ka kâwlah a ngîr a, ka kuomah, ‘Unau Saula, mitvar nei rawh,’ a mi ta. Chu lai tak chun ka mit chu a hung var a, ama ka hang hmu tah a.

en: And he said, The God of our fathers hath appointed thee to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, ‘Ei thlatuhai Pathienin a ditzâwng hre ding le, Mi feltak chu hmua, a ṭawngbau khawm hre dingin a ruot ta che.

en: For thou shalt be a witness for him unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.
hmr: I hmu le i hriet thua khan mi po po kuomah ama thu hretu nîng i tih.

en: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on his name.
hmr: Chun, iengdinga i la um zing am? Tho la, ama hming lam pumin baptisma chang la, i suolhai sâwpfai ta la,’ a mi ta.

en: And it came to pass, that, when I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,
hmr: “Chun, Jerusalema hin ka kîr nâwk hnungin, Pathien biekina ka ṭawngṭai laiin, zêlin ka um a;

en: and saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem; because they will not receive of thee testimony concerning me.
hmr: chun, ‘Inhmaw la, Jerusalema inthawkin suok rawh; ka chanchin i hril ding chu an pawm âwm naw hi,’ a mi ti lai ka hmuh a.

en: And I said, Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:
hmr: “Chun, keiin, ‘Lalpa inkhâwm- na in tinah a ringtu che taphawt intângna inah ka khum a, ka vuok hlak kha an hriet sih a;

en: and when the blood of Stephen thy witness was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting, and keeping the garments of them that slew him.
hmr: chun, i thu hretu Stephan thisen an insuo lai khan kei khawm an kâwlah ka ngîr a, ka lo remtih a, a sukhlumtuhai puonhai dâm ka lo vêng tâwl bawk a nih,’ ka ta.

en: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee forth far hence unto the Gentiles.
hmr: “Chun, ama chun, ‘Fe rawh; hitaka inthawka hlatakah, Jentail- hai kuomah tir lem ka ti che,’ a mi tih a,” a ta.

en: And they gave him audience unto this word; and they lifted up their voice, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.
hmr: Chun, chu thu chen chun an ngai a, rawl inringtakin, “Mi hieng ang hrep hi, khawvêla inthawkin sukbohmang ro, hring tlâk khawm a ni nawh,” an ti tah a.

en: And as they cried out, and threw off their garments, and cast dust into the air,
hmr: An khêk a, an puonhai an hlîp a, an pei a, pilvut an vânvawr a,

en: the chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, bidding that he should be examined by scourging, that he might know for what cause they so shouted against him.
hmr: chuongchun, sipai hotu laltak chun Paula chu kulbîng sûnga ṭhuoi lût thu a pêk a, a chunga chuong ang lâwma an khêkna san chu hrietna dingin vuok puma suosal dingin a tih a.

en: And when they had tied him up with the thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?
hmr: Chun, savun hruia an khuop zoin, Paulain a kâwla ngîr sipai za hotu kuoma chun, “Rom mi hrim hrim in vuok thei am a nih? thiemnaw inchangtir hnung khawm ni si loin,” a ta.

en: And when the centurion heard it, he went to the chief captain and told him, saying, What art thou about to do? for this man is a Roman.
hmr: Sipai za hotu chun chu chu a hriet phingleh, sipai hotu laltak kuomah chun a feh a, “I thil thaw ding hi fimkhur raw khai! Hi mipa hi Rom mi a lo nih ie,” a ta, a hril a.

en: And the chief captain came and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? And he said, Yea.
hmr: Chun, sipai hotu laltak chu a hung a, a kuomah, “Rom mi i ni maw? Mi hril rawh,” a ta. Ama chun, “Nih e,” a ta.

en: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this citizenship. And Paul said, But I am a Roman born.
hmr: Sipai hotu laltak chun, “Chu khuoa mi ni dingin kei chu tangka tamtak ka sêng annaw,” a ta, a dawn a. Paula chun, “Kei chu Rom mia pieng hrim ka nih,” a ta.

en: They then that were about to examine him straightway departed from him: and the chief captain also was afraid when he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
hmr: Chuongchun, sawisak puma suosal tumtuhai chun ama chu an mâksan nghâl tah a; sipai hotu laltak khawmin Rom mi a nih ti a hriet chun a ṭih a, ama a khuop lei khan a ṭi bawk a.

en: But on the morrow, desiring to know the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together, and brought Paul down and set him before them.
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun Judahaiin ieng leiin am Paula an hêka ti hriet fel tumin sipai hotu laltak chun ama chu a sût a, thiempu lalhai le rorêltuhai po po inkhâwm dingin thu a pêk a, Paula a ṭhuoi thlâk a, an hmaah ân ngirtir ta a.

en: And Paul, looking stedfastly on the council, said, Brethren, I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day.
hmr: Chun, Paula chun rorêltuhai chu a en zing a, “Unauhai, vawisûn chen hin Pathien mithmua ṭha tienga ka hriet taphawt chu thawin ka um hlak,” a ta.

en: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Laltak Anania chun, Paula kâwla ngîrhai kuomah, a baua benpêk ding a ta.

en: Then said Paul unto him, God shall smite thee, thou whited wall: and sittest thou to judge me according to the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?
hmr: Paula chun a kuomah, “Nang lung bang nâlvârpa, Pathienin ben lem a ti che; nang Dân anga mi ngai- tuo dingin i ṭhung a, Dân naw anga mi ben ding i ti vei a ni maw?” a ta.

en: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God’s high priest?
hmr: Chun, a kâwla mihaiin, “Pathien thiempu Laltak i hal vei maw?” an ta.

en: And Paul said, I knew not, brethren, that he was high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of a ruler of thy people.
hmr: Chun, Paulain, “Unauhai, thiem- pu Laltak a ni ti ka hriet nawa a nih, ‘I chipuihai hotu chungah thu ṭhanaw hril naw’ ti khawm ziek a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, Brethren, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees: touching the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.
hmr: Chun, Paulain a ṭhen Saddukai, a ṭhen Pharisaihai an nih ti a lo hrietin rorêltuhai lai chun a khêk a, “Unauhai, Pharisai ka nih, Pharisai naupa khawm ka nih; beiseina le mithi thonâwkna thuah suosalin ka um a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and Sadducees; and the assembly was divided.
hmr: Chun, chu chu a hril phingleh, Pharisaihai le Saddukaihai an lo insêl a, rorêltuhai chu an inkhing tah a.

en: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess both.
hmr: (Saddukaihaiin, “Mithi thonâwk- na hrim a um nawh, vântirkohai, thlarauhai khawm an um bawk nawh,” an ti hlak; Pharisaihai ruok chun chu kawng pahni chu a um an awi sih a.)

en: And there arose a great clamor: and some of the scribes of the Pharisees’ part stood up, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: and what if a spirit hath spoken to him, or an angel?
hmr: Chuongchun, nasatakin an buoi tah a; Pharisai tienga mi Dân inchûktirtu ṭhenkhat an ngîr a, an sêl a, “Hi mipa hi a suolna iengkhawm kan hriet nawh ie; thlarau khawmin, vântirko khawmin ama hi be sienla ieng am pawi a ta?” an ta.

en: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the castle.
hmr: Chun, an insêl nasa deu deu leiin, sipai hotu laltak chun Paula an kei nâwi a ṭih a, sipaihai kuomah, zu fea anni laia inthawka kulbînga hung ṭhuoi lût el dingin a ta.

en: And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer: for as thou hast testified concerning me at Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
hmr: Chun, zâna chun Lalpa chu Paula kâwlah a ngîr a, “Thlamuong- takin um rawh, Jerusalema ka thu în hriettir ang bawkin Roma khawm în hriettir ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And when it was day, the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
hmr: Chun, nisa a suok chun Judahai an ṭhang ruol a, Paula an that hmakhat chu iengkhawm faa dâwn lo dingin an inkhâm a.

en: And they were more than forty that made this conspiracy.
hmr: Chu thu phierrutuhai chu sâwmli nêka tam lem an nih.

en: And they came to the chief priests and the elders, and said, We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.
hmr: Anni chu thiempu lalhai le upahai kuomah an feh a, “Paula kan that hmakhat chu iengkhawm intem lo dingin kan inkhâm tah a nih.

en: Now therefore do ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you, as though ye would judge of his case more exactly: and we, before he comes near, are ready to slay him.
hmr: Chuleiin, nangnîn, rorêltuhai le a thu fel nâwkzuola ngaituo tum angin, in kuoma ṭhuoi thla dingin sipai hotu laltak kuomah pehêl deuin hang hril ro; in kâwl hnai a tlung hma khawmin keini ama that dingin kan inpei zing a nih,” an ta.

en: But Paul’s sister’s son heard of their lying in wait, and he came and entered into the castle and told Paul.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Paula farnu naupa chun an inchân thu chu a lo hriet a, kulbînga chun a va lût a, Paula a va hril a.

en: And Paul called unto him one of the centurions, and said, Bring this young man unto the chief captain; for he hath something to tell him.
hmr: Chun, Paula chun sipai za hotu pakhat a ko a, “Hi tlangvâl hi hotu laltak kuoma chun ṭhuoi rawh; a kuomah thu ieng amanih hril ding a nei a ni âwm ie,” a ta.

en: So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and saith, Paul the prisoner called me unto him, and asked me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath something to say to thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, sipai hotu laltak kuoma chun a va ṭhuoi a, “Paula intâng khan a mi ko a, hi tlangvâl hi i kuoma hung ṭhuoi dingin a mi tir a, i kuomah thu ieng amanih hril ding a nei a ni âwm ie,” a ta.

en: And the chief captain took him by the hand, and going aside asked him privately, What is it that thou hast to tell me?
hmr: Sipai hotu laltak chun, a kutah a chel a, a fe hranpui a, inrûkin, “Ieng am mi hril ding i nei chu?” a ta, ân dawn a.

en: And he said, The Jews have agreed to ask thee to bring down Paul to-morrow unto the council, as though thou wouldest inquire somewhat more exactly concerning him.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Paula thu fel nâwk zuola i ngaituo ding angin, zîngah rorêltuhai kuoma ṭhuoi thlâk dingin Judahaiin hni che an remti tlâng a.

en: Do not thou therefore yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men, who have bound themselves under a curse, neither to eat nor to drink till they have slain him: and now are they ready, looking for the promise from thee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an thu lo awi naw rawh; anni laia mi sâwmli nêka tam lemin an inchân zing a, chuonghai chun ama an that hmakhat chu iengkhawm faa dâwn lo dingin an inkhâm a; tuhin i thu nghâkin inpei sa zingin an um a nih,” a ta.

en: So the chief captain let the young man go, charging him, Tell no man that thou hast signified these things to me.
hmr: Chun, sipai hotu laltak chun tlangvâl chu ân fetir a, “Hieng thu hi i mîn hriettir tah ti tukhawm hril naw rawh,” a ta.

en: And he called unto him two of the centurions, and said, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go as far as Cæsarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night:
hmr: Chun, sipai za hotu pahni a ko a, “Zân, zâl hun pha, Kaisari chena fe ding sipai za hni leh, sakawr chung chuong mi sâwmsari leh, fei chawi mi za hni leh siem ro,” a ta.

en: and he bade them provide beasts, that they might set Paul thereon, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.
hmr: Chun, Bawrsâp Felik kuoma chun, himtaka ân tlun theina dingin, Paula an inchuongtirna dingin sahai lo siem ding a ti bawk a.

en: And he wrote a letter after this form:
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hin lekha a ziek a;

en: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix, greeting.
hmr: “Klaudi Lusiain Felik Bawrsâp ṭhatak chibai a bûk.

en: This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be slain of them, when I came upon them with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.
hmr: “Hi mipa hi Judahaiin an man a, an that ding laiin an kuomah sipaihai ṭhuoiin ka feh a, Rom mi a nih ti ka hriet a, ka san suok tah a.

en: And desiring to know the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him down unto their council:
hmr: Chun, an hêkna san hriet ka nuom a, an rorêltuhai kuomah ka ṭhuoi thlâk a.

en: whom I found to be accused about questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.
hmr: Chuongchun, an dân thu ieng ienga manih hêk a nih ti ka hriet a, nisienlakhawm, an hêkna thuah thina le khuopna khawp rau dingin iengkhawm ka hriet si nawh.

en: And when it was shown to me that there would be a plot against the man, I sent him to thee forthwith, charging his accusers also to speak against him before thee.
hmr: Chun, Judahaiin ama an inchân ti miin an mîn hriettir phingleh, i kuomah ama hi ka hung tir nghâl ta a nih, a hêktuhai khawm, a chunga thupawi an nei taphawt chu i hmaa hril dingin thu ka pêk bawk a,” tiin.

en: So the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.
hmr: Chuongchun, sipaihai chun a thupêk ang chun, Paula chu a zân a zânin an ṭhuoi a, Antipatri an tlungpui a.

en: But on the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the castle:
hmr: A zînga chun sakawr chung chuong mihai chu, ama le fe pei dingin an kîr san a, kulbînga chun an fe nâwk tah a.

en: and they, when they came to Cæsarea and delivered the letter to the governor, presented Paul also before him.
hmr: Chun, anni chu Kaisari khuo chu an tlung a, Bawrsâp kuomah lekha chu an pêk a, Paula khawm a hmaah an inngîrtir a.

en: And when he had read it, he asked of what province he was; and when he understood that he was of Cilicia,
hmr: Bawrsâp chun a tiem zoin Paula umna ram ân dawn a. Chun, Kiliki ram mi a nih ti a hriet phingleh,

en: I will hear thee fully, said he, when thine accusers also are come: and he commanded him to be kept in Herod’s palace.
hmr: “A hêktuhai che an hung tlung phingleh, i thupawi ngaituong ka tih,” a ta. Chun, Herod inah vêng ding thu a pêk a.

en: And after five days the high priest Ananias came down with certain elders, and with an orator, one Tertullus; and they informed the governor against Paul.
hmr: Chun, ni nga chenah Thiempu Laltak Anani a hung tlung thlah a, upa tuhai amanih leh, a hming Tertulla thuhril thiem pakhat leh; chun, Paula chunga thupawi chu Bawrsâp kuomah an hril a.

en: And when he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy much peace, and that by thy providence evils are corrected for this nation,
hmr: Chun, Paula chu an ko suok hnung chun, Tertulla chun ama a hêk phut a, “Felik ṭha tak, nangma zârin thlamuongtakin kan um lei le, i enkawl leia hi chihai ta dinga suolhai chu khap ṭhata a um hlak leiin,

en: we accept it in all ways and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness.
hmr: kumkhuoin khâwlai khawm lungawitakin kan lâwm hlak.

en: But, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I entreat thee to hear us of thy clemency a few words.
hmr: Iengkhawm ni sienla, i ta dinga nghawkum taluo ni ka nuom nawh a, I nunnêmnain thu baukhat ruok chu mi ngaipêk dingin ka hni che a nih.

en: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
hmr: Hi mipa hi mi theidaumtak, khawvêla Judahai po po chawkbuoitu le, Nazareth pâwla a ṭhuoitu pakhat a nih ti kan hriet a.

en: who moreover assayed to profane the temple: on whom also we laid hold:
hmr: Pathien biekin sukthieng naw a tum bawk a, chuleiin, kan man a nih; [kan dân anga a chungthu rêl kan nuom a,
