nisienlakhawm, sipai hotu tak Lusia a hung a, ka kuta mi chu a hung ṭhuoi lui tah a.

en: from whom thou wilt be able, by examining him thyself, to take knowledge of all these things whereof we accuse him.
hmr: Ama hêktuhai chu i hmaa inlang ding thu a pêk bawk a.] Nang ngeiin suosal la, kan hêkna thil po po hi amaa inthawkin hre thei i tih,” a ta.

en: And the Jews also joined in the charge, affirming that these things were so.
hmr: Judahai khawm chun, “Chuong thu chu chuong ang tak chu a nih,” tiin an lo ṭhangpui a.

en: And when the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, Paul answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I cheerfully make my defence:
hmr: Chun, Bawrsâp chun thu hril dinga Paula chu kuta a zâp phingleh, ama chun, “Nang kum tamtak hi chihai rorêl pêktu i nih ti ka hriet leiin lâwmtakin ka thiemna thu ka hril ding a ni hi.

en: seeing that thou canst take knowledge that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem:
hmr: Jerusalema Pathien be dinga ka hang fe chen chu ni sâwm le pahni bâk la ni naw nih ti hre thei i tih.

en: and neither in the temple did they find me disputing with any man or stirring up a crowd, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city.
hmr: Pathien biekina khawm, inkhâwmna inahai khawm khuoa khawm tukhawm ka sêl le mipui kân fui annîn an mi hmu bawk nawh,

en: Neither can they prove to thee the things whereof they now accuse me.
hmr: tu khawm hin an mi hêkna thu hi i hrietah a bula inthawkin sui suok thei bawk naw ni hai.

en: But this I confess unto thee, that after the Way which they call a sect, so serve I the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hi thu hi i kuomah inphuong ka tih, ‘Chi hran,’ an ti, Lam dân angin ei thlatuhai Pathien ka biek hlak, Dân le zâwl- neihai lekhabua ziek po po ringin.

en: having hope toward God, which these also themselves look for, that there shall be a resurrection both of the just and unjust.
hmr: Chun, mi fel le felnaw thonâwk- na um a tih ti Pathien tieng ka beisei a, hienghai khawm hin chu chu an awi ve bawk si.

en: Herein I also exercise myself to have a conscience void of offence toward God and men always.
hmr: Chuleichun, Pathien kuom tienga le mihriem tienga khawm lungril suol naw mawl hi vawn tlat ka tum hlak.

en: Now after some years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings:
hmr: Chun, kum tamtak hnunga hin ka chipuihai lai thilpêk ding chawiin, inthâwina inhlân dingin ka hung a.

en: amidst which they found me purified in the temple, with no crowd, nor yet with tumult: but there were certain Jews from Asia—
hmr: Chuong lai chun, mipui le, nasêtum um loin, Pathien biekinah insukthiengin an mi hmuh a.

en: who ought to have been here before thee, and to make accusation, if they had aught against me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chutaka chun Asia rama mi Juda tuhai amanih an um kha, chuonghai chun ka chungah thu an nei chun, hitaka hin i hmaa umin an mi hêk ding a nih.

en: Or else let these men themselves say what wrong-doing they found when I stood before the council,
hmr: Annawleh, hienghai ngei hin rorêltu hmaa ka ngîr lai khan, ka suksuol ieng am an hmuh a, hril raw hai se,

en: except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question before you this day.
hmr: anni laia ngîrin, hi thu baukhat, ‘Mithi thonâwkna thuah vawisûn hin in hmaah suosalin ka um a ni hi,’ ka ti lei kha a ni nghâl naw chun,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will determine your matter.
hmr: Chun, Felik chun Lam thu chu a hriet fel deu leiin, “Sipai hotu laltak Lusia chu a hung tlung thla pha in thu la rem ka tih,” tiin a sie ta hrih a.

en: And he gave order to the centurion that he should be kept in charge, and should have indulgence; and not to forbid any of his friends to minister unto him.
hmr: Chun, Paula chu duot deua, a ruolhai rawngbâwlpêk khap loa invêngtir dingin sipai za hotu chu thu a pêk a.

en: But after certain days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess, and sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.
hmr: Chun, ni iengzât chena manih Felik chu a hung nâwk a, a nuhmei Drusilla Juda nuhmei leh, Paula chu ân kotir a, Krista Isu ringna thu chu a ngai a.

en: And as he reasoned of righteousness, and self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, Go thy way for this time; and when I have a convenient season, I will call thee unto me.
hmr: Paula chun, felna thu dâm, insûm thu dâm, ro a la rêl ding thu dâm ṭhahnemngaitaka a hril laiin Felik chun ṭium a ti bêk a, “Fe nâwk phawt ta rawh, hun remchâng ka nei pha ko ka ti che,” a ta.

en: He hoped withal that money would be given him of Paul: wherefore also he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.
hmr: Paulain tangka a pêk a beisei bawk a, chuleiin, a ko inzing deu a, a biek hlak a nih.

en: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus; and desiring to gain favor with the Jews, Felix left Paul in bonds.
hmr: Chun, kum hni ân vawi hnungin Porkia Festain Felik chu a thleng tah a; Felik chun Judahai laia hmingṭhat a nuom a, Paula chu khuop sain a mâksan tah a.

en: Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Cæsarea.
hmr: Chuongchun, Festa chun ram chu a awp tah a; chun, ni thum hnungin Kaisaria inthawk chun Jerusalemah a hang feh a.

en: And the chief priests and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul; and they besought him,
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai le Juda hotuhai chun Paula chanchin chu a se tiengin an lo inhriettir a.

en: asking a favor against him, that he would send for him to Jerusalem; laying a plot to kill him on the way.
hmr: Jerusalema hung inṭhuoitir ding- in lunginsietna an lo hni rak bawk a; lampuia lo inchâna that an tum a.

en: Howbeit Festus answered, that Paul was kept in charge at Cæsarea, and that he himself was about to depart thither shortly.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Festa chun, “Paula Kaisariah an vêng zing a nih, kei khawm sâwtnawtêah ka fe ding a nih.

en: Let them therefore, saith he, that are of power among you go down with me, and if there is anything amiss in the man, let them accuse him.
hmr: Chuleiin, ama chun suolna a nei chun, nangni laia thuneituhaiin mi zui thla hai sienla, hêk raw hai se,” a ta.

en: And when he had tarried among them not more than eight or ten days, he went down unto Cæsarea; and on the morrow he sat on the judgment-seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.
hmr: Chun, anni lai chun ni riet amanih, ni sâwm amani chau chu a châm nâwk a, Kaisariah a fe thlah a; chun, a zînga chun rorêlna ṭhungphaah a ṭhung a, Paula chu hung ṭhuoi dingin thu a pêk a.

en: And when he was come, the Jews that had come down from Jerusalem stood round about him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove;
hmr: Chun, ama chu a hung tlung chun, Jerusalema inthawka Juda hung thlahai chu a vêla chun an ngir a, a chungah thupawi tamtak, rik tak tak an hril an hril a, a bul ruok chu an sui suok thei si nawh a.

en: while Paul said in his defence, Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Cæsar, have I sinned at all.
hmr: Chun, Paula chun a thiemna thu a hril a, “Judahai Dân chunga dâm, Pathien biekin thua dâm, Kaisar chunga dâm khawm, thil hrim hrim ka suksuol nawh,” a ta.

en: But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said, Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem, and there be judged of these things before me?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Festa chun Judahai laia hmingṭhat a nuom a, Paula kuoma chun, “Jerusalema hang fea, khitaka ka hmaa i thu rêl i nuom am?” a ta.

en: But Paul said, I am standing before Cæsar’s judgment-seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou also very well knowest.
hmr: Paula ruok chun, “Kaisar rorêl- na ṭhungpha hmaah, ro rêlpêka ka umna ding hrima chun ngîr ka tih; Judahai chungah thil iengkhawm ka suksuol nawh, nang khawmin chu chu i hriet zing sih a.

en: If then I am a wrong-doer, and have committed anything worthy of death, I refuse not to die; but if none of those things is true whereof these accuse me, no man can give me up unto them. I appeal unto Cæsar.
hmr: Mi suol ka nia, thina khawp rau thil thaw ka ni chun, thi khawm ka sêl nawh; nisienlakhawm, hienghai mi hêkna thil hi a bul iengkhawm a um naw chun, tukhawmin an kuomah mi pe thei naw ni hai, Kaisar kuomah intlun ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Thou hast appealed unto Cæsar: unto Cæsar shalt thou go.
hmr: Chun, Festa chun a rorêlpuitu- hai a biek rawn zoin, “Kaisar kuoma intlun i tum vei a, Kaisar kuomah fe mawl i tih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: Now when certain days were passed, Agrippa the king and Bernice arrived at Cæsarea, and saluted Festus.
hmr: Chun, ni iengzât amani chena chun lal Agrippa le Berniki chu Kaisari an hung tlung a, Festa chibai an bûk a.

en: And as they tarried there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying, There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix;
hmr: Chun, ni tamtak chutaka chun an châm leiin Festa chun Paula thu- pawi chu lal kuoma chun a hril a, “Felik khan intâng tû amanih a mâksan a.

en: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for sentence against him.
hmr: Jerusalema ka um lai khan thiempu lalhai le Juda upahaiin a chungchâng thu an mi hril a, thiem- naw inchangtir dingin an ngên a.

en: To whom I answered, that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man, before that the accused have the accusers face to face, and have had opportunity to make his defence concerning the matter laid against him.
hmr: Keiin an kuomah, ‘An ihêk le a hêktuhai an inhmaituok a, an hêkna kawngah a thiemna thu hril vena remchâng a hmu hmakhat chu, mi hrim hrim hrem dinga inthla hi Rom mi dân a ni nawh ie,’ tiin ka dawn a.

en: When therefore they were come together here, I made no delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment-seat, and commanded the man to be brought.
hmr: Chun, hitaka an hung tlungin, sâwt riel loin, a zînga chun rorêlna ṭhungphaah ka ṭhung a, ama chu hung ṭhuoi dingin thu ka pêk a.

en: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such evil things as I supposed;
hmr: Chun, a hêktuhai an ngîr laiin ka ring ang hrimin a chungah suolna thupawi an hril nawh a;

en: but had certain questions against him of their own religion, and of one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
hmr: an sakhuo dânhai le, Isu mi pakhat thi tahnung, Paula chun, ‘A hring nâwk a nih,’ tiin a hril a; chuong ang a hril lei chun a chungah thubuoihai an lo nei a lo ni lem a.

en: And I, being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, asked whether he would go to Jerusalem and there be judged of these matters.
hmr: Kei chun, chuong thuhai chu ngaituo ngaina hrim ka hriet nawh a, Jerusalemah fe a, khitaka chuong thu chu rêlpêk a nuom le nuom naw kân dawn a.

en: But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept till I should send him to Cæsar.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Paula chun, Laltak rêl dinga khêk a ngên ta lem a; chuleiin, Kaisar kuoma kân fetir thei hmakhat chu vêng dingin thu ka pêk a,” a ta.

en: And Agrippa said unto Festus, I also could wish to hear the man myself. To-morrow, saith he, thou shalt hear him.
hmr: Chun, Agrippa chun Festa kuoma chun, “Kei khawm chu thu hril chu ngai ka lo nuom rawp hlak hrim a nih,” a ta. Ama chun, “Zingah a thu hril ngai naw ti nîm,” a ta.

en: So on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, and Bernice, with great pomp, and they were entered into the place of hearing with the chief captains and the principal men of the city, at the command of Festus Paul was brought in.
hmr: Chuongchun, a zînga chun, Agrippa le Berniki chu ropuitakin an hung a, thu hrilna inah an hung lût a, sipai hotu lalhai leh, khuoa miṭha deu deuhai leh; chun, Festa thuin Paula an hung inṭhuoilûttir a.

en: And Festus saith, King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, ye behold this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews made suit to me, both at Jerusalem and here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.
hmr: Chun, Festa chun, “Lal Agrippa le hitaka eini laia um po pohai, hi mipa hi in hmu hi a nih, a chungchâng thuah Judahai po poin, an rêngin hring ta lo dingin, khêk a, Jerusalema le hitaka an mi biekna kha a nih.

en: But I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death: and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thina khawp rauin iengkhawm a thaw nawh ti ka hriet a; amiruokchu, ama hin Laltak kuoma intlun a tum leiin tir ka tum a nih,

en: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, and specially before thee, king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I may have somewhat to write.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, a thu mumal iengkhawm ka lal kuoma ziek ding ka hriet si nawh a. Chuleiin, in kuomah ka hung ṭhuoi suok hi, lal Agrippa, nanga hmaa hung ṭhuoi bîk deu khawm ka nih, suosal zoa ieng amani bêk ziek ding ka hmu theina dingin.

en: For it seemeth to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not withal to signify the charges against him.
hmr: Mi intâng Laltak kuoma tir a, a chunga an hêkna thu inhriettir sa naw chu, invêtthlâk niin ka hriet sih a,” a ta.

en: And Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth his hand, and made his defence:
hmr: Chun, Agrippa chun Paula kuoma chun, “I thiemna thu hril thei i tih,” a ta. Chun, Paula chun a kut a phar a, a thiemna thu a hril a,

en: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, that I am to make my defence before thee this day touching all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews:
hmr: “Lal Agrippa, Judahaiin an mi hêkna po poa ka thiemna thu vawisûn hin i hmaa ka hril ding lei hin lâwmin kân hriet;

en: especially because thou art expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
hmr: hi hi ka lâwmna tak chu a nih; Judahai laia dân le thubuoi po po kawnga i var ngawt lei hin; chuleiin, muongtaka mi ngai pêk dingin ka ngên che.

en: My manner of life then from my youth up, which was from the beginning among mine own nation and at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;
hmr: A tîra, ka naupang laia inthawk ka chihai lai le Jerusalema ka um dân kha Judahai po poin an hriet a.

en: having knowledge of me from the first, if they be willing to testify, that after the straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
hmr: A tîra inthawka ka chanchin an hriet a, khânga ei sakhuo pâwl kher- mei tak dân pângngaia Pharisaia ka um kha; an nuom phawt chun an mi hrilpui thei a nih.

en: And now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers;
hmr: Chun, Pathienin ei thlatuhai kuoma thu a tiem kha beisei kawng thuah tuhin hitaka hin rorêlpêk dingin ka ngîr hi;

en: unto which promise our twelve tribes, earnestly serving God night and day, hope to attain. And concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, O king!
hmr: chu thutiem chu, ei hnam sâwm le pahniin, a sûn a zâna Pathien rawng ṭhahnemngaitaka bâwlin hmu an beisei hlak. Aw, lalpa, chu beiseina lei chun Judahaiin an mi hêk a ni hi.

en: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God doth raise the dead?
hmr: “Pathienin mithihai a keitho ti hi iengdinga awium nawa in ruot am a na?

en: I verily thought with myself that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
hmr: Kei khawmin Nazareth Isu hming kal zâwngin thil tamtak thaw lang ṭhain ka ring hlak a.

en: And this I also did in Jerusalem: and I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, and when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.
hmr: Chuongang chu Jerusalemah ka thaw bawk hlak; chun, thiempu lalhai kuomah thu ka hmuh a, mi inthienghai laia mi tamtak intângna inah ka khum bawk hlak a; chun, an sukhlum laiin sukhlum remti tieng ka ṭhang bawk hlak a.

en: And punishing them oftentimes in all the synagogues, I strove to make them blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto foreign cities.
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmna in tinah ka hrem rawp hlak a, Pathien inhril- siettir ka tum hrâm hlak a; an chungah ka rilo bêk bêk a, ram dang khuo chena khawm ka suknawmna hlak a.

en: Whereupon as I journeyed to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests,
hmr: “Chuong ang thaw dingin, thiempu lalhai thu hmuin le, an tirna lekha chawiin, Damaskaah ka feh a;

en: at midday, O king, I saw on the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them that journeyed with me.
hmr: chun, i aw, lalpa, ka fe laiin, sûnbu fâk pha a nih, vâna inthawkin var ieng amanih, nisa nêka var lem kei le ka fepuihai vêla chun varin ka hmuh a.

en: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying unto me in the Hebrew language, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the goad.
hmr: Chun, kan rêngin hnuoiah kan tluh a, Hebrai ṭawngin, ‘Saula, Saula, iengdinga nangin i mi suknawmna am a na? Sunna hmawl khêng chu i ta dingin a na ie,’ tiin râwl ka hriet a.

en: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
hmr: Chun, keiin, ‘Tu am i na Lalpa?’ ka ta. Lalpa chun, ‘Isu i suknawmnat hi ka nih.

en: But arise, and stand upon thy feet: for to this end have I appeared unto thee, to appoint thee a minister and a witness both of the things wherein thou hast seen me, and of the things wherein I will appear unto thee;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tho la, ngir rawh; hieng i thil hmuhai le, i kuoma ka inlarna ding thilhai leh chu rawngbâwla le hretua siem ding chein, i kuomah ka hung inlâr a ni hi.

en: delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom I send thee,
hmr: Mi po po le Jentailhai kuta inthawkin sanhim ka ti che.

en: to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among them that are sanctified by faith in me.
hmr: An mit sukvar dingin an kuomah ka tir che hi, chuongchun, inthim chu var tieng nghatsan an ta, Setan thuneina chu Pathien tieng nghatsan an tih, suol ngaidamna an hmuna dingin le an mi ringna leia inthieng tahai kuomah ro chan an nei ve theina dingin,’ a ta.

en: Wherefore, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:
hmr: “Chuleiin, lal Agrippa, vâna mi inlâr chu ka sêl nawh a,

en: but declared both to them of Damascus first, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judæa, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.
hmr: a tîrin Damaskaa mihai kuomah, chu hnunga chun Jerusa- lema mihai kuoma dâm, Juda ram tina mihai kuoma dâm, Jentailhai kuoma dâm khawm sim hming inbûk tlâka thil thawa, sima, Pathien tieng an nghatna dingin ka hril lem hlak a nih.

en: For this cause the Jews seized me in the temple, and assayed to kill me.
hmr: Chuong lei chun, Judahaiin Pathien biekinah an mi man a, mi sukhlum an tum a.

en: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand unto this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses did say should come;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathiena in- thawka ṭhangpuina ka hmu leiin vawisûn chenin mi chînhai le mi lienhai kuomah thu inhriettirin ka la um zing a, zâwlneihai le Mosiein hung tlung ding an ti thu chau naw chu thu dang hril loin;

en: how that the Christ must suffer, and how that he first by the resurrection of the dead should proclaim light both to the people and to the Gentiles.
hmr: khânga Krista chun rinum tuor a ta; chun, mithi laia inthawka a thonâwk leiin mi po po kuoma le Jentailhai kuoma khawm var inhmutirtu hmasatak nîng a tih, an ti thu kha,” a ta.

en: And as he thus made his defence, Festus saith with a loud voice, Paul, thou art mad; thy much learning is turning thee mad.
hmr: Chun, chuong anga a thiemna thu a hril laiin, Festa chun rawl inringtakin, “Paula, în vêt a nih, în chûk tamin a sukvêt che a nih,” a ta.

en: But Paul saith, I am not mad, most excellent Festus; but speak forth words of truth and soberness.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Paula chun, “Festa ṭhatak, kân vêt nawh ie; thu indiktak le thu vartak ka hril lem a ni hi.

en: For the king knoweth of these things, unto whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him; for this hath not been done in a corner.
hmr: Hieng thu hi lal hin a hriet annâwm, a kuoma khawm ṭi loin ka hril hi; hieng thil hi a kuomah iengkhawm ip a ni nawh ti indiktakin ka hriet deh, hieng hi in kila thaw a ni si nawh a.

en: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.
hmr: Lal Agrippa, zâwlneihai thu i awi am? I awi ti ka hriet,” a ta.

en: And Agrippa said unto Paul, With but little persuasion thou wouldest fain make me a Christian.
hmr: Chun, Agrippa chun Paula kuomah, “Sâwtnawtê chau mi thlêm a, Kristiena mi siem i tum a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And Paul said, I would to God, that whether with little or with much, not thou only, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except these bonds.
hmr: Paula chun, “Sâwt sienla, sâwt naw sienla, nang chau ka ti nawh a, vawisûna ka thu hretuhai po po khawm hi, keia ang bawka um dingin Pathien kuomah ka hni a nih, kawlhai ruok hi chu bun ve loin,” a ta.

en: And the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:
hmr: Chun, lal leh, Bawrsâp leh, Berniki le an kâwla ṭhunghai le chun an tho tâwl a;

en: and when they had withdrawn, they spake one to another, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.
hmr: chun, a tumin an feh a, an inbiek a, “Hi mipa hin thina le kawl bunna khawp rau iengkhawm thil a lo thaw luo naw hi,” an ta.

en: And Agrippa said unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Cæsar.
hmr: Chun, Agrippain Festa kuom- ah, “Hi mipa hin Kaisar kuoma intlun lo tiem ta naw chu ni sienla, a suok el ding bah,” a ta.

en: And when it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.
hmr: Chun, Itali rama lawnga kan fe ding an sukthlûk phingleh, Paula le mi intâng dang tuhai amanih,

en: And embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail unto the places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea, Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
hmr: Augusta pâwla mi sipai za hotu Julia an inkawltir a. Adramuttium khaw lawng Asia ram tuisuoriet panga khaw umhai sir dingah kan chuong a, tuisuorietah kan fe tah a; Makedonia rama mi Aristarka, Thessalonikaa mi kan kuomah a um a.

en: And the next day we touched at Sidon: and Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him leave to go unto his friends and refresh himself.
hmr: A zîngah Sidon khuo kan sîr a, chun, Julia chun Paula a sukṭha hleh a, insukhar dingin a ruolhai kuomah ân lêng tir a.

en: And putting to sea from thence, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawkin, tuisuo- rietah kan fe nâwk a, thliin a ni naw tieng a mi nam leiin Kupra thlierkâr phên thli inupna tieng kan zâm a.

en: And when we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
hmr: Chun, Kilikia ram le Pamphulia ram dep tuisuoriet kan khêl hnungin, Lukia rama Mura khuo kan tlung a.

en: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy; and he put us therein.
hmr: Chutaka chun sipai za hotu chun, Alexandria khaw lawng, Itali ram sir ding chu a hmuh a: chutaka chun a mîn chuongtir a.

en: And when we had sailed slowly many days, and were come with difficulty over against Cnidus, the wind not further suffering us, we sailed under the lee of Crete, over against Salmone;
hmr: Ni sâwt tak damtê têin kan feh a, Knidos khaw zâwn intak takin kan tlung hrâm a, thliin a mi dangkîr leiin Salmoni hrûlah Kret thlierkâr phên thli inupna tieng kan zâm a;

en: and with difficulty coasting along it we came unto a certain place called Fair Havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.
hmr: chun intak takin vapang kan hrût kan hrût a, likilkawi, Mawi an ti chu kan tlung tah a; chu kâwla chun Lasai khuo a um.

en: And when much time was spent, and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast was now already gone by, Paul admonished them,
hmr: chun, ni tamtak ân hmang ta lei le, lawnga fe ṭi a um ta leiin, (Bu nghei ni chu a lo khêl ta sih a), Paula chun anni chu ân fui a,

en: and said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the lading and the ship, but also of our lives.
hmr: an kuomah, “Puhai, tuta lawnga fe hi sietna le bohmangna nasatak a tlung ding a nih ti ka hriet, thuomhnaw le lawng chunga chau ka ti nawh a; eini chunga khawm ka ti a nih,” a ta.

en: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship, than to those things which were spoken by Paul.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, sipai za hotu chun, Paula thu hril nêk chun lawngpu le lawng neitu thu hril a awi lem a.

en: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to put to sea from thence, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there; which is a haven of Crete, looking north-east and south-east.
hmr: Chun, thlasik tuorna dingin likilkawi chu a rem naw leiin, a tam lemin chutaka inthawka tuisuorieta fe suoka, Phoiniki tlung hrâma, chutaka thlasik tuor an rawtpui a; Phoiniki chu Kret thlierkâra likil- kawi pakhat a nih, hmâr sak le sim sak sawng a nih.

en: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, they weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close in shore.
hmr: Chun, sim thli chu damtê tea a hung hrâng phingle chun, an ditzâwng an hmu amanih an sâwn a, thîrchakai chu an khaisuok a, Kret thlierkâr pang chu an hrût an hrût a.

en: But after no long time there beat down from it a tempestuous wind, which is called Euraquilo:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, sâwt nawtê hnunga chun khawmuol tienga chun thli natak a hung hrâng thla tah a, chu thli chu Eurokuilo an ti hlak.

en: and when the ship was caught, and could not face the wind, we gave way to it, and were driven.
hmr: Chun, lawng chu a hung nam fûk a, thli tieng ân nghat thei naw phingleh kan inthla tah a, a mi lên a mi lên el tah a.

en: And running under the lee of a small island called Cauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat:
hmr: A hming Klauda thlierkâr chîtê phên thli inupna tieng chun kan zâm a, intak takin lawnglêng kan hum thei hrâm a.

en: and when they had hoisted it up, they used helps, under-girding the ship; and, fearing lest they should be cast upon the Syrtis, they lowered the gear, and so were driven.
hmr: Chun, an keisuok hnungin ṭhangpuina hrui dâm an hmang a, lawng hnuoitieng an lâk vêt a, an khuop a. Puon zarna iengkim an sukthlûk a, chuong naw chun Surtia inlên lût an ṭih a, chuongchun, a mi lên a mi lên tah a.

en: And as we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw the freight overboard;
hmr: Chun, a zîngah tuifâwnin a mi vawr hrep lei chun, lawng thuom- hnaw chu tuiah an pei ṭan tah a.

en: and the third day they cast out with their own hands the tackling of the ship.
hmr: A zîng nâwk chun anni kut ngeiin lawng thuomhnaw an pei suok nâwk tah a.

en: And when neither sun nor stars shone upon us for many days, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was now taken away.
hmr: Chun, ni sâwttak nisa khawm, arasi khawm ân lang nawh a, thlipui namênin a mi nuoi nawh a, dam hrim kan inbeisei ta nawh a.

en: And when they had been long without food, then Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.
hmr: Chun, bu fa loa sâwttak an um hnungin, Paula anni laiah a ngîr a; “Puhai, Kret thlierkâra khan sût loin, ka thu kha awi unla, hieng sietna le bohmangna hi in tlung naw ding bah.

en: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer; for there shall be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tukhawm hin lungmuongtaka um dingin kân fui cheu, nangni lai tukhawmin in hringna inhmang naw ti niu, lawng ruok hi chu ân hmang ding a ni hi.

en: For there stood by me this night an angel of the God whose I am, whom also I serve,
hmr: A ta ka na, a rawng ka bâwl hlak Pathien kha, ama vântirko pakhat vawizân hin ka kâwlah a hung ngîr a, ka kuomah,

en: saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must stand before Cæsar: and lo, God hath granted thee all them that sail with thee.
hmr: ‘Paula, ṭi naw, Kaisar hmaah i ngîr ding a nih; chun, ngai rawh, lawnga i kuoma fehai po po khawm hi Pathienin a pêk che a nih,’ a mi ti a nih.

en: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even so as it hath been spoken unto me.
hmr: Chuleiin, Puhai, lungmuong- takin um ro; Pathien ka ring a, a mi hril ang peiin a um ding a nih.

en: But we must be cast upon a certain island.
hmr: Chuleiin, thlierkâr ienga manih a mi lên suok ding a nih,” a ta.

en: But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven to and fro in the sea of Adria, about midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some country:
hmr: Chun, Adria tuisuorietah thliin khing tieng khing tieng a mi lên a mi lên a, zân sâwm le pali a tling zân chun, zân ril vêlah lawng mihai chun khâwlai khawmuol amanih tlung dingin an inhriet a.

en: and they sounded, and found twenty fathoms; and after a little space, they sounded again, and found fifteen fathoms.
hmr: Chuongchun, tui inthûkzie an inkhih a, hlam sâwmhni niin an hriet a; chun, sâwt nawtêah an inkhi nâwk a, hlam sâwm le panga niin an hriet a.

en: And fearing lest haply we should be cast ashore on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for the day.
hmr: Chun, lawng mei tieng thîr- chakai pali an thlâk a, chuong naw chun lungkho lai mi lên suok hlau rawi a tih, an tih a; chun, khuo var kâr an nghâkhla hle a.

en: And as the sailors were seeking to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, under color as though they would lay out anchors from the foreship,
hmr: Chun, lawng mihai chun lawng lu tieng chun thîrchakaihai thlâk ding anga thaw tehlêmin, lawnglêng chu tuisuorietah an thlâk a, lawng chu tlân san an tum a.

en: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.
hmr: Chu lai chun Paulain sipai za hotu le sipaihai kuoma chun, “Hienghai hi lawngah an um zing naw chun him thei naw ti niu,” a ta.

en: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.
hmr: Chuongchun, sipaihai chun lawnglêng hruihai chu an ât tan a, an inthla tah a.

en: And while the day was coming on, Paul besought them all to take some food, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing.
hmr: Chun, khawvar tâwm chun Paulain mi po po chu bu fa dingin a tir a, “Vawisûn hi ni sâwmpali a ni tah, iengkhawm fa loin in nghâk a, in nghei zing a nih.

en: Wherefore I beseech you to take some food: for this is for your safety: for there shall not a hair perish from the head of any of you.
hmr: Chuleiin, bu fa dingin ka tir cheu hi; in damna ding a ni hi; nangni laia tukhawm a samzai pakhat khawm bohmang naw ni,” a ta.

en: And when he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all; and he brake it, and began to eat.
hmr: Chun, chu thu chu a hril zoin bei a lâk a, mi po po hmaa chun Pathien kuomah lâwmthu a hril tah a; chun, a khawi a, a fâk phut tah a.

en: Then were they all of good cheer, and themselves also took food.
hmr: Anni khawm thlamuongtakin an um a, bu an fâk ve tah a.

en: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.
hmr: Lawnga mi chu kan rêngin za hni sâwmsari paruk kan nih.

en: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.
hmr: Chun, an fâk khawp chun bu chu tuisuorietah an pei a, lawng an sukzâng deu a.

en: And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they perceived a certain bay with a beach, and they took counsel whether they could drive the ship upon it.
hmr: Chun, nisa a suok chun, khawmuol chu khâwlai am a ni an hriet nawh a; nisienlakhawm, khâwlai likilkawi amanih ṭieupho an hmuh a, chu chunga chun a thei chun lawng chu intlan suoktir an tum a.

en: And casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time loosing the bands of the rudders; and hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach.
hmr: Thîrchakai thlungnahai chu an ât tan a, tuisuorietah an mâksan a; chu ruol chun a karherna khuop- nahai chu an sût a, hma tieng puon zar chu thli imût ding zawngin an khai sâng a; ṭieupho chu an pan tah a.

en: But lighting upon a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground; and the foreship struck and remained unmoveable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tuihrât pahni intuokna hmunah kan lût hlau a, lawng chu hnuoi an insuktir tah a. Chuongchun, lawng lu tieng chu ân tâng tlat a, sukchâng ruol loin a um zing a, a mawngtieng ruok chu tuifâwn a nasat leiin a kawi ṭan tah a.

en: And the soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.
hmr: Chun, sipaihaiin intânghai chu sukhlum an rawt a, chuong naw chun, tui inhlieu kai dâm um an ta, tlân hmang an tih ti an ṭih a.

en: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stayed them from their purpose; and commanded that they who could swim should cast themselves overboard, and get first to the land;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, sipai za hotu chun Paula sanhim a nuom a, an thil tum chu a khap a. Tui inhlieu thei po tuisuorieta chun inchâwm thlâk a, khawmuol lo kai hmasa ding le,

en: and the rest, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. And so it came to pass, that they all escaped safe to the land.
hmr: mi danghai chu, a ṭhen thingphêk chunghaiah, a ṭhen lawng thuomhnaw dang chunghaiah kai dingin thu a pêk a. Chuong ang chun an rêngin khawmuolah himtakin an kai seng tah a.

en: And when we were escaped, then we knew that the island was called Melita.
hmr: Chun, kan kai zo chun, thlierkâr hming chu Malta a nih ti kan hriet tah a.

en: And the barbarians showed us no common kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
hmr: Chu ram mihai chun lunginsiet namênin an mi lo lunginsiet nawh a; ruo a hung sûr lei le a dei leiin mei an sêm a, kan rêngin an mi lo lâwm a.

en: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out by reason of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
hmr: Chun, Paula chun thing têl khat ân khâwm a, meia chun a tih a, a lum leiin rûl a hung suok a, a kutah a chuk a, a kawp zing a.

en: And when the barbarians saw the venomous creature hanging from his hand, they said one to another, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped from the sea, yet Justice hath not suffered to live.
hmr: Chun, chu ram mihai chun thilhring a kuta inkhai zing chu an hmu chun, “Hi mipa hi tuolthattu a ni phawt el, tuisuorieta inthawkin tlân suok sienla khawm, Phuba latu chun a dam a awi ta naw a ni hi,” an ta.

en: Howbeit he shook off the creature into the fire, and took no harm.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun thilhring chu meiah a thinthlâk a, iengkhawm a ti nawh a.

en: But they expected that he would have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but when they were long in expectation and beheld nothing amiss come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.
hmr: Anni ruok chun ân vûng amanih, kârloa thia a tlûk nghâl amanih an ring a; chun, sâwttak an nghâk zing a, iengkhawm a ti nawh ti an hriet chun an lungril an inlet a, “Pathien a ni hi,” an ti ta lem a.

en: Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius; who received us, and entertained us three days courteously.
hmr: Chun, chu hmun kâwla chun chu thlierkâra laltak a hming Publia ram a um a, ama chun a mi lo lâwm a, ni thum lâwmtakin a mîn tlungtir a.

en: And it was so, that the father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery: unto whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laying his hands on him healed him.
hmr: Chun, Publia pa chu khawsik le santên invawiin a lo zâl zing a; chun, Paula a kuomah a lût a, a ṭawngṭai a, a chungah a kuthai ân nghat a, a sukdam tah a.

en: And when this was done, the rest also that had diseases in the island came, and were cured:
hmr: Chu chu a thaw zo chun, chu thlierkâra natna nei po chu an hung a, an dam tâwl tah a; chuhai chun nasatakin an mi chawimawi a,

en: who also honored us with many honors; and when we sailed, they put on board such things as we needed.
hmr: chun, kan fe dingin kan ma- mawhai chu lawngah an sie tâwl a.

en: And after three months we set sail in a ship of Alexandria which had wintered in the island, whose sign was The Twin Brothers.
hmr: Chun, thla thum chenah a hming Dioskuri, Alexandria khaw lawng, thlasika thlierkâra um tah, chu lawnga chun kan fe tah a.

en: And touching at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.
hmr: Chun, Surakus kan sir a, chutaka chun ni thum kan châm a.

en: And from thence we made a circuit, and arrived at Rhegium: and after one day a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli;
hmr: Chutaka inthawkin kan fe kuol a, Regium kan tlung a; chun, ni khat chenah sim thli a hung hrâng a, a zîng nâwk chun Puteoli kan tlung nâwk a.

en: where we found brethren, and were entreated to tarry with them seven days: and so we came to Rome.
hmr: Chutaka chun unauhai kan hmuh a, an kuoma ni sari châm dingin an mi thlêm a; chuong ang chun Rom tieng kan fe ta pei a.

en: And from thence the brethren, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns; whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.
hmr: Chun, unauhaiin kan chanchin an hriet phingleh chutaka inthawk chun Appia Dâwr le Khuolbûk pathum chenah mi tuok dingin an hung a; anni chu a hmu chun Pathien kuomah Paulain lâwmthu a hril a, ân sukhuoi tah a.

en: And when we entered into Rome, Paul was suffered to abide by himself with the soldier that guarded him.
hmr: Chun, Roma kan lût chun, Paula chu a vêngtu sipai kuomah a khât chaua um an phal a.

en: And it came to pass, that after three days he called together those that were the chief of the Jews: and when they were come together, he said unto them, I, brethren, though I had done nothing against the people, or the customs of our fathers, yet was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans:
hmr: Chun, ni thum chenah Paula chun Judahai hotuhai deu deu a ko khâwm a; chun, an hung inkhâwmin, an kuomah, “Unauhai, mi po po le ei thlatuhai dân chungah iengkhawm ka thaw naw khawmin Jerusalema inthawkin Roma mihai kuomah an mîn tângtir a nih.

en: who, when they had examined me, desired to set me at liberty, because there was no cause of death in me.
hmr: Anni chun an mi suosal zoin thina khawp meu ka chungah iengkhawm a um naw leiin mîn suo an tum a.

en: But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Cæsar; not that I had aught whereof to accuse my nation.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Judahaiin chu chu an sêl leiin Kaisar kuomah intlun naw thei ka ni ta nawh a; nisienlakhawm, ka chihai hêkna neia thaw ka ni nawh.

en: For this cause therefore did I entreat you to see and to speak with me: for because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.
hmr: Chuong kawnga chun nangni inhmupui ding cheuin le inbiekpui ding cheuin ka ko cheu a nih; Israelhai beisei kân ṭâwmpui leia hi khaidiet hi bun ka ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And they said unto him, We neither received letters from Judæa concerning thee, nor did any of the brethren come hither and report or speak any harm of thee.
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “I chanchin Judai rama inthawkin lekhahaiin kan hmu si nawh a, unau- hai hitaka hungin tukhawmin i chunga thupawi an hrilsuok si nawh, phuong khawm an phuong bawk nawh.

en: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hi pâwl hi ram tinah hrilsiet a ni sih a, nangin ieng- tin am i ngai a hriet kan nuom,” an ta.

en: And when they had appointed him a day, they came to him into his lodging in great number; to whom he expounded the matter, testifying the kingdom of God, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning till evening.
hmr: Chun, ni an tiem a, chu ni chun a tlung inah mi tamtak a kuomah an hung a, zîngkâra inthawkin zântieng chenin an kuomah chu thu chu a hrilfie a, Pathien ram thu ân hriettir a, Mosie Dân Lekhabu thu le Zâwlneihai Lekhabu thuin Isu tieng anni a thlêm a thlêm a.

en: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.
hmr: Chun, a ṭhenin a thu hril chu an ring a, a ṭhen chun an ring nawh a.

en: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Spirit through Isaiah the prophet unto your fathers,
hmr: An inngei ta nawh a, Paulain thu baukhat a hril zoin an suok tah a. A thu hril chu hi hi a nih: — “Thlarau Inthiengin zâwlnei Isai bauin in thlatuhai kuoma a hril kha ân dik ngawt el,

en: saying, Go thou unto this people, and say, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall in no wise understand; And seeing ye shall see, and shall in no wise perceive:
hmr: Hi chihai kuoma hin va hril rawh: ‘Na chun chu hre de ti niu a, a ngaina ruok chu hre tawp naw ti niu, Hmu chu hmûng in ta, hriet chu hre tawp naw ti niu;

en: For this people’s heart is waxed gross, And their ears are dull of hearing, And their eyes they have closed; Lest haply they should perceive with their eyes, And hear with their ears, And understand with their heart, And should turn again, And I should heal them.
hmr: Hi chihai lungril hi a lo ngawng tah a, An nahai a lo sêt deu a, An insîm bawk a, Chuong naw chun ei mitin hmûng ei ta, Ei nain hrieng ei ta, Ei lungrilin hre bawk ei ta, Ngha kîr nâwk rawi ei ta, Amain mi sukdam hlau rawi a tih,’ an tih a,” a ti kha.

en: Be it known therefore unto you, that this salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles: they will also hear.
hmr: “Chuongchun, Pathien sandam- na thu hi Jentailhai kuomah inphur a nih ti hi hre ro, anni chun chu ngai khawm ngai an tih,” a ta.
[Chuongchun, hieng thuhai hi a hril zo chun, Judahai chu an ṭin a, anni le anni nasatakin an insêl a.]

en: And he abode two whole years in his own hired dwelling, and received all that went in unto him,
hmr: Chun, Paula chu kum hni pumhlûm ama in hawah a um a, a kuoma lût taphawt a lâwm hlak a,

en: preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, none forbidding him.
hmr: Pathien ram thu a hril a, Lal Isu Krista thu khawm huoitakin ân chûktir hlak, tukhawmin ama an khap si nawh a.

en: Now Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
hmr: Chun, Peter le Johan chu chawhnung inher, ṭawngṭai hun lai chun, Pathien biekina lût ding chun an hang feh a.

en: And a certain man that was lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;
hmr: Chun, patling tu amanih a pieng tira inthawka ke inbai an hung zâwn a, ama chu biekina lûthai kuoma kut daw dingin, biekin kawtkhâr, “Maawi,” an ti bula chun, ni tin an inzâltir hlak a.

en: who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, asked to receive an alms.
hmr: Ama chun Peter le Johan Pathien biekina lût ding chu a hmuh a, kut a dawh a.

en: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him, with John, said, Look on us.
hmr: Chun, Peter le Johanin ama chu an en zing a. Peterin, “Keini mi hang en ta,” a ta.

en: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something from them.
hmr: Ama chun an kuoma inthawka ieng amanih hmu a beisei a, a hang en a.

en: But Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but what I have, that give I thee. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peterin, “Tang- ka le rângkachak iengkhawm ka nei nawh; nisienlakhawm, ka nei sun pêng ka ti che; Nazareth Isu Krista hmingin kein lâwn ta rawh,” a ta.

en: And he took him by the right hand, and raised him up: and immediately his feet and his ankle-bones received strength.
hmr: A kut changtieng a chel a, a keitho tah a. Chun, kârloin a kehai le a kemit ruhai chu a hung hrât nghâl tah a.

en: And leaping up, he stood, and began to walk; and he entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.
hmr: Chun, ama chu ân châwm tho a, a ngîr a, a kein a lâwn phut tah a. Kea lâwn lâwn le, inchâwm le, Pathien inpâk pum peiin biekina chun a lût ve tah a.

en: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:
hmr: Chun, keâ lâwn le Pathien ân pâk chu mi po poin an hmuh a;

en: and they took knowledge of him, that it was he that sat for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple; and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.
hmr: biekin kawtkhâr, Mawi, bula kut dawa ṭhung hlak kha a nih ti an hriet a; a chunga thil tlung chu mak an ti bêk bêk a, an buoi hle el a.

en: And as he held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
hmr: Chun, ama chun Peter le Johan chu a chel zing laiin, mi po poin mak an ti bêk bêk a, Solomon tuolpûk an tia chun, an kuomah an hung tlân khâwm a.

en: And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this man? or why fasten ye your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him to walk?
hmr: Peterin chu chu a hmu chun, mihai chu a biek a, “Nangni Israel mihai, hieng hi iengdinga mak in ti am a na? Keini thilthawtheina le Pathien kan ngaisak leia ama hi kan inlâwntir ang el chun iengdinga in mi en zing am?

en: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Servant Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied before the face of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.
hmr: Abraham hai, Isak hai, Jakob hai Pathien, ei thlatuhai Pathien chun, a siehlaw Isu chu a chawimawi ta a ni hi; ama chu in inmantir a, Pilatin insuo a tum khawmin a hmaah in lo dit naw kha.

en: But ye denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted unto you,
hmr: Mi inthieng le feltak kha in dit nawh a, tuolthattu kha in kuoma pêk in ngên ta lem a.

en: and killed the Prince of life; whom God raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.
hmr: Hringna Siemtu chu in that a; nisienlakhawm, Pathienin ama chu mithi laia inthawkin a keitho nâwk tah; chu chu a hretuhai kan nih.

en: And by faith in his name hath his name made this man strong, whom ye behold and know: yea, the faith which is through him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
hmr: Chun, ama hming ring leiin, a hming chun hi mipa in hmu le in hriet hlak hi a sukhrât tah a nih; anih, ama leia ringna hung um hin, in rênga mithmuah a sukdam var tah a ni hi.

en: And now, brethren, I know that in ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, unauhai, in hotuhai khawmin an inmâwl leia an thaw ang khan, in inmâwl leiin hieng hi in thaw a nih ti ka hriet.

en: But the things which God foreshowed by the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathienin zâwlnei po po bauah, Krista chun rinum a tuor ding thu ân hriettir lâwk kha; khâng ang khan ân tlungtir ta lem a nih.

en: Repent ye therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, that so there may come seasons of refreshing from the presence of the Lord;
hmr: Chuleiin, in suolhai thâibo a ni theina dingin sim unla, ngha kîr nâwk ro,

en: and that he may send the Christ who hath been appointed for you, even Jesus:
hmr: chuongchun, Lalpa kuoma in- thawka har hunhai la hung tlung thei a tih, Krista Isu, in ta dinga a iruot khawm kha hung tir thei a tih.

en: whom the heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, whereof God spake by the mouth of his holy prophets that have been from of old.
hmr: Amiruokchu, iengkim siem ṭhat hun a tlung hmakhat chu vânin ama chu a la kawl hri ding a nih; chu siem ṭhat ding thu chu Pathienin leihnuoi insieng tira inthawk a zâwlnei inthieng umhai bauin a hril ta kha.

en: Moses indeed said, A prophet shall the Lord God raise up unto you from among your brethren, like unto me; to him shall ye hearken in all things whatsoever he shall speak unto you.
hmr: Mosie ngeiin, Lalpa Pathienin kei a mi siem ang hin in unauhai lai zâwlnei pakhat siempêk a ti cheu. Ama chun, thu po po in kuoma a hril taphawt chu ngaipêk in tih.

en: And it shall be, that every soul that shall not hearken to that prophet, shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.
hmr: Chun, mi tûkhawm, chu zâwlnei thu chu ngai naw taphawt chu, mi laia inthawk sukbohmang dai nîng an tih,” a ti kha.

en: Yea and all the prophets from Samuel and them that followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.
hmr: Anih, Samuel um chena in- thawk zâwlnei po po, an hnunga mihai leh, thu hril taphawt kha, tulai chanchin hi an hril lâwk bawk hlak.

en: Ye are the sons of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with your fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
hmr: Nangni hi zâwlneihai le thu- thlung nauhai in nih, Pathienin Abraham kuomah, “ ‘I thlahai leiin khawvêla hnam tin thawveng an tih,’ tiin in thlatuhai kuomah a tiem kha.

en: Unto you first God, having raised up his Servant, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your iniquities.
hmr: Pathienin a Siehlaw chu a ruot a, in suolhai innghatsantir seng cheua mal sâwmpêk ding cheuin, nangni kuomah a hung tir hmasa tak a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And as they spake unto the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came upon them,
hmr: Chun, Peter le Johanin mihai kuomah thu an hril leiin, thiempuhai, biekin hotuhai, Saddu- kaihai chu an kuom an hung tlung phut a.

en: being sore troubled because they taught the people, and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
hmr: Mi an inchûktir le Isu leiin mithi laia inthawka thonâwk thu an hril leiin an lungninaw bêk bêk a.

en: And they laid hands on them, and put them in ward unto the morrow: for it was now eventide.
hmr: Chun, an man a, zântieng a ni leiin a zîng chena dingin intângna inah an khum tah a.

en: But many of them that heard the word believed; and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thu ngaihai a ṭhen tamtakin an awi a; an tam tieng chu patling ruok khawm sâng nga lai an tling a.

en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem;
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun an hotuhai, upahai, Dân inchûktirtuhai, Jeru- salemah an um khâwm a,

en: and Annas the high priest was there, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest.
hmr: Thiempu Laltak Anna hai, Kaia- pha hai, Johan hai, Alexandra hai, Thiempu Laltak chihai po po le chun.

en: And when they had set them in the midst, they inquired, By what power, or in what name, have ye done this?
hmr: Chun, Peter le Johan chu a laiah an inngîrtir a, “Ieng thuneinain am, tu hmingin am hieng hi in thaw a?” an ta, an indawn a.

en: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders,
hmr: Chuongchun, Peter chu Thlarau Inthiengin a sip a, an kuomah, “Mi po po hotuhai, upahai,

en: if we this day are examined concerning a good deed done to an impotent man, by what means this man is made whole;
hmr: mi hrâtnaw sukṭhat thuah, ‘Hi mipa hi ieng leiin am a hung dam tah a?’ tiin vawisûn hin in mi fie a ni chun,

en: be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, even in him doth this man stand here before you whole.
hmr: nangni po poin hre ro, Israel mi po khawmin hre raw se, Nazareth Isu Krista krawsa in hemde Pathienin mithi laia inthawka a ikeitho nâwk kha, ama hming ngeiin hi mipa hi hitaka hin in hmaah damin a ngîr tah a ni hi.

en: He is the stone which was set at nought of you the builders, which was made the head of the corner.
hmr: Nangni in bâwltuhai, in lung dehâwn, a kia lung ṭhangkaitak lo ni ta kha ama hi a nih.

en: And in none other is there salvation: for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, wherein we must be saved.
hmr: Mi dang tu kuoma khawm san- damna a um nawh; vânkhuphnuoia mihriem isak lai, a mi sandam ding hming dang hrim a um nawh,” a ta.

en: Now when they beheld the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.
hmr: Chun, Peter le Johan huoizie chu an hmu chun lekha thiemnaw le mi narân el an nih ti an hrietin, mak an ti hleh a; Isu kuomah an um tah ti an hriet tah a.

en: And seeing the man that was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
hmr: Chun, mi an sukdam chu an kâwla ngîr an hmuh a, iengkhawm an sawisêl thei si nawh.

en: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
hmr: Chuongchun, an rorêlnaa in- thawk a an infetir hnungin an inrawn a,

en: saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been wrought through them, is manifest to all that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot deny it.
hmr: “Hieng mihai hi iengtin am thâwng ei ta? Thilmak inthangtak an thaw ti Jerusalema um po poin an hriet ta hi; eini khawmin ei sêl thei si nawh a.

en: But that it spread no further among the people, let us threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi kuoma ân phuong nâwk zuol nawna dingin, tuta inthawk tû kuoma khawm hi hminga thu an hril nawna dingin vau ei tiu,” an ta.

en: And they called them, and charged them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chu an ko a, Isu hminga thu hril dêr lo ding an ti tlat a.

en: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it is right in the sight of God to hearken unto you rather than unto God, judge ye:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peter le Johan- in an kuomah, “Pathien mithmuin, Pathien thu zâwm nêkin nangni thu zâwm ân dik lem am chu, ngaituo ro.

en: for we cannot but speak the things which we saw and heard.
hmr: Keini chu thil kan hmu le kan hriethai kha hril loin kan um thei nawh,” an ta.

en: And they, when they had further threatened them, let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people; for all men glorified God for that which was done.
hmr: Chun, anni chun an vau nâwk zuol a, an insuo tah a. Mipui leiin hremna remchâng an hmu nawh; an thilthaw lei khan mi po poin Pathien an chawimawi sih a.

en: For the man was more than forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was wrought.
hmr: Thilmaka an isukdam chu kum sâwmli nêk hmana ta m lem a ni sih a.

en: And being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said unto them.
hmr: Chun, Peter le Johan chu an suok chun anni pâwlhai lai an va feh a; thiempu lalhai le upahaiin an kuoma an hril po chu an hril vawng a.

en: And they, when they heard it, lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, O Lord, thou that didst make the heaven and the earth and the sea, and all that in them is:
hmr: Chuongchun, a ngaihai chun a ruolin rawl inringtakin Pathien kuomah, “Lalpa, nang hnuoi hai, vân hai, tuisuoriet hai, a sûnga um po pohai siemtu i nih;

en: who by the Holy Spirit, by the mouth of our father David thy servant, didst say, Why did the Gentiles rage, And the peoples imagine vain things?
hmr: nangin Thlarau Inthiengin, kan thlatu i siehlaw David bauin, hieng thu hi i hril a nih:- ‘Jentailhai iengdinga an lunginsen am? Hnam tinin iengdinga thil teplo an ngaituo am a na?

en: The kings of the earth set themselves in array, And the rulers were gathered together, Against the Lord, and against his Anointed:
hmr: Khawvêl lalhaiin an ep huoi huoi a, Hotuhai khawm an pung khâwm a, Lalpa le a Krista chunga chun,’ tiin.

en: for of a truth in this city against thy holy Servant Jesus, whom thou didst anoint, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel, were gathered together,
hmr: “Hi khuoa hin i siehlaw in- thieng, i hriek nâl, Isu chunga khan Herod le Pontia Pilat le, Jentailhai le Israel mihai an pungkhâwm tak zet a nih;

en: to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel foreordained to come to pass.
hmr: i kut le i lungrilin tlung dinga i ruot lâwk taphawt kha thaw dingin.

en: And now, Lord, look upon their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants to speak thy word with all boldness,
hmr: Chuongchun, tuhin Lalpa, an mi vauzie hi ngai ta; i suokhai hi huoitakin i thu inhriltir la,

en: while thou stretchest forth thy hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of thy holy Servant Jesus.
hmr: mihai sukdam dingin i kut phar bawk rawh; i siehlaw inthieng Isu hmingin inchikna le thilmakhai inthawtir bawk rawh,” an ta.

en: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken wherein they were gathered together; and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spake the word of God with boldness.
hmr: Chun, an ṭawngṭai zo chun an umna in chu a hung inhnîng a, an rêngin Thlarau Inthiengin an hung sip a, huoitakin Pathien thu an hril tah a.

en: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and soul: and not one of them said that aught of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.
hmr: Chun, a ringtu mipuihai chu lungril hmunkhat le ngaituo hmun- khatin an um a; anni laia pakhat khawmin an sum nei, “Ka ta bîk a nih,” an ti nawh; thil po po an inṭâwm lem hlak.

en: And with great power gave the apostles their witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.
hmr: Chun, tirkohai chun awium- takin Lal Isu thonâwk thu an inhriettir hlak a, an rênga chungah lunginsietna nasatak a um.

en: For neither was there among them any that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,
hmr: Chun, anni lai khawm tlasam tukhawm an um nawh, hnuoihai, inhai nei taphawtin an zawr a, an thil zawrhai chu a man an hung chawi a,

en: and laid them at the apostles’ feet: and distribution was made unto each, according as any one had need.
hmr: tirkohai ke bulah an sie hlak a; an mamaw dai tâwk sengin an sem seng hlak.

en: And Joseph, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of exhortation), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race,
hmr: Chun, Josef, tirkohaiin Barna- ba an ti chu, (chu hming umzie chu “Thlamuongna nau,” tina a nih), Levi chi, Kupra thlierkâra mi a na,

en: having a field, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
hmr: a lo nei chu zawrin a man a hung chawi a, tirkohai ke bulah a sie tah a.

en: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi pakhat a hming Anania a nuhmei Saphira leh an um a, Anania chun hnuoi a zawr a, a nuhmei hrietin a man a ṭhen a ip tah a.

en: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
hmr: Chun, a ṭhen a hung chawi a, tirkohai ke bula chun a sie a.

en: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thy heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peterin, “Ana- nia, Thlarau Inthieng hlêm ding le, hnuoi man a ṭhen ip dingin iengdinga Setanin I lungril a suksip am a na?

en: While it remained, did it not remain thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thy power? How is it that thou hast conceived this thing in thy heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.
hmr: A um sûng po khan i ta a ni zing a ni naw am a nih? I zawr hnung khawm khan a man chu i thu thua um a ni naw am a nih? Iengdinga hieng thu hi i lungrila i ngaituo am a na? Mihriem hlêm i ni nawh a, Pathien kuoma khêl hril i ni lem,” a ta.

en: And Ananias hearing these words fell down and gave up the ghost: and great fear came upon all that heard it.
hmr: Chun, Anania chun chuong thu chu a hriet phingleh a tluh a, a thi tah a; chun, a hre taphawt chun an ṭi ta bêk bêk a.

en: And the young men arose and wrapped him round, and they carried him out and buried him.
hmr: Chun, tlangvâlhai chu an tho a, an tuom a, an zâwn suok a, an phûm tah a.

en: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
hmr: Chun, dârkar thum lai hnunga chun, a nuhmei chu thil umzie chu hre loin a hung lût a.

en: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much. And she said, Yea, for so much.
hmr: Chun, Peterin a kuomah, “Mi hril rawh, Hnuoi chu hieng zât char hin maw in zawr?” a ta. Ama chun, “Uou, hieng zât char hin a nih,” a ta.

en: But Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to try the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them that have buried thy husband are at the door, and they shall carry thee out.
hmr: Chun, Peterin a kuomah, “Ieng- dinga Lalpa Thlarau infiena dinga in inthuruol am? Ngai ta, i pasal phûmtuhai kepha chu kawtkhâr bulah a hung um tah, nang khawm zâwn dawk an ti che,” a ta.

en: And she fell down immediately at his feet, and gave up the ghost: and the young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.
hmr: Chun, kârloin a ke bula chun a tlu nghâl tah a, a thi ve tah a; chun, tlangvâlhai chu an hung lût a, ama chu a thisain an hung hmuh a, an zâwn dawk a, a pasal kâwla chun an phûm tah a.

en: And great fear came upon the whole church, and upon all that heard these things.
hmr: Chun, kohranhai po po le chuong thu hre taphawt chun an ṭi ta bêk bêk a.

en: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people: and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
hmr: Chun, mi lai Pathienin tirkohai kutin inchikna le thilmak tamtak a thaw hlak. Annirawi chu an rêngin lungril hmunkhatin Solomon Tuol- pûka chun an inkhâwm hlak.

en: But of the rest durst no man join himself to them: howbeit the people magnified them;
hmr: Mi dang ruok chu tukhawm anni lai an ṭhang ve ngam ta nawh; nisienlakhawm, anni chu miin an inpâk hlak.

en: and believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women:
hmr: Chun, a ring tharhai nuhmei le pasal tamtakin Lalpa kuoma chun an hung belsa nâwk zuol hlak a.

en: insomuch that they even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that, as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some one of them.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi damnawhai khawm kawtthlêrhaiah an zâwn dawk a, khumahai, puonphaahai an inzâltir a, “Peter fe malamin a hlimin a ṭhen bêk a hlie theina dingin,” an ta.

en: And there also came together the multitude from the cities round about Jerusalem, bringing sick folk, and them that were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem kâwl vêl khuoa inthawkin mipuihai khawm chu damnawhai, khawhri inthieng- naw isawisakhai hung ṭhuoiin an hung khâwm a; chuonghai khawm chu an hung dam ta seng a.

en: But the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy,
hmr: Chun, thiempu Laltak le a ruolhai po po an hung inthawk a, (chuong a ruolhai chu Saddukai pâwl an nih,) an îtthîk bêk bêk a,

en: and laid hands on the apostles, and put them in public ward.
hmr: tirkohai chu an man a, vântlâng intângna inah an khum tah a.

en: But an angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them out, and said,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Lalpa vântirko pakhatin, kawtkhârhai chu a hung hawng a, a ṭhuoi suok tah a,

en: Go ye, and stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this Life.
hmr: “Pathien biekinah va ngîr unla, mi kuomah hieng hringna thu po po hi va hril ro,” a ta.

en: And when they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison-house to have them brought.
hmr: Chun, chu thu chu an hrietin khawvar hun vêla chun Pathien biekinah an va lût a, an inchûktir a. Nisienlakhawm, Thiempu Laltak le a ruolhai chu an hung a, rorêltuhai le Israel thlahai upahai po po an ko khâwm a, tirkohai chu hung inṭhuoitir dingin intângna ina chun mi an tir a.

en: But the officers that came found them not in the prison; and they returned, and told,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, manmihai chu an va tlung chun intângna ina chun anni chu an hmu si nawh; chuong- chun, an kîr nâwk a,

en: saying, The prison-house we found shut in all safety, and the keepers standing at the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.
hmr: “Intângna in chu himtaka inkhârin, a vêngtuhai khawm kawt- khâr bula ngîrin kan hmu sih a; nisienlakhawm, kan hei hawng a, a sûngah tukhawm kan hmu si nawh,” tiin an hril a.

en: Now when the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were much perplexed concerning them whereunto this would grow.
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekin hotu le thiempu lalhaiin chuong thu chu an hrietin, “Hieng hi iengtin tak inphuong a ti maw?” tiin an thua chun an lunginzîng ta bêk bêk a.

en: And there came one and told them, Behold, the men whom ye put in the prison are in the temple standing and teaching the people.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat a hung a, an kuomah, “Ngai ta u, intângna ina mi inkhumhai khan Pathien biekinah ngîrin mi an inchûktir ka ti!” tiin an hung hril a.

en: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them, but without violence; for they feared the people, lest they should be stoned.
hmr: Chuongchun, hotu chu manmi- hai le chun an va feh a, vântlâng an ṭi leiin tlangtakin an hung ṭhuoi a, chuong naw chun lunga dêng an ṭih a.

en: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest asked them,
hmr: Chun, an hung ṭhuoi tlung chun rorêltuhai hmaa chun an inngîrtir a. Chun, Thiempu Laltak chun an kuomah,

en: saying, We strictly charged you not to teach in this name: and behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.
hmr: “Hi hming hin inchûktir lo ding kan ti tlat ta cheu kha; hre ro, in thu inchûktirin Jerusalem in suksip vawng ta hi; chu mipa sukhlum bul chu mîn tumtir in tum a ni hi,” tiin a suosal a.

en: But Peter and the apostles answered and said, We must obey God rather than men.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peter le tirko- hai chun, “Mihriem thu nêkin Pathien thu kan zâwm lem ding a nih.

en: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew, hanging him on a tree.
hmr: Nangnîn Isu thinga khaikângin in sukhlum kha, ei thlatuhai Pathienin a keitho nâwk tah a nih.

en: Him did God exalt with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.
hmr: Ama ngei kha Pathienin Lal le Sandamtua um dingin a changtieng a chawimawi tah, Israelhai suol insim- tir ding le ngaidam dingin.

en: And we are witnesses of these things; and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God hath given to them that obey him.
hmr: Chuong thu chu, a hretuhai kan ni hi, Thlarau Inthieng, Pathienin a thu zâwm taphawthai kuoma a pêk kha, a hretu a ni ve bawk a,” an ta, an dawn a.

en: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and were minded to slay them.
hmr: Chun, anni chun chuong thu chu an hrietin an lungril a khei tah a, sukhlum an tum tah a.

en: But there stood up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in honor of all the people, and commanded to put the men forth a little while.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, rorêltuhai lai chun, a hming Gamaliel, Pharisai, Dân hretu, mi po po laia hminginthangtak, mi pakhat chu a ngîr a, chuhai chu insuoktir phawt dingin thu a pêk a.

en: And he said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves as touching these men, what ye are about to do.
hmr: Chun, rorêltuhai kuoma chun, “Nangni Israel mihai, hihai chunga in thil thaw tum hi fîmkhur ro.

en: For before these days rose up Theudas, giving himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nought.
hmr: Tuta hma khawm khan, Theo- da, ‘Mi lien ka nih,’ tiin a hung um a, chu mipa kuoma chun mi tamtak, za li lai an lo kawp a. Ama chu sukhlumin a um tah a; a thu zâwm taphawt chu an rêngin an indar ta vawng a, iengkhawm an ni ta nawh.

en: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the enrolment, and drew away some of the people after him: he also perished; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.
hmr: Chu mipa um hnung chun, hming ziek lai khan Galili rama mi Juda kha a hung um nâwk a, a kuomah mi ṭhenkhat a hîp nâwk a, nisienlakhawm, ama chu a thi tah a, a thu zâwm taphawt chu an rêngin an indar ta vawng a.

en: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will be overthrown:
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin ka ti cheu hi, hieng mihai hi tâwk naw unla, um el raw hai se; hieng an thil thaw tum le an thilthaw hi mihriem ithaw suok el a ni chun bohmang a tih;

en: but if it is of God, ye will not be able to overthrow them; lest haply ye be found even to be fighting against God.
hmr: amiruokchu, Pathien ithaw suok a ni chun anni sukbohmang thei naw ti niu; chuong naw chun, Pathien do ni hlau rawi in tih,” a ta. Chun, a hril chu rem an ti tah a.

en: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles unto them, they beat them and charged them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
hmr: Chuongchun, tirkohai chu an ko a, an vuok a, chu zo chun Isu hminga thu hril lo ding ti tlatin an insuo tah a.

en: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for the Name.
hmr: Chuongchun, rorêltuhai laia inthawk chun an suok a, chu hming leia muolphona tuor tlâka ruot an ni leiin an lâwm hleh a.

en: And every day, in the temple and at home, they ceased not to teach and to preach Jesus as the Christ.
hmr: Chun, ni tin Pathien biekina le anni inahai, “Isu chu Krista a nih,” tiin inchûktir le hril an ma nawh.

en: Now in these days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, there arose a murmuring of the Grecian Jews against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.
hmr: Chun, chuong laia inchûktirhai an pung an pung lai chun, an ni tin thil sema chun an hmeithaihai an ngaisak naw leiin Juda, Grik ṭawng hmanghai chu Juda, Hebrai ṭawng hmanghai chungah an lo chier tah a.

en: And the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them, and said, It is not fit that we should forsake the word of God, and serve tables.
hmr: Chun, sâwm le pahnihai chun inchûktir mipuihai chu an ko a, “Pa- thien thu hril bân sanin, dawkânahai rawng kan bâwl chun ṭha naw nih.

en: Look ye out therefore, brethren, from among you seven men of good report, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.
hmr: Chuongchun, unauhai, nangni laia varna le Thlaraua sip mi hming ṭha ruok pasari thlang ro; anni chu hieng thil rêltu ding hin siem ei tih.

en: But we will continue stedfastly in prayer, and in the ministry of the word.
hmr: Keini ruok chu ṭawngṭai le thu rawngbâwlin um tlat kan tih,” an ta.

en: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolaüs a proselyte of Antioch;
hmr: Chuong thu chun mipui po po chu a suklâwm a; chuongchun, Stephan, ringna le Thlarau Inthienga sip le, Philip, Prokor, Nikanor, Timon, Parmena le Nikol Judahai saphun Antiokei mi leh an thlang a.

en: whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid their hands upon them.
hmr: Chuhai chu tirkohai hmaa chun an inngîrtir a, chun, anni chu an ṭawngṭai a, an chungah an kut an innghat a.

en: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
hmr: Chun, Pathien thu chu a hung indar a; Jerusalema inchûktirhai an pung ta bêk bêk a; thiempu laia khawm mi tamtak chu ringna awi mi an ni tah a.

en: And Stephen, full of grace and power, wrought great wonders and signs among the people.
hmr: Chun, Stephan chu zaidamna le thilthawtheinain a sip a, mi lai thilmak le inchikna ropuitak a thaw hlak a.

en: But there arose certain of them that were of the synagogue called the synagogue of the Libertines, and of the Cyrenians, and of the Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and Asia, disputing with Stephen.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Sal suokhai, Kurinia mi dâm, Alexandra khuoa mi dâm, inkhâwmna an tia mi ṭhenkhat leh, Kiliki rama mi dâm, Asia ram mi inkhâwmna ina mi ṭhenkhathai an hung inthawk a, Stephan chu an hung sêl a.

en: And they were not able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spake.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a varna le a hrilpuitu Thlarau chu an letthlâk thei nawh a.

en: Then they suborned men, who said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and against God.
hmr: Chun, mihai an tham a; chuhai chun, “Mosie le Pathien a hrilsiet kan hriet,” an ta.

en: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon him, and seized him, and brought him into the council,
hmr: Chun, mihai, upahai, Dân inchûktirtuhai, an infui a, Stephan an thawh a, an man a, rorêltuhai kuomah an ṭhuoi a.

en: and set up false witnesses, who said, This man ceaseth not to speak words against this holy place, and the law:
hmr: Chun, hretu tehlêmhai an siem a, chuhai chun, “Hi mipa hin In Inthieng le Dân hi a hrilsiet rawp hlak a;

en: for we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered unto us.
hmr: hi Nazareth Isu hin hi In hi ṭhiek a ta, Mosien dân a mi pêkhai kha sukdanglam a tih tiin a hril kan hriet,” an ta.

en: And all that sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.
hmr: Chun, rorêltuhai ṭhung po po chun Stephan an en zing a, a hmêl chu vântirko hmêl angin an hmuh a.

en: And the high priest said, Are these things so?
hmr: Chun, Thiempu Laltak chun, “Hieng thu hi ân dik am?” a ta.

en: And he said, Brethren and fathers, hearken: The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,
hmr: Chun, Stephan chun, “Unauhai, pahai ngai ta u, ei thlatu Abraham Harana a um hmaa, Mesopotamia rama a um lai khan Ropuina Pathien chu a kuomah a hung inlâr a,

en: and said unto him, Get thee out of thy land, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall show thee.
hmr: a kuomah, ‘I khuo tieng le i chihai laia inthawkin suok la, ram ka lân entir ding che tieng chun fe rawh,’ a ta.

en: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldæans, and dwelt in Haran: and from thence, when his father was dead, God removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell:
hmr: Chun, ama chu Kaldaihai rama inthawkin a suok a, Haranah a va um tah a; chun, a pa a thi hnungin chutaka inthawkin hi tuta in umna khuo tieng hin Pathienin ân pêm lûttir a.

en: and he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on: and he promised that he would give it to him in possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.
hmr: Chun, hitaka hin chu iengkhawm hmun hluo ding, a ke innghatna khawp khawm a pêk nawh a; nisienlakhawm, ama le a hnunga a thlahai chena ro dingin pêk a tiem a, nau a la nei hma ngei khawmin.

en: And God spake on this wise, that his seed should sojourn in a strange land, and that they should bring them into bondage, and treat them ill, four hundred years.
hmr: “Chun, Pathienin hieng ang hin a hril:- ‘A thlahai mi khuo tieng kum za li thang an tih, miin suokah siem an ta,suknawmna bawk an tih,’ tiin.

en: And the nation to which they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin, ‘Suoka neitu ding hnam chu keiin la ngaituong ka tih, chun,chu zoa chun hung suok an ta, hi hmuna hin ka rawng la bâwl an tih,’ a ti bawk a.

en: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so Abraham begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob the twelve patriarchs.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin a kuomah ser- tan thu kha a thlung a, chuongchun, Abraham chun, Isak a hung nei a, a ni riet niah a ser a tan a; chun Isak chun Jakob a nei a, Jakob chun chi thlatu sâwm le pahnihai kha a hung nei tah a.

en: And the patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt: and God was with him,
hmr: “Chun, chi thlatuhai khan Josef an îtthik a, Aigupta tieng an zawr a, nisienlakhawm, Pathien a kuomah a um a.

en: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
hmr: A rinum tuor po poah a san suok pei a, Aigupta ram lal Pharao khawm ân lunginsiettir a, mi vartak a ni ti ân hriettir bawk a. Chuongchun, ama chun Aigupta ram le a ina mi po po chungah hotuin a siem tah a.

en: Now there came a famine over all Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.
hmr: “Chun, Aigupta le Kanaan ram po poa chun ṭâm a hung tlah a, rinum nasatak a hung tlung tah a; ei thlatuhai chun fâk ding hrim hrim an hmu ta nawh a.

en: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent forth our fathers the first time.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jakob chun Aiguptaah bu a um ti a hriet phingleh ei thlatuhai chu a tir suok a; chu chu an fe phutna tak a nih.

en: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s race became manifest unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, an fe a vawi hninaa chun, Josef chu a unauhai kuoma chun ân hriettir a, chun Josef unauhai chu Pharao an inhriettir tah a.

en: And Joseph sent, and called to him Jacob his father, and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.
hmr: Chun, Josef chun a pa Jakob le a unau po po ân kotir a; anni chu sâwmsari le panga an nih.

en: And Jacob went down into Egypt; and he died, himself and our fathers;
