hmr: Chuongchun, Jakob chu Ai- gupta ramah a zu feh a, chutaka chun ama le ei thlatuhai chu an thi tah a,

en: and they were carried over unto Shechem, and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver of the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
hmr: Sekem khuo an zâwn tlung a, Abrahamin Sekem khuoa Hamor naupahai kuoma thlân, tangka suma a inchâwka khan an phûm tah a.

en: But as the time of the promise drew nigh which God vouchsafed unto Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
hmr: “Chun, Pathienin Abraham kuoma thu a tiem kha a hung tlung hun chu a tlung dingin, mihai chu Aiguptaa chun an pung a, an tam ta deu deu a,

en: till there arose another king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
hmr: Josef hre naw lal dang a hung um chen khan.

en: The same dealt craftily with our race, and ill-treated our fathers, that they should cast out their babes to the end they might not live.
hmr: Ama chun ei chihai chu a zai- hlêm a, a suknawmna a, an nautêhai dam lo dingin ân pei suoktir hlak.

en: At which season Moses was born, and was exceeding fair; and he was nourished three months in his father’s house:
hmr: Chu lai chun, Mosie a hung pieng a, a hmêl a ṭha bêk bêk a, a pa inah thla thum an châwm a.

en: and when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.
hmr: Chun, an pei suok chun Pharao naunu chun a lâk a, ama nau dingin a châwm tah a.

en: And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians; and he was mighty in his words and works.
hmr: “Chun, Mosie chu Aigupta mihai varna po po an inchûktir a, a thu le a thilthawah a ropui bêk bêk a.

en: But when he was well-nigh forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.
hmr: Chun, ama chu kum sâwmli a tling ding vêlin a unau Israel thlahai chu kan a tum a.

en: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him that was oppressed, smiting the Egyptian:
hmr: Chun, anni laia mi pakhat sukrinum tuor lai a hmuh a, a san a, suknawmnatna tuortu phuba chu a lâk a, Aigupta mi chu a sukhlum tah a.

en: and he supposed that his brethren understood that God by his hand was giving them deliverance; but they understood not.
hmr: Mosie chun ama kutin Pa- thienin anni a sanhim ding ti a unauhaiin an hriet amanih a ta, nisienlakhawm, an hriet si nawh.

en: And the day following he appeared unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?
hmr: Chun, a zîngah anni laia mi pahni an insuol laiin an kuom a hung tlung a, ‘Puhai, unau in nih annâwm; iengdinga indiknawtakin in inthaw am?’ tiin anni rem a tum a.

en: But he that did his neighbor wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a ruolpa chunga a kawmawpa lem chun Mosie a nampei a, ‘Kan chungah rorêltu le hotuin tuin am a siem cheh a?

en: Wouldest thou kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian yesterday?
hmr: Zânita Aigupta mi i sukhlum ang khan, mi sukhlum i tum a ni maw?’ a ta.

en: And Moses fled at this saying, and became a sojourner in the land of Midian, where he begat two sons.
hmr: Chun, chu thu lei chun Mosie a tlân hmang a, Median ramah a thang zing a, chutaka chun naupasal pahni a nei a.

en: And when forty years were fulfilled, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.
hmr: Chun, kum sâwmli a tling hnungin Sinai tlâng thlalêrah chîmbukah meichawk lai vântirko pakhat a kuomah ân lâr a.

en: And when Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold, there came a voice of the Lord,
hmr: Chun, Mosiein a hmu chun, a thil hmu chu mak a ti êm a; chun, en dinga a va hnai laiin, Lalpa rawlin,

en: I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob. And Moses trembled, and durst not behold.
hmr: ‘Kei i thlatuhai Pathien ka nih, Abraham Pathien, Isak Pathien, Jakob Pathien chu,’ a lo tih a. Chuongchun, Mosie chu ân thin a, a en ngam ta nawh a.

en: And the Lord said unto him, Loose the shoes from thy feet: for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.
hmr: Chun, Lalpa chun a kuomah, ‘I kephaa inthawkin i kekawk kha sût rawh, i ngîrna hmun kha hnuoi inthieng a nih.

en: I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning, and I am come down to deliver them: and now come, I will send thee into Egypt.
hmr: Aiguptaa ka mi umhai chu an rimsikzie ka hmu zing a, anni sanhim dingin ka hung ṭum a nih. Hung ta, Aiguptaah tir ka ti che,’ a ta.

en: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge? him hath God sent to be both a ruler and a deliverer with the hand of the angel that appeared to him in the bush.
hmr: “Chu Mosie, ‘Hotu le rorêltu dingin tuin am a siem cheh a?’ tia an sêl chu, chîmbuka vântirko a kuoma inlâr khan a ṭhangpui a, Pathienin ama ngei chu hotu le sanhimtu ni fâwm dingin a tir a nih.

en: This man led them forth, having wrought wonders and signs in Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
hmr: Ama chun Aiguptaa dâm, Tuisuoriet Sena dâm, thlalêra dâm chun kum sâwmli sûngin thilmak le inchiknahai inhmutirin anni a ṭhuoi suok tah a.

en: This is that Moses, who said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall God raise up unto you from among your brethren, like unto me.
hmr: “Israel thlahai kuomah ‘Pa- thienin kei a mi siem ang hin, in unauhai laia mi zâwlnei pakhat siempêk a ti cheu,’ titu kha a nih, chu Mosie chu.

en: This is he that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel that spake to him in the mount Sinai, and with our fathers: who received living oracles to give unto us:
hmr: Ama chu thlalêra pungkhâwm- hai laia Sinai tlânga betu vântirko kuoma le ei thlatuhai kuoma um kha a nih; ama chu a mi pêk sâwng dinga thu hringhai latu kha a nih.

en: to whom our fathers would not be obedient, but thrust him from them, and turned back in their hearts unto Egypt,
hmr: Ei thlatuhai chun a thu an zâwm nuom nawh a, an sêl a, an lungrilhai chu Aigupta ram tieng a lêt nâwk tah a.

en: saying unto Aaron, Make us gods that shall go before us: for as for this Moses, who led us forth out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
hmr: Aron kuomah, ‘Kan hmaṭhuoitu dingin pathienhai mi siempêk rawh, Mosie Aiguptaa mi ṭhuoi suoktu hlak hi a chanchin kan hriet ta si nawh a,’ an ta.

en: And they made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.
hmr: Chun, chuonghai chun se- bâwngte lim an siem a, a lim chu ran thatin an biek a, anni kutsuok chunga chun an hlim tah a.

en: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, Did ye offer unto me slain beasts and sacrifices Forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathienin a nghat san a, vâna arasihai chibai an bûk theina dingin anni a ensan tah a; Zâwlnei Lekhabua, ‘Israel chihai, thlalêra khan kum sâwmli sûngin, Sa that le ran thatin kei in mi biek am a nih?

en: And ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, And the star of the god Rephan, The figures which ye made to worship them: And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.
hmr: Molok puon in le pathien Rephan arasi khawm chu, Chibai bûk dingin a lim in siemhai kha, In zâwm lem hlak a; Chuleiin, Babulon khaw khêl tieng Ṭhuoi hmang ka ti cheu,’ ti ziek ang khan.

en: Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he appointed who spake unto Moses, that he should make it according to the figure that he had seen.
hmr: “A lim a hmu anga siem dinga Mosie hriltuin a ruot ang khan, ei thlatuhaiin thlalêra khan inhriet- tirna puon in chu an nei a.

en: Which also our fathers, in their turn, brought in with Joshua when they entered on the possession of the nations, that God thrust out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;
hmr: Chu bawk chu ei thlatuhai thla nâwk khawmin an nei sâwng pei a, Pathienin ei thlatuhai hmaa Jentail a hnawt suokhai ram an hluo lai khan Josua lût ruolin an lûtpui a; David hung um chen khan chutaka chun a um ta zing a.

en: who found favor in the sight of God, and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.
hmr: Chu David chu Pathien mithmuin ditsak tlâkin a um a, Jakob Pathien ta dinga umna ding siempêk a hnih a.

en: But Solomon built him a house.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Solomonin in chu a bâwlpêk ta lem a.

en: Howbeit the Most High dwelleth not in houses made with hands; as saith the prophet,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Achunghnung- tak chu kuta bâwl inhaiah a um ngai nawh; zâwlnei chun:-

en: The heaven is my throne, And the earth the footstool of my feet: What manner of house will ye build me? saith the Lord: Or what is the place of my rest?
hmr: Lalpain, ‘Vân ka ṭhungpha a na, Hnuoi ka kepha innghatna a nih; In ieng angin am mi bâwlpêk in ta? Ka châwlna hmun khawm ieng am a na?

en: Did not my hand make all these things?
hmr: Keia kutin hieng thil iengkim hi ka siem naw am a nih? a tih, ti ziek ang khan.

en: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Spirit: as your fathers did, so do ye.
hmr: “Mi kâwmawhai, lungril le na tan nawhai, kumkhuoin Thlarau Inthieng hi in kal rawp el; in thlatuhai thaw ang pei khan in thaw hlak.

en: Which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute? and they killed them that showed before of the coming of the Righteous One; of whom ye have now become betrayers and murderers;
hmr: In thlatuhaiin zâwlnei lai an suknawmnat naw tu am an um a? Mi feltak hung ding thu hril lâwktuhai kha an sukhlum a; chun, Mi Takzet chu inmantirtu le thattuhai nangni tuhin in nih in sawnnaw.

en: ye who received the law as it was ordained by angels, and kept it not.
hmr: Vântirkohai ipêk sâwng Dân kha hmu zeta zâwm si lohai,” a ta.

en: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with their teeth.
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu an hrietin an lungril a khei tah a, Stephan chunga chun an ha an rawt a.

en: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chu Thla- rau Inthienga sip a na, vân tieng a en tlat a, Pathien ropuizie le Pathien changtienga Isu ngir a hmuh a,

en: and said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.
hmr: “Ngai ta u, vân inhawnghai ka hmuh a, Pathien changtienga Mi- hriem Naupa ngîr khawm ka hmuh,” a ta.

en: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed upon him with one accord;
hmr: Chun, anni chu rawl inring- takin an khêk a, an na an hip a, inthuruolin an thawh a.

en: and they cast him out of the city, and stoned him: and the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.
hmr: Khuoa inthawk chu an hnawt- suok a, lungin an dêng a. A hretuhai chun tlangvâl pakhat a hming Saula ke bula chun an puonhai an sie tâwl a.

en: And they stoned Stephen, calling upon the Lord, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.
hmr: Chuongchun, Stephanin, “Lal Isu, ka thlarau la rawh,” tia Lalpa a ko laiin lungin an dêng mur mur a.

en: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
hmr: Chun, a dingṭhaṭhuon a, rawl inringtakin a khêk a, “Lalpa, hi an thil suksuol hi an chungah maw inphurtir naw rawh,” a ta. Chu thu chu a hril zo phingleh a ininnghil tah a. Saula khawm chun a thi chu a remtih a.

en: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And there arose on that day a great persecution against the church which was in Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judæa and Samaria, except the apostles.
hmr: Chu ni chun, kohran Jerusalema umhai chu miin nasatakin an suknawmna phut tah a; chuongchun, tirkohai bak naw chu Judai le Samari ram khaw tinah an indar ta vawng a.

en: And devout men buried Stephen, and made great lamentation over him.
hmr: Chun, Pathien ngaisak tuhaiin amanih Stephan chu an phûm a, nasatakin an ṭap a.

en: But Saul laid waste the church, entering into every house, and dragging men and women committed them to prison.
hmr: Saula ruok chun kohranhai chu a suknawmna bêk bêk a, in tinah a lût a, a nuhmei a pasalin a hnûk dawk a, intângna inah a khum hlak.

en: They therefore that were scattered abroad went about preaching the word.
hmr: Chun, ân darhai chu khaw tinah an feh a, thu chu an hril pei a.

en: And Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed unto them the Christ.
hmr: Chun, Philip chu Samari khuoah a zu feh a, an kuomah Krista thu a khêk pui a.

en: And the multitudes gave heed with one accord unto the things that were spoken by Philip, when they heard, and saw the signs which he did.
hmr: Mipuihaiin a thu an hriet a, a thilmak thawhai an hmu chun Philip thu hril chu lungril hmunkhatin an ngaisak a,

en: For from many of those that had unclean spirits, they came out, crying with a loud voice: and many that were palsied, and that were lame, were healed.
hmr: khawhri inthiengnawhai chu mi tamtak an imanhai sûnga inthawkin rawl inringtaka khêka an suok leiin le, zeng le keinbai tamtak khawm an hung dam ta leiin.

en: And there was much joy in that city.
hmr: Chun, chu khuoa chun nasatakin an lâwm tah a.

en: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, who beforetime in the city used sorcery, and amazed the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:
hmr: Chun, a hming Simon, mi pakhat a um a; ama chun, chu khuoa chun dawi hmangin Samari khuoa mihai maktitakin a lo siem ta hlak a.

en: to whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is that power of God which is called Great.
hmr: Mi po po chun mi setaka inthawka ân laltak chenin, “Hi mipa hi Pathien thilthawtheina, ‘Ropui,’ an ti kha a ni hi,” tiin a thu an ngaisak tâwl hlak.

en: And they gave heed to him, because that of long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.
hmr: A dâwi hmangin sâwttak mak titaka a siem hlak leiin a thu an ngaisak a nih.

en: But when they believed Philip preaching good tidings concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chun Pathien ram chanchin ṭha le Isu Krista hming Chanchin Ṭha Philip hril chu an âwi phingleh, a nuhmei a pasalin baptisma an chang tah a.

en: And Simon also himself believed: and being baptized, he continued with Philip; and beholding signs and great miracles wrought, he was amazed.
hmr: Chun, Simon rau khawmin a âwi ve tah a, chun baptisma a chang zo chun, Philip kuomah a um zing a. Inchikna le thilmak nasatak thawa umhai chu a hmu veh a, mak a ti hle hlak a.

en: Now when the apostles that were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:
hmr: Chun, tirko Jerusalema umhai khan Samari khuoa mihaiin Pathien thu an awi ti an hrietin, an kuomah Peter le Johan chu an tir a.

en: who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Spirit:
hmr: Anni chu an zuk tlung chun Thlarau Inthieng an hmu theina dingin an ṭawngṭaipêk a.

en: for as yet it was fallen upon none of them: only they had been baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.
hmr: Chu hma chun anni laia tu chunga khawm a la tlung nawh; Lal Isu hmingin baptisma an chang chau a la nih.

en: Then laid they their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, an chungah an kut an innghat a, Thlarau Inthieng an hmu tah a.

en: Now when Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money,
hmr: Chun, tirkohai kut innghat leia Thlarau Inthieng pêk a nih ti Simonin a hmuh a,

en: saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay my hands, he may receive the Holy Spirit.
hmr: “Hi thuneina hi mi pe ve ro, tû chunga khawm kut kân nghatna taphawtin Thlarau Inthieng an hmu vena dingin,” tiin an kuomah tangka pêk a tum a.

en: But Peter said unto him, Thy silver perish with thee, because thou hast thought to obtain the gift of God with money.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peterin a kuomah, “I tangka hi nanga ruolin bohmang raw se, Pathien thilpêk tangka suma inchâwk i tum leiin.

en: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right before God.
hmr: Hieng thua hin i ṭhang ve nawh, chan khawm i nei bawk nawh; i lungril Pathien ngaiin a fel nawh.

en: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray the Lord, if perhaps the thought of thy heart shall be forgiven thee.
hmr: Chuleiin, i suol hi sim la, Lalpa kuomah ṭawngṭai rawh, chuongchun, i lungrila i ngaituo hi a ngaidam che rawi mawh.

en: For I see that thou art in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.
hmr: Thil khâkna mîta le, suol khuop thlûkna hmunah i um ti ka hriet a nih,” a ta.

en: And Simon answered and said, Pray ye for me to the Lord, that none of the things which ye have spoken come upon me.
hmr: Chun, Simonin, “In thil hril hi ka chunga iengkhawm a tlung nawna dingin nangnîn Lalpa kuomah mi ṭawngṭaipêk ro,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: They therefore, when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chun Lalpa thu chu an inhriettira an hril zoin, Jerusalemah an fe nâwk tah a; Samari rama mihai khaw tamtak kuomah Chanchin Ṭha chu an hril pei a.

en: But an angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza: the same is desert.
hmr: Chun, Lalpa vântirko pakhatin Philip chu a biek a, “Tho la, sim tienga Jerusalema inthawka Gaza zuk sun lampuia khan fe rawh, chu lampui chu thlalêra fe thleng a nih,” a ta.

en: And he arose and went: and behold, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship;
hmr: Chuongchun, a tho a, a fe tah a. Chun, ngai ta, Ethiopia rama mi pakhat, Ethiopia lalnu Kandaki hnuoia mitillâk inlaltak, a ro po po enkawltu, Jerusalemah Pathien be dingin a hang feh a.

en: and he was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.
hmr: A hung tieng chun a tawlailîra ṭhung pumin zâwlnei Isai lekhabu a tiem pei a.

en: And the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.
hmr: Chun, Thlarau chun Philip kuomah, “Saw tawlailîr saw va hnai la, va pâwl rawh,” a ta.

en: And Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?
hmr: Chun, Philip chu mitillâk kuoma chun a va tlân a, zâwlnei Isai lekhabu a tiem a hriet a, “I tiem kha a umzie i hriet am?” a ta.

en: And he said, How can I, except some one shall guide me? And he besought Philip to come up and sit with him.
hmr: Ama chun, “Tukhawmin an mi hrilfie naw chun, iengtin am hre thei ka ta?” a ta. Chun, a kuoma hung ṭhung dingin Philip chu a fiel tah a.

en: Now the passage of the scripture which he was reading was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; And as a lamb before his shearer is dumb, So he openeth not his mouth:
hmr: Pathien Lekha a tiem lai chu hi hi a nih:- “That dingin berâm angin ama chu an ṭhuoi a; Berâmtê a hmul vâwtu hmaa a to zing angin, Ama khawmin a bau a ka nawh;

en: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: His generation who shall declare? For his life is taken from the earth.
hmr: A tlâwm laiin a rorêlna chu lâkpêkin a um a; A thlahai chanchin tuin am hril tâng an ta? Khawvêla inthawkin a hringna an lâkpêk ta sih a,” ti hi.

en: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other?
hmr: Chun, mitillâk chun Philip a biek a, a kuomah, “Zâwlneiin hieng thu hi tû thu am a na a hril, ama thu am a ni, mi dang thu? kân dawn che,” a ta.

en: And Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this scripture, preached unto him Jesus.
hmr: Philip chun a hril a, chu Pathien Lekha Thu chu a bulah a phut a, a kuomah Isu thu a hril a.

en: And as they went on the way, they came unto a certain water; and the eunuch saith, Behold, here is water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?
hmr: Chun, lampuia an fe malamin tui ieng amanih an tlung a; chun, mitillâk chun, “En ta, hitaka hi tui a um, baptisma changna ding iengin am a mi hluo kher leh?” a ta.
[Chun, Philip chun, “I lungril po poa i ring chun, i chang thei,” a ta. Ama chun, “Isu Krista chu Pathien Naupa a ni ka ring,” a ta, a dawn a].

en: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.
hmr: Chun, tawlailîr chu ân ngîrtir a, an pahni chun, Philip le mitillâk chu tuia chun an zu feh a; chun, Philip chun ama chu a baptis tah a.

en: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip; and the eunuch saw him no more, for he went on his way rejoicing.
hmr: Tuia inthawk chu an hang suok phingleh, Lalpa Thlarau chun Philip chu a lâk hmang tah a; mitillâk chun ama chu a hmu nâwk ta nawh a, nisienlakhawm, hlimtakin a fe ta pei a.

en: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached the gospel to all the cities, till he came to Cæsarea.
hmr: Philip chu miin Azota khuoah an hmu nâwk tah a; chun, a fe thleng a, Kaisari khuo a tlung hmakhat chun, khaw tinah Chanchin Ṭha chu a hril pei a.

en: But Saul, yet breathing threatening and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,
hmr: Saula ruok chun, Lalpa in- chûktirhai a vau thu le that a tum thu chu a la sâksuok ta rawp a.

en: and asked of him letters to Damascus unto the synagogues, that if he found any that were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
hmr: Thiempu Laltak kuomah a fe a, Damaskaa inkhâwmna in po poa mihai kuoma pêk dingin lekha a hnih a, chu Lama mi chu tukhawm a hmu chun, nuhmei khawm, pasal khawm, Jerusalema khuop puma hung ṭhuoi theina dingin.

en: And as he journeyed, it came to pass that he drew nigh unto Damascus: and suddenly there shone round about him a light out of heaven:
hmr: Chun, a fe laiin, Damaska a tlung tâwmin, kârloin var vâna inthawkin a vêlah a hung var phut a.

en: and he fell upon the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
hmr: Chun, hnuoiah a tluh a, a kuomah, “Saula, Saula, nangin iengdinga i mi suknawmna am a na?” tiin rawl a hriet a.

en: And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest:
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Tû am i na, Lalpa?” a ta.

en: but rise, and enter into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.
hmr: Lalpa chun, “Isu i suknawmnat hi ka nih; nisienlakhawm, tho la, khuoah lût rawh, chuongchun, i thaw ding lo hril an ti che,” a ta.

en: And the men that journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing the voice, but beholding no man.
hmr: Chun, ama le fehai chu hril ding hre loin an ngir a, rawl chu an hriet a chu tukhawm an hmu si nawh.

en: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw nothing; and they led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.
hmr: Chun, Saula chu hnuoia inthawk chun a tho a; chun, a hang meng a, iengkhawm a hmu thei ta nawh a; chuongchun, a kutah an kei a, Damaskaa chun an ṭhuoi lût a.

en: And he was three days without sight, and did neither eat nor drink.
hmr: Ni thum khaw hmu loin a um a, iengkhawm a fâkin a dâwn nawh a.

en: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and the Lord said unto him in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, I am here, Lord.
hmr: Chun, Damaskaa chun inchûk- tir pakhat a hming Anania a um a. Lalpa chun a mang angin a kuomah, “Anania,” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Lalpa, en ta, hitaka hin ka um,” a ta.

en: And the Lord said unto him, Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judas for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus: for behold, he prayeth;
hmr: Lalpa chun a kuomah, “Tho la, kawtthlêr, ‘Tlûn’ an tia chun fe la, Juda inah, Tarsa khuoa mi, a hming Saula indawn suok rawh; ngai ta, a ṭawngṭai zing a nih,

en: and he hath seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.
hmr: a hming Anania mi pakhat lûta, a mit sukvar dingin a chunga kut innghatin a hmu tah,” a ta.

en: But Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard from many of this man, how much evil he did to thy saints at Jerusalem:
hmr: Chun, Anania chun, “Lalpa, chu mipa chu Jerusalema i mi inthieng- hai chunga a suksuol tamzie thu mi tamtak baua inthawkin ka hriet a nih.

en: and here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call upon thy name.
hmr: Hitaka khawm i hming lam taphawt chu khuop dingin thiempu lalhaia inthawkin thu a hmu zing annâwm,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles and kings, and the children of Israel:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Lalpa chun a kuomah, “Fe el rawh, Jentailhai, lalhai, Israel thlahai kuoma ka hming put lûtna dinga ka bêl ruot a nih.

en: for I will show him how many things he must suffer for my name’s sake.
hmr: Ka hming leiin rinum ieng anga nasa am a tuor ding a kuomah lân hriettir ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Ananias departed, and entered into the house; and laying his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus, who appeared unto thee in the way which thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mayest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, Anania chu a va feh a, ina chun a lût a; a chungah kut ân nghat a, “Unau Saula, i mit varna ding le Thlarau Inthieng sipa i um theina dingin, Lalpa, i hungna lampuia i kuoma inlâr Isu khan a mi hung tir a nih,” a ta.

en: And straightway there fell from his eyes as it were scales, and he received his sight; and he arose and was baptized;
hmr: Chun, kârloin a mita inthawk chun phuhlip ang ieng amanih a tla nghâl tah a, a mit a var nâwk tah a; chun, a tho a, baptisma a chang tah a.

en: and he took food and was strengthened. And he was certain days with the disciples that were at Damascus.
hmr: Chun, bu a fâk a, a har nâwk tah a. Chun, Damaskaa inchûktir umhai kuoma chun ni iengzat amanih a um a.

en: And straightway in the synagogues he proclaimed Jesus, that he is the Son of God.
hmr: Inkhâwmna inhaia chun Isu chu Pathien Naupa a nizie thu a khêkpui nghâl tah a.

en: And all that heard him were amazed, and said, Is not this he that in Jerusalem made havoc of them that called on this name? and he had come hither for this intent, that he might bring them bound before the chief priests.
hmr: Chun, a thu hretuhai po po chun mak an ti hleh a; “Hi mipa hi Jerusalema hi hming lamtuhai suknawmna hlaktu kha a ni naw am a nih? Chuong mihai chu thiempu lalhai kuoma khuop puma ṭhuoi, a hung san a ni kha,” an ta.

en: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews that dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.
hmr: Saula ruok chu a hung hrât nâwk zuol a, ama chu Krista a ni takzet ti a hrilfieh a, Damaskaa Juda umhai chu a sêldawng rawp hlak a.

en: And when many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel together to kill him:
hmr: Chun, ni sâwt tak hnunga chun Saula sukhlum dingin Judahai chu an inrawn a;

en: but their plot became known to Saul. And they watched the gates also day and night that they might kill him:
hmr: nisienlakhawm, ama chun an thurawt chu a lo hriet tah a. Sukhlum dingin kul kawtkhâr tina chun a sûn a zânin an inchân hlak a.

en: but his disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a închûktir- haiin ama chu an ṭhuoi a, zânah kul tukverah bâwmin an thlâk thla tah a.

en: And when he was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: and they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun Jerusalem a tlung phingleh inchûktirhai chu pâwl a tum a; anni ruok chun an rêngin ama chu an ṭih a, inchûktir a ni ve ti an ring nawh a.

en: But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how at Damascus he had preached boldly in the name of Jesus.
hmr: Barnaba ruok chun ama chu a ṭhuoi a, tirkohai kuoma chun a hungpui a, lampuia Lalpa a hmua a biekzie dâm, Damaskaa Isu hminga huoitaka a thu a hrilzie dâm khawm chu an kuomah a hril tah a.

en: And he was with them going in and going out at Jerusalem,
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chu Jeru- salema chun an kuoma lût hlak suok hlakin a um tah a, Lalpa hmingin huoitakin thu a hril hlak a.

en: preaching boldly in the name of the Lord: and he spake and disputed against the Grecian Jews; but they were seeking to kill him.
hmr: Chun, Grik ṭawng hmang Judahai lai thu a hril a, a sêl a; anni ruok chun ama chu sukhlum an tum a.

en: And when the brethren knew it, they brought him down to Cæsarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
hmr: Chun, unauhai chun chu chu an hrietin, Kaisari khuoah an ṭhuoi thlâk a, Tarsa khuoah an tir ta dai a.

en: So the church throughout all Judæa and Galilee and Samaria had peace, being edified; and, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, was multiplied.
hmr: Chuongchun, kohranhai chu Judai ram vêla dâm, Galili ram vêla dâm, Samari ram vêla dâm chun an det deu deu a, muongtakin an um tah a; chun, Lalpa ṭi dêkin, Thlarau Inthieng ithlamuongin an um a, an hung pung ta deu deu a.

en: And it came to pass, as Peter went throughout all parts, he came down also to the saints that dwelt at Lydda.
hmr: Chun, Peterin khawvêl a fang malamin, Ludda khuoa mi inthieng umhai kuomah a zu fe bawk a.

en: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had kept his bed eight years; for he was palsied.
hmr: Chutaka chun mi pakhat, a hming Ainia a zeng leia kum riet khuma zâl zing a hmuh a.

en: And Peter said unto him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ healeth thee: arise, and make thy bed. And straightway he arose.
hmr: Chun, Peter chun a kuomah, “Ainia, Isu Krista chun a sukdam che; tho la i puonpha ziel rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, a tho nghâl tah a.

en: And all that dwelt at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
hmr: Chun, Ludda khuo le Saron phaia um po pohai chun Ainia chu an hmuh a, Lalpa tieng an ngha tâwl tah a.

en: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.
hmr: Chun, Joppa khuoah a hming Tabitha, inchûktir pakhat a um a, (Tabitha umzie chu Dorka a nih); chu nuhmei chun thil thawṭhat le thilpêk a hau hleh a.

en: And it came to pass in those days, that she fell sick, and died: and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper chamber.
hmr: Chun, chuong lai chun a damnawh a, a thi tah a; chun an insil fai a, pindan chunghnungah an inzâl a.

en: And as Lydda was nigh unto Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men unto him, entreating him, Delay not to come on unto us.
hmr: Chun, Ludda khuo chu Joppa khaw kâwl a ni leiin, inchûktirhai chun Peter chutaka chun a um ti an hriet a, “Sâwt riel loin kan kuomah hung rawh,” tia ngên dingin a kuomah mi pahni an tir a.

en: And Peter arose and went with them. And when he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.
hmr: Chun, Peter chu a tho a, anni leh a fe ve tah a. Chun, a tlung phingleh pindan chunghnunga chun an ṭhuoi a; hmeithai po po chu a kâwla ngîrin, Dorka an kuoma a um laia a zakuo siemhai, a puon siemhai inentir pumin an ṭap tâwl a.

en: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes; and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Peter chun an rêngin ân suoktir vawng a, a dingṭhaṭhuon a, a ṭawngṭai tah a; chun, ruong tieng chu a nghah a, “Tabitha, tho rawh,” a ta. Chuong- chun, a mit a hung meng a, Peter chu a hmu phingleh a ṭhung tah a.

en: And he gave her his hand, and raised her up; and calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
hmr: Chun, Peter chun a kut a pêk a, a keitho tah a; chun, mi inthienghai le hmeithaihai chu a ko a, damin a khîkhmuh a.

en: And it became known throughout all Joppa: and many believed on the Lord.
hmr: Chun, chu chu Joppa khuo po po chun an hriet ta vawng a; mi tamtakin Lalpa chu an ring tah a.

en: And it came to pass, that he abode many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.
hmr: Chun, Peter chu ni tamtak Joppa khuoa Simon, savun siemtu inah a châm zing a.
